amendment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Improvement, reformation, change for the better.<BR><b>2. </b>Alteration, change, correction.

ford
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Wading place, shallow.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Stream, current, flood.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Wade through (<i>a river</i>), cross on foot, cross by wading.

scotch
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cut (<i>slightly</i>), wound (<i>superficially</i>), score, notch, scot, jag.<BR><b>2. </b>Stop (<i>as a wheel, to prevent it from rolling back</i>), block, prop, support.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Scottish.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Incision, cut, slit.

abandon
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Leave, relinquish, quit, forsake, desert, evacuate, drop, abjure, forswear, give over, cast off, retire from, withdraw from.<BR><b>2. </b>Surrender, cede, yield, resign, forego, renounce, waive, vacate, deliver up, give up, part with, let go, lay down, demit. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> abdicate.

abandoned
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Relinquished, deserted, forsaken, cast away, rejected, discarded, given up, given over, cast off, cast aside, thrown overboard, demitted.<BR><b>2. </b>Depraved, corrupted, corrupt, profligate, vicious, sinful, wicked, dissolute, reprobate, graceless, shameless, unprincipled, lost, obdurate, hardened, impenitent, incorrigible, irreclaimable, demoralized, lost to shame, dead to honor.

abandonment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abandoning, relinquishment, desertion, dereliction.<BR><b>2. </b>Renunciation, surrender, cession, resignation, abnegation, abjuration, rejection, demission. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> abdication.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Depress, detrude, lower, reduce, drop, sink, stoop, cast down, let down, throw down, let fall.<BR><b>2. </b>Degrade, humble, disgrace, dishonor, humiliate, debase, bring low, take down.

abash
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Shame, mortify, confuse, confound, disconcert, discompose, cow, humiliate, humble, snub, put to shame, make ashamed, put down, put out of countenance, take down, send away with a flea in one's ear. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> discountenance.

abate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lessen, diminish, decrease, reduce, lower, relax, slacken.<BR><b>2. </b>Remit, allow, bate, rebate, deduct.<BR><b>3. </b>Moderate, assuage, mitigate, soothe, soften, qualify, alleviate, mollify, allay, appease, pacify, compose, tranquillize, temper, attemper, quiet, quell, calm, dull, blunt.<BR><b>4. </b>Batter down, beat down, demolish, raze, lay low.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Remove, suppress, terminate, put an end to.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Decrease, diminish, lessen, subside, sink, wane, decline, fall away, fall off, fade, fade away, ebb, intermit, slacken.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Be defeated, frustrated, <i>or</i> overthrown, fail.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Diminution, decrease, decrement, lessening, mitigation, moderation, assuagement, extenuation, remission.<BR><b>2. </b>Subsidence, decline, lowering, sinking, settling, wane, fading, evanishing, evanishment, ebb.<BR><b>3. </b>Discount, allowance, rebate, deduction, reduction, drawback.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Shorten (<i>by cutting off</i>), curtail, reduce, contract, retrench, condense, compress, epitomize, cut short, cut down. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> abridge.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Shortening (<i>by cutting off</i>), curtailment, contraction, reduction, condensation, compression, brief, compend, compendium, abstract, epitome. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> abridgment.

abdicate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Resign (<i>an office</i> or <i>dignity</i>), surrender (<i>a right</i>), cede, forego, renounce, relinquish, abandon, quit, vacate, give up, part with, lay down, renounce all claim to.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Resign, relinquish office, (<i>especially that of a king</i>), vacate the throne, retire to private life, go into retirement.

abduct
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Take away (<i>surreptitiously</i> or <i>forcibly</i>, or both), kidnap, carry off, run away with, run off with, spirit away, drag away.

aberrant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deviating, wandering, rambling, diverging, divergent, devious, erratic, out of the right way.<BR><b>2. </b>Irregular, abnormal, unnatural, unusual, singular, peculiar, anomalous, unconformable, exceptional, strange, anomalistic, eccentric, erratic, out of the way, disconnected, inconsequent, idiotic, monstrous, preternatural.

aberration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deviation, divergence, wandering, rambling, departure.<BR><b>2. </b>Irregularity, eccentricity, singularity, peculiarity, strangeness, unconformity, anomaly, abnormity, monstrosity.<BR><b>3. </b>Illusion, delusion, hallucination, monomania, self deception.

Instigate (<i>to commit a crime</i>), stimulate, incite, foment.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stay, sojourn, tarry, lodge, rest, keep, take up one's quarters, pitch one's tent.<BR><b>2. </b>Dwell, reside, live, inhabit, settle, plant one's self, get a footing, get a foothold.<BR><b>3. </b>Remain, continue, persist, persevere, go on, keep on, be steadfast, be constant. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> subsist.<BR><b>4. </b>Endure, last, be enduring, be indestructible, be permanent, be immutable.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Await, attend, wait for, be in readiness for, be in store for.<BR><b>2. </b>Endure, tolerate, bear, brook, suffer, bear with, put up with, sustain.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Power (<i>to execute anything</i>), ableness, force, potency, might, vigor, efficiency, efficacy, strength, energy, skill, skilfulness, dexterity, address, adroitness, cleverness, ingenuity, talent, aptitude, aptness, knack, expertness, facility, quickness, readiness.<BR><b>2. </b>Qualification, competency, sufficiency.<BR><b>3. </b>Capability, capableness, faculty, gift, parts, genius, endowment, calibre, forte, turn. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> capacity.

abrupt
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Broken, cragged, craggy, rough, rugged, jagged.<BR><b>2. </b>Steep, precipitous, acclivous, acclivitous.<BR><b>3. </b>Sudden, unexpected, unanticipated, precipitate, hasty, unseasonable, ill timed, unlooked for, unannounced.<BR><b>4. </b>Short, blunt, unceremonious, curt, brusk (<i>or</i> brusque), rude, rough, inconsiderate, uncomplaisant, discourteous.<BR><b>5. </b>Inelegant (<i>as style</i>), stiff, cramped, harsh, disconnected, unconnected.

absolute

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abstaining, fasting.<BR><b>2. </b>Abstemious, sober, temperate, self restraining, self denying, not indulgent of appetites.

abstract
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Separate, disunite, disjoin, dissociate, isolate, detach, disengage, take out of context, take out of its proper whole, view partially, view one sidedly, regard without reference to relations, consider in bare thought, think without the definiteness of sense perception, think vaguely.<BR><b>2. </b>Take, seize, appropriate, steal, purloin.<BR><b>3. </b>Abridge, abbreviate, epitomize, make an abstract of, outline, make synopsis of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR><b>1. </b>Separate, isolated, not concrete, out of context, unrelated, simple, by itself, <i>per se</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Occult, recondite, subtile, refined, abstracted, vague. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> abstruse.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Abridgment, epitome, summary, conspectus, compend, compendium, synopsis, syllabus, outline, digest, brief, breviary, sum and substance, concise statement, gist, drift, general contents.

abundant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Abounding, flowing, overflowing, plentiful, plenteous, copious, much, exuberant, luxuriant, replete, full, large, ample, good, liberal, bountiful, lavish, rich, teeming, thick.

abuse
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Misuse, misemploy, misapply, pervert, prostitute, desecrate, dishonor, profane, pollute, make an ill use of, deceive, impose on, betray, cajole, seduce by cajolery.<BR><b>2. </b>Maltreat, harm, injure, hurt, ill treat, ill use.<BR><b>3. </b>Revile, reproach, vilify, slander, traduce, defame, asperse, inveigh against, carp at, malign, blacken, disparage, berate, rate, betongue, upbraid, calumniate, lampoon, satirize, lash, <i>pasquinade</i>, rail at, sneer at, speak ill of, calumniate, treat with contumely, pour contumely on. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> vituperate.<BR><b>4. </b>Violate, outrage, ravish, deflour.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Misapplication, misuse, misemployment, dishonor, dishonoring, profanation, prostitution, desecration, pollution, perversion, ill use.<BR><b>2. </b>Maltreatment, outrage, ill treatment, bad treatment.<BR><b>3. </b>Corrupt practice, malfeasance, malversation.<BR><b>4. </b>Vituperation, railing, reviling, vilification, defamation, aspersion, disparagement, rating, upbraiding, contumely, obloquy, opprobrium, insult, scurrility, ribaldry, foul invective, rude reproach, billingsgate.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Same as Accessary.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Confederate. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> accessary.<BR><b>2. </b>Accompaniment, attendant, concomitant. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> accessary, 2.

accident
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Casualty, chance, fortuity, mischance, misadventure, calamity, mishap, miscarriage, misfortune, hap, hazard, contingency, unforeseen <i>or</i> fortuitous event. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> contretemps.<BR><b>2. </b>Property, quality, modification, affection, mode, condition, state, change, alteration, attribute, contingent attribute, modalization.

accidental
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Casual, fortuitous, contingent, that happens by chance, not designed, not planned, unintended, chance, undesigned, not purposed.<BR><b>2. </b>Incidental, adventitious, non essential, immaterial, dispensable, not absolutely requisite, <i>de facto</i> but not <i>de jure</i>, that has merely happened to be.

acclaim
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> acclamation.

acclimate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Acclimatize, inure <i>or</i> habituate to a climate.

accommodate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oblige, serve, supply, furnish, do a service for, supply the wants of, minister to the convenience of, make comfortable, contain, hold, furnish room for.<BR><b>2. </b>Fit, suit, adapt, make conform, make conformable, make consistent, make correspond.<BR><b>3. </b>Reconcile, adjust, settle, compose, harmonize.

accompaniment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Appendage, concomitant, attendant, adjunct, attachment, appurtenance.

accompany
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Attend, escort, convoy, follow, wait on, be associated with, keep company with, go with, go along with, consort with, go hand in hand with.

accomplice
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Confederate, accessary, abettor, associate (<i>in a crime</i>). <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> socius criminis.

accomplish
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Complete, achieve, effect, execute, perform, do, consummate, compass, carry, carry into effect, carry through, carry out, get through, bring about, work out, turn out, turn off.<BR><b>2. </b>Finish, end, conclude, terminate.<BR><b>3. </b>Fulfil, realize, effectuate, bring to pass.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Equip, furnish, supply.

accomplished
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Instructed, educated, practised, experienced, finished, consummate, ripe, thorough bred, versed, qualified, proficient, able, clever, apt, adroit, expert, skilful.<BR><b>2. </b>Polished, refined, polite, elegant, fashionable, fine.

accomplishment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Completion, performance, execution, achievement, consummation, fulfilment. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> accomplish.<BR><b>2. </b>Acquirement, attainment, proficiency, stock of knowledge, mental resources, embellishment (<i>of mind</i> and <i>manners</i>), ornamental acquisition, ornament, adornment, grace.

accord
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Grant, concede, yield, give, allow, vouchsafe, deign.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Harmonize, correspond, agree, tally, quadrate, be in unison, be harmonious, square.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Accordance, agreement, <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> next.

accost
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Come alongside, confront, approach, draw near, address, salute, greet, speak to, make up to.

account
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Record, register, inventory, score.<BR><b>2. </b>Bill, charge, registry of debt and credit.<BR><b>3. </b>Reckoning, computation, calculation, enumeration, tale, count.<BR><b>4. </b>Description, statement, narration, recital, rehearsal, relation, narrative, chronicle, history, delineation, representation, portrayal, detail, word, tidings, report.<BR><b>5. </b>Explanation, exposition, clearing up, elucidation, exhibition of causes, reference to grounds, exploration into principles, philosophy.<BR><b>6. </b>Consideration, regard, motive, reason, ground, sake.<BR><b>7. </b>Consequence, importance, worth, distinction, dignity, repute, reputation, note.<BR><b>8. </b>Profit, advantage. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> benefit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Esteem, regard, deem, judge, believe, take for, think, hold, consider, view, reckon, rate, estimate, look upon.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> [With <i>with</i> or <i>to</i> before persons, and <i>for</i> before things.]<BR><b>1. </b>Render an account, answer in judgment, answer responsibly.<BR><b>2. </b>Explain, elucidate, expound, trace to causes, give the philosophy of, clear up, exhibit the grounds, give a reason, show the reason, render a reason, assign the cause, make explanation of.

accountability
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Accountableness, responsibility, liability, obligation, bond of duty, the having to answer for, amenability.

accountant
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Book keeper, expert in accounts.

accredit
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Credit, give trust <i>or</i> confidence to, give credit <i>or</i> honor to, receive as an envoy, receive as commissioned, empowered, <i>or</i> authorized, authorize, empower, commission, depute, send with credentials.

accretion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Growth (<i>by accession of parts</i>), accumulation, increase by adhesion.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Growing together, adhesion.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Gradual accumulation (<i>of soil, as at the mouth of a river</i>).

accrue
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Result, proceed, come, arise, issue, follow, flow, ensue, be added, be derived, be gained, be got, come in, accumulate (intrans.).

accumulate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pile, amass, aggregate, collect, collect together, gather up, pile up, heap up, bring together, heap together, scrape together.<BR><b>2. </b>Store, garner, husband, treasure up, garner up, lay up, lay by, lay in, set by. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> hoard.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Increase, grow, be accumulated, be heaped up, accrue.

accumulation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Collection, pile, heap, aggregation, mass, accretion, amount accrued, store, hoard, hoarding.

accuracy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Accurateness, exactness, exactitude, correctness, precision, niceness, nicety, truth, accurateness, fidelity, faithfulness, carefulness, correctness, closeness, strictness.

accurate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Exact, correct, precise, true, truthful, faithful, strict, close, rigorous, severe, just, nice, unerring.

accusation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Crimination, impeachment, arraignment, indictment, charge. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> accuse.

accuse
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Charge, impeach, arraign, indict, criminate, incriminate, inculpate, tax, inform against, call to account, take to task, blame, censure.

accustom
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Habituate, inure, use, harden, familiarize, train, discipline, drill, break in. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> addict.

accustomed
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Usual, habitual, wonted, habituated, customary, familiar, common, frequent, regular, ordinary, every day.

acerbity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sourness, astringency, roughness, acidity, acidness, tartness, acridity, acridness, bitterness.<BR><b>2. </b>Acrimony, acrimoniousness, severity, harshness, sternness, asperity, bitterness, venom, rancor, crabbedness, churlishness, moroseness, sullenness, ill temper.

achieve
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Accomplish, perform, execute, do, complete, finish, compass, consummate, effect, realize, bring about, bring to pass, carry through, carry out, work out, bring to a close, bring to conclusion, bring to consummation <i>or</i> perfection, actualize.<BR><b>2. </b>Obtain, acquire, procure, gain, win, get.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Performance, accomplishment, completion, attainment, realization, consummation.<BR><b>2. </b>Exploit, feat, deed, work.<BR><b>3. </b>Escutcheon, shield, ensign armorial.

achromatic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Colorless, uncolored, untinged, hueless, free from color, perfectly transparent.

acid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Sour, tart, sharp, pricking, stinging, pungent.

acidity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Acidness, sourness, tartness, sharpness.

acknowledge
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Recognize, take cognizance of, be aware of, hold in remembrance.<BR><b>2. </b>Admit, grant, concede, allow, accept, indorse, subscribe to, agree to.<BR><b>3. </b>Confess, own, avow, profess.<BR><b>4. </b>Express gratitude for, give thanks for.<BR><b>5. </b>Own <i>or</i> admit the validity of.

acme
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Summit, top, apex, vertex, zenith, peak, pinnacle, utmost height, highest point, culmination, culminating point, climax.

acquaint
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Familiarize, make familiar.<BR><b>2. </b>Inform, apprise, tell, notify, make aware, make known to, mention to, communicate to, signify to, give notice to, send word to, write word to, advise of, advertise of, send advices to.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Familiarity, familiar knowledge.<BR><b>2. </b>Friend (<i>with whom one is not intimate</i>), circle known, visiting circle, round of one's social intercourse, person <i>or</i> persons known.

acquiesce
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Yield, comply, submit, bow, rest, resign one's self, be reconciled, be resigned, be satisfied, rest satisfied, repose, rest content.<BR><b>2. </b>Assent, consent, agree, accede, concur, yield assent, give consent, fall in, go with the stream, go with the current.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compliance, submission, resignation, satisfaction, contentment.<BR><b>2. </b>Assent, consent, agreement, concurrence.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> acquirement.

acrid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sharp, biting, pungent, hot, burning, poignant, caustic, corrosive, bitter.<BR><b>2. </b>Severe, harsh. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> acrimonious.

acrimonious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Corrosive, caustic, sharp.<BR><b>2. </b>Severe, harsh, hard, acrid, sarcastic, bitter, virulent, malignant, censorious, crabbed, snarling, snappish, testy, pettish, petulant, cross, sour, tart, splenetic, peevish, ill tempered, ill natured, rancorous, spiteful, envenomed, galling, grinding, biting, mordacious.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sharpness, corrosiveness, causticity.<BR><b>2. </b>Severity, harshness, hardness, sourness, tartness, acridity, acridness, asperity, virulence, bitterness, acerbity, rancor, venom, crabbedness, moroseness, churlishness, ill temper, spite, spitefulness, abusiveness.

acrobat
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Rope dancer, funambulist, highvaulter, lofty tumbler, flying trapezist, aerial athlete, equilibrist, aerosaltant.

actual
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Real, veritable, true, substantial, objective, determinate, decided, categorical, positive, absolute, certain, genuine, very, not merely imagined, not imaginary, not merely supposed or fancied, not fictitious, that exists in deed and in truth, <i>de jure</i> as well as <i>de facto</i>, ideal (<i>in pregnant sense</i>), really ideal, ideally real, <i>bona fide</i>, thorough, thoroughgoing, in entelechy, entelechic.<BR><b>2. </b>Present, now existing, now in being, sensibly real, sensible, perceptible, <i>de facto</i>, in hard fact, at this moment, here and now, just this present, un ideal, in act, <i>in actu</i>, in process, energizing, energic, in energy.

actually
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Really, truly, absolutely, positively, verily, indeed, in fact, in reality, as a matter of fact, in truth. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> actual.

actuate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Induce, impel, move, prompt, instigate, persuade, incite, act upon, prevail upon, work upon, urge, drive, dispose, incline.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Acuteness, shrewdness, sagacity, astuteness, sharpness, ingenuity, perspicacity, discernment, penetration, mother wit, quick parts.

acute
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sharp, pointed, acuminate, cuspidate.<BR><b>2. </b>Keen, shrewd, discerning, knowing, quick, sharp, smart, bright, sage, sagacious, intelligent, astute, ingenious, subtle, penetrating, piercing, clear sighted, sharp witted, long headed.<BR><b>3. </b>Severe, violent, intense, poignant, distressing, fierce, piercing, exquisite, pungent.<BR><b>4. </b>High, shrill, high toned.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Sudden, violent, temporary, limited, not chronic.

adage
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Proverb, saying, saw, dictum, aphorism, apothegm, maxim, by word, sententious precept.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Diamond, crystallized carbon, infrangible mineral, indestructible stone, eternal rock.

adapt
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Adjust, accommodate, suit, proportion, qualify, prepare, fit, temper, fashion, match, make, conform, make conformable <i>or</i> suitable.

additive

addle
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Addled, spoiled (<i>as eggs</i>), rotten, putrid, corrupt.<BR><b>2. </b>Barren, unfruitful, fruitless, abortive, unproductive, unprolific, unfertile, sterile, infecund, addled.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Corrupt, spoil, render barren. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> preceding.<BR><b>2. </b>Accumulate gradually, earn, lay up, save.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Direct (<i>words, etc</i>.), accost, speak to, apply to, invoke, court, pay court to, make suit to, direct (<i>a letter, etc</i>.), indite, consign.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Appeal, invocation, petition, entreaty, request, imploration, application, solicitation, suit.<BR><b>2. </b>Discourse, speech, oration, harangue.<BR><b>3. </b>Skill, art, adroitness, readiness, dexterity, expertness, cleverness, ingenuity, ability, tact, management.<BR><b>4. </b>Superscription, direction.<BR><b>5. </b>Manner (<i>in speaking to another</i>).<BR><b>6. </b>Place by the post <i>or</i> mail, post office, place for receiving correspondence.

adjust
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Arrange, dispose, rectify, trim, put <i>or</i> set in order, put <i>or</i> set to rights, put in tune, put in good <i>or</i> proper trim.<BR><b>2. </b>Regulate, set.<BR><b>3. </b>Settle, compose, pacify, reconcile, make up.<BR><b>4. </b>Fit, adapt, suit, proportion, accommodate, measure, make conform, make conformable (followed by <i>to</i> or <i>with</i>).

adjustment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Arrangement, adjusting, putting in order, putting in good trim, setting to rights, disposal.<BR><b>2. </b>Regulation, setting, putting right, state of regulation, good order, accurate arrangement.<BR><b>3. </b>Settlement, reconciliation, pacification, agreement, understanding, mutual understanding.<BR><b>4. </b>Fitting, adapting, accommodation, making suitable <i>or</i> conformable, conformity, suitedness.

administer
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dispense, give, distribute, supply, contribute, deal out, give out, afford, furnish.<BR><b>2. </b>Direct, manage, conduct, control, superintend, preside over.<BR><b>3. </b>Tender, offer, proffer.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Contribute, conduce, be helpful. [With <i>to</i>.]<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Act as administrator. [With <i>upon</i>.]

administration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dispensation, distribution, giving.<BR><b>2. </b>Management, conduct, direction, control, superintendence.<BR><b>3. </b>Executive department (<i>of a government</i>), President (or <i>other chief magistrate</i>) and cabinet, the Government, the ministry, the cabinet.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Management of an estate (<i>of an intestate</i>).

admiration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Wonder, surprise, astonishment, amazement.<BR><b>2. </b>Liking, love, high regard, high opinion.

admire
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Wonder at, be surprised at, be astonished <i>or</i> amazed at.<BR><b>2. </b>Esteem great, regard with pleasure, think fine, count brilliant, like much, think highly of, have a high opinion of, prize <i>or</i> value highly.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>(<i>Rare</i>.) Wonder, marvel, be surprised <i>or</i> astonished.

admission
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Admittance, introduction, access, entrance, initiation, <i>entree</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Allowance, avowal, concession, acknowledgment, assent, acceptance.

admit
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Receive, grant entrance to, let in, take in, open the door to, give access to.<BR><b>2. </b>Concede, accept, grant, acknowledge, own, confess, take for granted, agree to, accede to, acquiesce in.<BR><b>3. </b>Permit, allow, bear, admit of, be capable of.

admonish
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reprove (<i>gently</i>), censure, warn of a fault, rebuke.<BR><b>2. </b>Advise, counsel, caution, forewarn, warn, enjoin.<BR><b>3. </b>Instruct, inform, teach, apprise, acquaint, notify, make acquainted, make aware, remind.

adolescent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Youthful, juvenile, young, growing, in the teens, etc. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> adolescence.

adopt

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Atmosphere, atmospheric air, common air.<BR><b>2. </b>Gas, aeriform fluid.<BR><b>3. </b>Breeze, zephyr, gentle wind, breath of air, current of air.<BR><b>4. </b>Weather, open air, open atmosphere.<BR><b>5. </b>Appearance, aspect, mien, manner, look, cast, demeanor, conduct, carriage, bearing, deportment, behavior, port.<BR><b>6. </b>Tune, melody, song, treble <i>or</i> soprano, poem.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Expose to air, ventilate, change the air of.<BR><b>2. </b>Expose, display, spread abroad, make ostentation of.

ajar
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Partly open (<i>as a door</i>), on the turn.

akin
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Kin, related, allied, kindred, cognate, of one blood, of the same stock, consanguineous, consanguineal.<BR><b>2. </b>Similar, congenial, analogous, parallel, like, corresponding, of a piece, cognate, connected, related.

alacrity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Readiness, promptitude, eagerness, alertness, agility, activity, quickness.<BR><b>2. </b>Sprightliness, gayety, cheerfulness, hilarity, vivacity, liveliness, high spirits, good spirits.

albeit
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Although, notwithstanding.

alchemy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>alchymy</b>)</b><BR> Magic, black, art, thaumaturgy.

alcove
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Recess.

alert
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Watchful, vigilant, circumspect, wary, heedful, on the alert, on one's guard, on the watch, on the lookout, on the <i>qui vive</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Active, brisk, nimble, agile, smart, lively, sprightly, spirited, supple, quick, ready, prompt. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> spry.

alias
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Otherwise.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Assumed name.

alien
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foreign, not native, not naturalized.<BR><b>2. </b>Estranged, differing, remote, unallied, separated, unconnected, strange, inappropriate, irrelevant, not pertinent.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Foreigner, stranger.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abalienate, transfer, demise, consign, assign, convey, devolve, make over, deliver over.<BR><b>2. </b>Estrange, disaffect, wean, withdraw the affections of, make unfriendly.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abalienation, transfer, demise, conveyance.<BR><b>2. </b>Estrangement, disaffection, variance, division, rupture, breach.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Similar, like, resembling, resemblant, analogous, allied, equal, of a piece.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> Equally, in the same manner, form, <i>or</i> degree, together, in common, both. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> akin.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Alimental, nourishing, nutritious, nutritive.

allay

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Permission, leave, license, permit, authorization, connivance, sanction, authority, approval, approbation, sufferance.<BR><b>2. </b>Admission, acknowledgment, concession, assent.<BR><b>3. </b>Grant for support, stated maintenance, commission.<BR><b>4. </b>Qualification, modification, extenuation, limitation, exception.<BR><b>5. </b>Ration, stated quantity (<i>of food</i> or <i>drink</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Put upon allowance, limit in the supply of food.

alloy
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Combination (<i>of metals</i>), metallic compound, amalgam (<i>in case mercury is one metal</i>), alloyage.<BR><b>2. </b>Baser metal (<i>mixed with finer</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Baser element <i>or</i> ingredient (<i>in anything</i>), admixture, adulteration, deterioration, diminution, decrement, drawback, depreciation, impairment, debasement, detraction, disparagement.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Admix (<i>a metal with a baser</i>), reduce the value, debase.<BR><b>2. </b>Admix, deteriorate, etc. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> preceding noun.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Malignity, virulence, bitterness, rancor, hostility, hatred, hate, enmity, grudge, rankling, spleen, ill will, heart burning, violent hatred, active enmity, persistent hostility.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Lat.]<BR><b>1. </b>Hostile feeling, malice, partisan feeling, intention, purpose, aim.<BR><b>2. </b>Disposition, spirit, temper, general tone, tone of mind.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun plural</span><BR>  Records (<i>in the order of years</i>), chronicles, registers, rolls, archives, historical accounts.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Temper (<i>as glass, by slow cooling</i>), toughen.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Publish, proclaim, blazon, promulgate, declare, report, trumpet, advertise, communicate, set forth, give out, blaze abroad, noise abroad, herald abroad, spread abroad, give notice of, make proclamation of, lay before the public, bring to the notice of the public.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Molest, trouble, vex, wound, pain, plague, worry, irritate, fret, chafe, incommode, disturb, disquiet, pester, bother, tease, infest, embarrass, harass, harry, hector, badger.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Yearly, occurring once a year, occurring every year, lasting a year, recurring with the year, anniversary.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Yearly publication, year book, yearly record, yearly report, yearly transactions, annals (<i>of science</i> or <i>letters</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Plant living but a year.

annually
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Yearly, by the year, every year, once a year, year by year, <i>per annum</i>.

annul
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cancel, abrogate, repeal, revoke, recall, countermand, reverse, rescind, abolish, disannul, vacate, quash, nullify, supersede, invalidate, overrule, make void, set aside.<BR><b>2. </b>Reduce to nought, obliterate. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> annihilate.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> approbation.

approve
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Commend, recommend, praise like, appreciate, value, prize, think well <i>or</i> favorably of, think highly of, speak well of, be pleased with.<BR><b>2. </b>Sanction, confirm, justify, ratify, uphold sustain, make valid, assent <i>or</i> consent to, concur in, indorse.

approximate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Proximate, approaching coming near. [Followed by <i>to</i>.]<BR><b>2. </b>Nearly correct, nearly accurate <i>or</i> true, inexact, almost exact.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> (<i>Rare</i>.) Bring near, cause to approach.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Approach, come near, closely resemble, nearly rival.

approximately
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Near, nearly, about, not fa from.

apropos
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[Fr.] Opportune, seasonable, timely, fit, suitable, apt, pat (<i>colloq.</i>), to the point, to the purpose, just the thing, quite the thing. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> apposite.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Opportunely, seasonably, to the purpose, etc. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> preceding.<BR><b>2. </b>By the way, by the bye, speaking of that, that reminds me, while the matter's up, in that connection.

apt
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Apposite, pertinent, suitable, fit, fitting, meet, befitting, germane, applicable, appropriate, felicitous, <i>apropos</i>, to the point, to the purpose.<BR><b>2. </b>Inclined, liable, prone, disposed.<BR><b>3. </b>Quick, sharp, ready, prompt, expert, dexterous, able, clever, happy, adroit, handy, skilful.

aptitude
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Turn, disposition, genius, gift, knack, endowment, talent, faculty, capacity, capableness, tendency, inclination, bent, bias, proclivity, proneness, propensity, forte, aptness.<BR><b>2. </b>Readiness (<i>at learning</i>), quickness, cleverness, ability, aptness.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  On <i>or</i> in the water, water (<i>as water vegetation</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Hooked, (<i>like an eagle's beak; applied especially to the nose</i>), bent, curved, curving, hooked.

aristocratic

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affirm, declare, maintain, pronounce, express, say, aver, allege, asseverate, protest, avouch, avow, predicate, lay down.<BR><b>2. </b>Vindicate, defend, claim, maintain, uphold, put forward, insist upon, press, emphasize, make felt.

assertion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affirmation, declaration, asseveration, protestation, position, statement, word, averment, allegation, predication, remark.<BR><b>2. </b>Vindication, defence, maintenance, support, pressing, emphasizing, insistence on.

assertive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Positive, decided, confident, unconditional, peremptory.

assess
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Tax, charge with one's share, assign one's share to, impose one's share on.<BR><b>2. </b>Value, appraise, compute, estimate, rate.<BR><b>3. </b>Fix, assign, determine, impose.

assessment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Assessing, valuation.<BR><b>2. </b>Tax, impost, charge, rate.

assiduous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Industrious, sedulous, diligent, indefatigable, notable, active, busy, untiring, unwearied, unremitting, unintermitting, persevering, persistent, constant, patient, devoted, careful, attentive, laborious, studious, zealous, nevertiring, tireless, painstaking.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Appointment, allotment, apportionment.<BR><b>2. </b>Designation, specification, fixing, determination.<BR><b>3. </b>Offer, offering, showing, giving, presentation, alleging, adducing.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Law</i>) Transfer, conveyance.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Make like, bring into resemblance.<BR><b>2. </b>Digest, turn to one's own substance, take into the organism, thoroughly appropriate, absorb into the system, incorporate, make part and parcel of one's being.

assist
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Help, aid, support, befriend, patronize, serve, speed, second, further, promote, abet, back, sustain, subsidize, co operate with, take part with, give support to, minister to.<BR><b>2. </b>Succor, relieve, aid, give alms to.<BR><b>3. </b>Alternate with, relieve, spell.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Help, aid, succor, furtherance, support, patronage, lift, helping hand, good offices.<BR><b>2. </b>Alms, aid, succor, relief, help, lift.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Coadjutor, helper, aider, co operator, co aid, ally, auxiliary, abettor, adjuvant, collaborator, <i>collaborateur</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Subordinate, subaltern, aid, clerk, under worker, agent, underling.

associate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Join, conjoin, unite, connect, combine, affiliate, yoke, couple, link, bring into close relation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Fraternize, sort, consort, keep company, be in familiar intercourse.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Companion, mate, fellow, yoke fellow, comrade, peer, compeer, follower, consort.<BR><b>2. </b>Partner, copartner, coadjutor, confederate, ally. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> colleague.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Mitigate, moderate, appease, soothe, soften, mollify, pacify, compose, tranquillize, quiet, still, quell, allay, abate, temper, attemper, lessen, qualify, relieve, ease, dull, blunt, lull. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> alleviate.

assume
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Take, undertake, take on, take upon one's self, be willing to bear, become responsible for.<BR><b>2. </b>Affect, feign, counterfeit, simulate, pretend to, put on.<BR><b>3. </b>Arrogate, usurp, claim unduly, make unjust pretensions to.<BR><b>4. </b>Beg, suppose, presuppose, imply, consider as true, take for granted.

assuming
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Presuming, presumptuous, forward, audacious, bold, shameless, frontless, unblushing, brazen, brazen faced.<BR><b>2. </b>Arrogant, proud, lofty, haughty, supercilious, overbearing, overweening, conceited, consequential, self conceited, self sufficient. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> arrogant.

assumption
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Assuming, taking, taking on, taking up, accepting, becoming responsible for.<BR><b>2. </b>Assuming, arrogating, usurpation.<BR><b>3. </b>Presumption, supposition, conjecture, hypothesis, postulate, theory.<BR><b>4. </b>Haughtiness, loftiness, superciliousness, lordliness, stateliness, conceit, pride, conceitedness, self conceit, self importance, vain glory, insolence, <i>hauteur</i>. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> arrogance.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Make certain <i>or</i> sure, free from doubt <i>or</i> uncertainty.<BR><b>2. </b>Embolden, encourage, enhearten, hearten, make confident.<BR><b>3. </b>Declare to (<i>confidently and earnestly</i>), vouch to, vow to, protest to, aver to, solemnly promise, pledge, guarantee, warrant.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Insure, agree to indemnify for loss, secure against loss.

austere
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rough (<i>to the taste</i>), sour, <i>and</i> astringent.<BR><b>2. </b>Severe, rigid, strict, formal, stiff, rigorous, harsh, stern, difficult, hard, uncompromising, unrelenting, relentless, ascetic, straight laced.

austerity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Severity, rigor, sternness, harshness, asceticism, rigidity, rigidness, strictness, formality, stiffness, inflexibility.

authentic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Genuine, real, true, veritable, pure, uncorrupted, unadulterated, not false, not spurious, not fictitious, not apocryphal, what it purports to be.<BR><b>2. </b>Trustworthy, reliable, authoritative, veritable, true, accurate, according to the facts, accordant with fact, not garbled, not tampered with, from competent and trustworthy sources, from the original data, that cannot be questioned, of approved authority, to be depended on, worthy of belief.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Verify, seal, attest, give credit <i>or</i> validity to, prove to be genuine.

authoritative
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Official, commanding, imperative, by authority, <i>ex cathedra</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Dictatorial, imperious, magisterial, oracular, peremptory, dogmatic. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> arrogant.

authority
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Power, sovereignty, dominion, empire, government.<BR><b>2. </b>Rule, sway, ascendency, supremacy, control, influence, interest.<BR><b>3. </b>Permission, warrant, warranty, liberty, permit, precept, order, authorization, sanction.<BR><b>4. </b>Witness, testimony.<BR><b>5. </b>Credibility, weight of evidence.<BR><b>6. </b>Respectability, dignity, weight of character.<BR><b>7. </b>Person of commanding knowledge, leading expert, <i>connoisseur</i>, master, master mind.

authorize

autocrat

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Aiding, helping, assisting, ancillary, subsidiary, helpful.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Helper, assistant, coadjutor, adjuvant, co operative, ally, confederate. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> accessory.

available
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>To be availed of, to be turned to account.<BR><b>2. </b>Serviceable, useful, profitable, advantageous, beneficial.<BR><b>3. </b>Suitable <i>or</i> fit (<i>for some purpose</i>), likely to answer the end.

avarice
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Cupidity, covetousness, sordidness, graspingness.

avaricious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Grasping, greedy (of gain), sordid, close, close fisted, hard fisted, eager for gain (<i>for the sake of hoarding it</i>). <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> covetous.

avenge
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Take satisfaction for, award just punishment for.<BR><b>2. </b>Revenge, vindicate (<i>by punishment of an offender</i>), inflict punishment in behalf of.

avenue
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Passage, entrance, entry, access, way of approach, passage way. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> under access.<BR><b>2. </b>Alley, walk, street, road, path.<BR><b>3. </b>Channel, route, way, pass.

aver
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Assert, declare, asseverate, protest, avouch, allege, say, pronounce, predicate. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> affirm.

average
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Medium, mean proportion, medial sum <i>or</i> quantity.<BR><b>2. </b>Mediocrity, medium grade, mean standard.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Equate, reduce to an average, reduce to a mean.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Commerce</i>) Proportion, distribute proportionally.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Amount to, <i>or</i> result in (<i>when the mean is taken</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Medial, medium, mean.<BR><b>2. </b>Middling, ordinary, passable, moderate, tolerable, well enough, pretty well, not bad.

averse
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unwilling, disinclined, indisposed, reluctant, loath, backward, adverse, opposed.

aversion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dislike, distaste, disrelish, disinclination, reluctance, unwillingness, repugnance.<BR><b>2. </b>Antipathy, hatred, loathing, disgust, detestation, abhorrence, horror.

avert
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Turn aside, turn away, turn off.<BR><b>2. </b>Prevent, divert, preclude, ward off, keep off. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> forefend.

avid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Rare</i>.) Eager, greedy.

avocation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vocation, calling, business, occupation, trade, employment.<BR><b>2. </b>Occasional business (<i>business that calls aside</i>), distraction, hindrance, interruption, by business, by concernment.

avoid
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Shun (<i>in a negative sense, or denoting care only without positive exertion</i>), eschew, escape, elude, keep away from, keep aloof from, keep out of the way of, withdraw from keep clear of, be shy of, fight shy of, have nothing to do with.<BR><b>2. </b>Forbear, refrain from, help (after <i>cannot</i>).

avow
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Acknowledge, confess, own, admit.<BR><b>2. </b>Declare. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> affirm.

avowal
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Acknowledgement, confession, declaration, profession.

awe
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reverence, veneration, reverential fear.<BR><b>2. </b>Dread, fearfulness, terror, fear.<BR><b>3. </b>Solemn exaltation, admiring solemnity, adoring wonder.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inspire with awe, solemnize, make reverent, fill with revering dread.<BR><b>2. </b>Overawe, intimidate, frighten, affright, daunt, cow. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> affright.

awkward
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unskilful, bungling, unhandy, maladroit, inapt, clumsy, without dexterity.<BR><b>2. </b>Unwieldy, lumbering, unmanageable, inconvenient, unfit.<BR><b>3. </b>Uncouth, unrefined, unpolished, uncourtly, rude, rough, clumsy, coarse, wooden, inelegant, ungainly, untoward, ungraceful, stiff, constrained, uneasy, rustic, boorish, clownish, loutish, gawky, lubberly, slouching.

awning
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Canopy, tilt, baldachino, baldaquin, <i>or</i> baldequin.

awry
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obliquely, asquint. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> askance.<BR><b>2. </b>Perversely, wrong. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> athwart, 2.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Oblique, slanting, distorted, crooked, wry. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> Askant and athwart.

axiom
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Truism, self evident proposition, intuitive truth, necessary truth.<BR><b>2. </b>Postulate, settled principle (<i>not of necessity true</i>), proposition commonly received, assumed truth.

axis
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Shaft, spindle, arbor.<BR><b>2. </b>Central line, line of symmetry, line of rotation, line of revolution.

azure
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Blue, cerulean, sky colored, sky blue.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Blue, sky color, cerulean.<BR><b>2. </b>(With <i>The</i> prefixed.) The sky, heaven, welkin, empyrean, arch <i>or</i> expanse of heaven, blue expanse, expanse, depths of space, the cerulean vault.

babble
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Prattle, jabber, chatter, gibber, talk inarticulately.<BR><b>2. </b>Prate, chat, gossip, palaver, tattle, be loquacious, talk idly <i>or</i> thoughtlessly. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> prate.<BR><b>3. </b>Tell secrets, tattle, blab, let the cat out of the bag.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Tell (<i>foolishly</i>), prate, utter, prate about.<BR><b>2. </b>Blab, let out, blab about (<i>hither and thither</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> Prattle, palaver, chit chat, gabble, twaddle, chatter, balderdash, platitude, flummery, fustian, wish wash, stuff, drivel, moonshine, fudge, trash, nonsense, gibberish, gibble gabble, small talk, idle talk, childish <i>or</i> foolish talk, frothy discourse. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> prattle, <i>n</i>.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reveller, carouser, bacchanalian, roysterer, debauchee, bacchant.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Riotous, revelling, noisy, bacchanalian.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Spine, spinal column, vertebral column.<BR><b>2. </b>Firmness, nerve, resolution, courage, pluck, hardihood, manhood, steadfastness, stability, decision, moral principle, stamina.

backhanded
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inclining to the left hand (<i>as writing</i>), sloping backward.<BR><b>2. </b>Outward and backward, with the back of the hand.<BR><b>3. </b>Indirect, unfair, unfavorable, backhand.

backslide
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Apostatize, fall off, fall away, break faith.

badge
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Token of office, shield of office, official star <i>or</i> emblem.<BR><b>2. </b>Emblem of membership, cognizance, device.<BR><b>3. </b>Emblem (<i>of anything</i>), sign, mark, token, stamp, brand.

badger
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Bawson (<i>or</i> bawsin), brock.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Persecute, tease, worry, harry, bait, annoy, vex, plague, harass, torment, pester, trouble, bother, hector.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Luggage, personal effects, travelling effects, traps.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Security, surety.<BR><b>2. </b>Handle (<i>of a pail, etc</i>.).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Admit to bail.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Put bait upon.<BR><b>2. </b>Feed (<i>animals</i>), give feed to.<BR><b>3. </b>Worry, harry. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> badger, <i>v</i>.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Take refreshment (<i>on a journey</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Lure, decoy, allurement, enticement, temptation.<BR><b>2. </b>Refreshment (<i>on a journey</i>).

balance
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pair of scales.<BR><b>2. </b>Equipoise, equilibrium, equality of weight.<BR><b>3. </b>Comparison, comparative estimate, weighing.<BR><b>4. </b>Excess, overplus, surplus, residue, remainder. (<i>Correct only of accounts</i>.)<BR><b>5. </b>Counterpoise, equalizing agency, equalizer.<BR><b>6. </b>Moral <i>or</i> mental equilibrium, equipoise, poise, self control, self possession, all sidedness, good proportion.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Poise, keep in equipoise, hold in equilibrium.<BR><b>2. </b>Weigh (<i>mentally</i>), compare, estimate comparatively.<BR><b>3. </b>Counterpoise, counteract, neutralize, countervail, counterbalance, compensate, make up for.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Commerce</i>) Equalize, make equal, square, adjust, clear.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Be in equipoise <i>or</i> equilibrium, counterpoise each other, neutralize each other.<BR><b>2. </b>Cast accounts, keep accounts, reckon, make balances.

bald
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Without hair (<i>on the head</i>), hairless, destitute of hair.<BR><b>2. </b>Bare, treeless, verdureless, uncovered, unsheltered, naked.<BR><b>3. </b>Unadorned, inelegant, prosaic, dull, meagre, vapid, tame.<BR><b>4. </b>Literal, unabated, unmitigated, undisguised, unvarnished, naked, bare.<BR><b>5. </b>Unsupported, bare, mere, uncorroborated, glaring.

balderdash
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Verbiage, rodomontade, gasconade, rant, bombast, fustian, froth, palaver, twaddle, chatter, trash, stuff, bosh, platitude, flummery, fudge, jargon, nonsense, prate, prating, senseless prate, jabber, gibberish, gibble gabble, gabble, drivel, frothy discourse, idle talk.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bundle, package.<BR><b>2. </b>Harm, injury, hurt, bane, ruin, mischief, calamity, misery.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Hurtful, injurious, noxious, mischievous, pernicious, calamitous, baneful, ruinous, deadly, fraught with evil.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Disappoint, frustrate, defeat, foil, baffle, disconcert, thwart.

balky
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[<i>U. S</i>.] Perverse (<i>said of a horse</i>), unruly, refractory, wayward, contrary, stubborn, obstinate.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Light poem, sentimental song.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rod, pole, grating, cross piece, casting, ingot.<BR><b>2. </b>Obstacle, hindrance, obstruction, barrier, barricade, stop, impediment.<BR><b>3. </b>Rail, railing.<BR><b>4. </b>Tribunal, judgment seat.<BR><b>5. </b>Body of lawyers, legal fraternity.<BR><b>6. </b>Shoal, sand bank, shallow, bank, sandbar.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fasten with a bar.<BR><b>2. </b>Hinder, obstruct, stop, prevent, prohibit, restrain.<BR><b>3. </b>Exclude, shut out.

bard
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Harper, minstrel, poet.<BR><b>2. </b>Larding strip, larding bacon, bacon strip.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Naked, nude, denuded, uncovered, unclothed, undressed, exposed, unprotected, unsheltered, unshielded, detected.<BR><b>2. </b>Simple, sheer, mere, alone.<BR><b>3. </b>Unadorned, bald, undecorated, unfurnished, meagre.<BR><b>4. </b>Poor, destitute, indigent, ill supplied, empty.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Strip, uncover, make bare. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> preceding adjective.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Poorly, meagrely, slenderly, meanly.<BR><b>2. </b>Merely, simply, only, just.

bargain
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compact, agreement, stipulation, covenant, contract, convention, concordat, treaty, indenture, transaction.<BR><b>2. </b>Purchase, getting, proceeds, result.<BR><b>3. </b>Cheap purchase, purchase on favorable terms, good bargain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Contract, agree, stipulate, covenant, make a bargain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Sell, transfer, convey. [With <i>away</i>.]

barge
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vessel of state, pleasure boat, barque.<BR><b>2. </b>Boat of burden, transport.

bark
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Yelp, bay.

barren
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unprolific, sterile, childless, infecund, incapable of bearing offspring.<BR><b>2. </b>Destitute of fruit, sterile, acarpous.<BR><b>3. </b>Unfertile, unproductive, sterile, poor, bare.<BR><b>4. </b>Ineffectual, uninstructive, unsuggestive, infecund, leading to nothing, unproductive.

barricade
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Obstruction (<i>as in the streets of a city to serve as a fortification</i>). <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> barrier.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Obstruct, block up, stop up, fortify hastily.

barrier
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Obstruction, obstacle, hindrance, bar, barricade, stop, impediment.

barrister
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Advocate (<i>admitted to plead at the bar</i>), counsellor, counsel, lawyer, attorney at law, limb of the law, member of the bar.

barter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Make exchanges, traffic by exchanges, traffic, trade, bargain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Give in exchange, barter away, bargain away, traffic away, trade off.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Exchange, traffic by exchange.

base
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inferior, of little or no worth, cheap, worthless.<BR><b>2. </b>Debased, spurious, counterfeit, false.<BR><b>3. </b>Plebeian, vulgar, untitled, nameless, lowly, humble, unknown, unhonored, base born, of low birth.<BR><b>4. </b>Mean, despicable, contemptible, beggarly, sordid, servile, slavish, menial, sorry, worthless, pitiful, low minded, rascally, abject, grovelling, low, venal.<BR><b>5. </b>Shameful, disreputable, disgraceful, discreditable, dishonorable, scandalous, infamous, vile, villanous.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Basis, foundation, ground, groundwork, lowest part, bottom, foot.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Surveying</i>.) Base line.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Chemistry</i>) Principal element (<i>of a compound</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Found, rest, establish. [Followed by <i>on or upon</i>.]

basement
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Ground floor, lowest story, basement story.

bashfulness
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Shyness, timidity, coyness, diffidence, self distrust, excessive modesty.

bask
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lie warming, warm one's self joyously, luxuriate.<BR><b>2. </b>Rejoice, be shone upon, be bathed, revel, prosper.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Bathe, warm, expose.

baste
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beat (<i>with a stick</i>), cudgel, cane, drub, thrash, buffet, pound, pommel. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> beat, 1.<BR><b>2. </b>Moisten with fat.<BR><b>3. </b>Sew (<i>with long stitches</i>), stitch (<i>loosely</i>).

batch
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Quantity (<i>as of bread, ore, etc., treated at one time</i>), amount, lot, collection, crowd.

baton
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Staff, truncheon, wand, rod, sceptre, staff of office.

bauble
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>bawble</b>)</b><BR> Trinket, gewgaw, toy, trifle, plaything, gimcrack, knack, knick knack.

bawdy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Obscene, filthy, indecent, impure, lewd, smutty, unchaste.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter, verb active</span><BR>  Clamor, vociferate, yell, howl, roar, shout, hoot, cry, squall.

beacon
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Signal fire.<BR><b>2. </b>Mark, sign, signal.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> Illumine, light, illuminate, enlighten, guide, signal.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Give light, signal, shine, gleam, brighten, flame.

bead
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Globule, pellet (<i>perforated for stringing</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Drop, droplet, pearly drop, bubble, blob.<BR><b>3. </b>Moulding, astragal.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mould, decorate with a moulding.<BR><b>2. </b>Deck with beads, raise into beads.

beak
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bill, mandible, neb.<BR><b>2. </b>Prow, bow, stem.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Girder, piece of timber.<BR><b>2. </b>Ray, pencil, streak, gleam. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> glimmer.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Shine, emit rays, gleam, glisten, glitter, beacon.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Shoot forth, emit in rays <i>or</i> beams.

bear
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Uphold, support, sustain, hold up.<BR><b>2. </b>Carry, transport, convey, waft.<BR><b>3. </b>Possess, have, hold.<BR><b>4. </b>Endure, suffer, undergo, brook, tolerate, abide, put up with, bear with, take patiently <i>or</i> easily, have patience with, submit to.<BR><b>5. </b>Admit, permit, allow, admit of, be capable of.<BR><b>6. </b>Maintain, keep up, carry on.<BR><b>7. </b>Entertain, cherish, harbor.<BR><b>8. </b>Be answerable, accountable, <i>or</i> responsible for, be charged with.<BR><b>9. </b>Produce, yield.<BR><b>10. </b>Bring forth, give birth to.<BR><b>11. </b>Exhibit, utter, show, give.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Suffer, submit.<BR><b>2. </b>Press, push, be oppressive.<BR><b>3. </b>Be fruitful, be prolific.<BR><b>4. </b>Act, take effect, operate, work, succeed.<BR><b>5. </b>Tend, relate, refer, be pertinent, concern, affect.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Nautical</i>) Be situated (<i>with respect to the point of compass</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bruin.<BR><b>2. </b>Growler, grumbler, snarler, surly old fellow, bundle of irritability.<BR><b>3. </b>Speculator on a fall, depreciator of the market, growler down of stocks.

beard
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Whiskers, hirsute appendage.<BR><b>2. </b>Guard. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> barb.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Seize <i>or</i> pluck by the beard, pull one's beard. (<i>In contempt</i>.)<BR><b>2. </b>Defy, bid defiance to, oppose to the face.

bearing
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deportment, demeanor, behavior, conduct, carriage, mien, air, port.<BR><b>2. </b>Relation, dependency, connection.<BR><b>3. </b>Endurance, suffering, enduring, patience, long suffering.<BR><b>4. </b>Direction, course, aim, aspect, point of compass.<BR><b>5. </b>Import, effect, force, meaning, scope, compass.<BR><b>6. </b>Producing, bringing forth, yielding fruit <i>or</i> increase.<BR><b>7. </b>Socket, bed, receptacle.

beat
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strike, knock, hit, thump, bethump, belabor, drub, maul, pommel, baste, thrash, thwack, bang, whack, pound, punch, cudgel, cane, whip, buffet, lay blows upon.<BR><b>2. </b>Hammer, forge.<BR><b>3. </b>Pound, bruise, pulverize, comminute, bray, break in pieces.<BR><b>4. </b>Batter, smite, pelt, dash against.<BR><b>5. </b>Conquer, overcome, subdue, vanquish, overpower, defeat, checkmate.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Excel, surpass, outdo, cut out.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pulsate, throb.<BR><b>2. </b>Dash, strike.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Nautical</i>) Go against the wind, go a zigzag course.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stroke, striking, blow.<BR><b>2. </b>Pulsation, throb, beating.<BR><b>3. </b>Round, course.

beatific
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Ravishing, enchanting, enrapturing, rapturing, enravishing, enravished, raptured, enraptured, rapturous, ecstatic, transporting, enchanting, enchanted, transported, rapt.

beckon
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Make a sign, give a signal, call <i>or</i> invite by gesture.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Call by a sign <i>or</i> signal, invite, wave toward one.

bedeck
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Adorn, decorate, embellish, beautify, ornament, deck, emblazon, gild, array, garnish, grace, bedizen, set out, set off, trick out. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> array.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Soil, pollute, daggle, draggle, foul, bemire, dirty. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> bedaub.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Generate, procreate, engender, breed, get, be the father of.<BR><b>2. </b>Produce, originate, give rise to, lead to, bring about.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  See, observe, contemplate, eye, survey, consider, regard, view, descry, discern, look upon, set one's eyes on.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">interjection</span><BR>  See, look, observe, mark, lo.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obliged, indebted, bound, in debt, obligated, under obligation.<BR><b>2. </b>Obliged, grateful, thankful, devoted.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Observer, spectator, looker on, bystander, witness.

behoove

belabor
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Thump, bethump, strike, knock, lay blows upon. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> beat.

belch
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Eject from the stomach, throw up, eject, vomit, expel.<BR><b>2. </b>Throw out violently, cast forth, discharge, emit, vomit, eject, expel, hurl forth.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Eructate, eject wind from the stomach.<BR><b>2. </b>Be ejected violently, rush forth, gush.

belie
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Falsify, misrepresent, represent falsely.<BR><b>2. </b>Give the lie to, convict of falsehood, show to be false, charge with falsehood.<BR><b>3. </b>Contradict, controvert, go counter <i>or</i> contrary to.<BR><b>4. </b>Load with lies, lie about, slander, calumniate.

belligerent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Carrying on war, engaged in war, waging war, contending, in conflict, at war, in arms.<BR><b>2. </b>Of belligerents, pertaining to parties at war.<BR><b>3. </b>Antagonistic, rival, contending, hostile, conflicting, opposed, adverse.<BR><b>4. </b>Warlike, hostile.<BR><b>5. </b>Bellicose, pugnacious, contentious, quarrelsome, full of fight.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Belligerent state <i>or</i> nation, party to war, contending party, antagonist, rival, combatant, opponent.

bellow

below
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">preposition</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Under, beneath, underneath.<BR><b>2. </b>Unbecoming, unworthy of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Under, beneath, underneath.<BR><b>2. </b>On the earth, in this world, in the present life, in time, in the world of sense.<BR><b>3. </b>In hell, in the lower regions, in the under world, among the shades, in the world of the departed, in the regions of the dead.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Stupefied, confused, bewildered, muddled, muzzy, tipsy, half seas over, half drunk.

bench
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Long seat, seat, form.<BR><b>2. </b>Work bench.<BR><b>3. </b>[With <i>The</i>.] Judge's seat, woolsack.<BR><b>4. </b>Court, tribunal, body of judges, rank of a judge.

bend
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Curve, crook, bow, incurvate, flex, make crooked, deflect, draw.<BR><b>2. </b>Direct, turn, incline.<BR><b>3. </b>Exert, apply (<i>earnestly</i>), direct (<i>attentively</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>[<i>Usually in the passive</i>.] Incline, determine, resolve, set.<BR><b>5. </b>Subdue, cause to yield, bring to submission, make submissive, persuade, influence, mould, dispose, bias.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Nautical</i>) Fasten, make fast.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Crook deflect, deviate, swerve, diverge, incline, be crooked, be bent, be curved.<BR><b>2. </b>Lean, incline, turn, deflect, deviate, diverge.<BR><b>3. </b>Overhang, jut out, jut, beetle.<BR><b>4. </b>Bow, stoop, lower <i>or</i> lour, hang low.<BR><b>5. </b>Yield, submit, bow, stoop, kneel, give way.<BR><b>6. </b>Condescend, stoop, deign, be gracious.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Curve, curvity, curvature, flexure, angle, elbow, crook, incurvation, turn, turning, arcuation.<BR><b>2. </b>Bight, coil.

beneath
