benefactor
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Succorer, well doer, savior, beneficent friend.<BR><b>2. </b>Patron, favorer, supporter, upholder, contributor, friend.

beneficent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bountiful, benevolent, kind, liberal, generous, bounteous, princely, munificent.<BR><b>2. </b>Benign, favorable, beneficial, benignant, salutary.

beneficial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Useful, profitable, advantageous, helpful, serviceable, salutary, wholesome, favorable, good for one's advantage, for one's good, for one's interest.

benefit
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Favor, service, act of kindness, good turn, kind office.<BR><b>2. </b>Advantage, profit, avail, gain, good, utility, behalf, behoof, account, interest.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Befriend, help, serve, do good to, be useful to, advance the interest of, confer a favor on, do a good turn <i>or</i> kind office to.<BR><b>2. </b>Profit, advantage, avail, be of advantage to.

benevolent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Kind, benignant, benign, kind hearted, obliging, humane, tender, charitable, generous, liberal, philanthropic, altruistic, unselfish, disposed to do good, full of good will.

benign
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Kind, kindly, benevolent, gracious, complaisant, humane, obliging, benignant, good, amiable, gentle, friendly, kind hearted, tender hearted, of a gentle disposition.<BR><b>2. </b>Beneficent, most salutary, most propitious, most favorable, benignant, most wholesome, most beneficial.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Mild, of a mild nature.

benison
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Blessing. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> benediction.

bent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disposition, inclination, tendency, turn, <i>penchant</i>, learning, bias, propensity, proclivity, predisposition, predilection, partiality, liking, fondness, proneness, appetency.<BR><b>2. </b>Bent grass, wiry grass, agrostis.<BR><b>3. </b>Dried reed, stalk.<BR><b>4. </b>Wild land, hill, moor, wild.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Crooked, hooked, bowed, curved, flexed, deflected, aduncous, arcuate, incurvate.

bequeath
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Leave, demise, devise, will, give by will.<BR><b>2. </b>Transmit, hand down, impart.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Legacy, devise.

berate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Scold, chide, reprimand, rate.<BR><b>2. </b>Abuse, vilify, defame, betongue, rail at. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> asperse.

bereave
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deprive (<i>of something that cannot be restored</i>), dispossess, rob, divest, strip, despoil, spoil, take away from, make destitute of.<BR><b>2. </b>Deprive of friend <i>or</i> kindred, afflict with personal loss, render lorn.

bereft
<span style="color: #0000ff">participle, adjective</span><BR>  Stripped, deprived, destitute, despoiled.

beseech
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Entreat, beg, implore, supplicate, petition, conjure, importune, pray to. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> adjure.<BR><b>2. </b>Solicit, ask, entreat, beg, implore, importune, plead for, crave, petition for, pray for, beg for.

beset
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Surround, encompass, environ, encircle, enclose, besiege, hem in. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> beleaguer.<BR><b>2. </b>Embarrass, perplex, entangle.<BR><b>3. </b>Set, bestud, bestick, set about, engirdle, encircle, decorate, ornament, embellish, garnish.

besides
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">preposition</span><BR>  Except, save, over and above, in addition to, distinct from.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>beside</b>)<BR><b>1. </b>Moreover, too, also, further more, more than that, over and above, in addition, yet.<BR><b>2. </b>Else, more, further, beyond that, in addition.

besiege
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Surround (<i>with a military force</i>), beset, invest, lay siege to. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> beleaguer.

besot
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Intoxicate, steep, drench, soak.<BR><b>2. </b>Stupefy, make sottish; make foolish <i>or</i> stupid.<BR><b>3. </b>Infatuate, stultify, befool, intoxicate, delude.

bespeak
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Order, speak for beforehand, engage.<BR><b>2. </b>Solicit, speak for.<BR><b>3. </b>Address, speak to, accost.<BR><b>4. </b>Indicate, imply, proclaim, declare, betoken, evince, show.

bestial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beastlike, brutal, brutelike, brute, irrational.<BR><b>2. </b>Beastly, brutal, brutish, vile, low, depraved, degraded, degrading, sensual.

bestow
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Put, place, stow, store, deposit, dispose, lay away, lay up in store.<BR><b>2. </b>Give, accord, grant, impart. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> confer.

betoken
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Signify, denote, indicate, represent, typify, imply, prove, evince, show, argue, betray.<BR><b>2. </b>Prefigure, foreshow, foreshadow, foretell, presage, portend, augur, presignify.

betray
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deliver up (<i>by breach of trust</i>), give up treacherously, give over to the foe.<BR><b>2. </b>Violate, break, prove recreant to, let perish, be false to.<BR><b>3. </b>Violate the confidence of, disclose the secrets of, deceive by treachery.<BR><b>4. </b>Divulge, reveal, discover, expose, tell, blab, show, make known.<BR><b>5. </b>Display, exhibit, manifest, show, indicate, imply, betoken, argue, evince, expose, reveal, uncover.<BR><b>6. </b>Mislead, lure, ensnare, entrap, beguile, delude, inveigle.<BR><b>7. </b>Seduce, ruin, corrupt, undo, lead astray.

betroth
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Affiance, plight, pledge in marriage, engage to marry.

beverage
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Drink, potion.

bewilder
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Perplex, confound, confuse, embarrass, puzzle, stagger, pose, nonpluss, mystify, entangle, daze, befog, muddle, bemuddle.

bias
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Inclination, bent, leaning, tendency, predilection, prepossession, proclivity, proneness, propensity, partiality, prejudice disposition, predisposition, turn, <i>penchant</i>.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Influence, incline, prejudice, dispose, predispose, bend.

bibliography
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>History of editions, history of publications.<BR><b>2. </b>Literature (<i>of a given subject</i>), pertinent <i>or</i> relevant literature.

bibulous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Spongy, porous, absorbent, imbibing.<BR><b>2. </b>Drinking, intemperate, tippling, fond of drink, cup loving, soaking.

bicker
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Wrangle, dispute, quarrel, spar, spat, jangle, squabble, have words, have an altercation.<BR><b>2. </b>Quiver, tremble, vibrate, play, be tremulous.<BR><b>3. </b>Clatter, rattle, clash.

bid
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Offer (<i>of a price</i>), bidding, proposal.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Command, order, require, charge, enjoin, direct, summon.<BR><b>2. </b>Invite, ask, request, call, solicit, pray.<BR><b>3. </b>Wish, greet, say.<BR><b>4. </b>Offer, propose, proffer, tender.

bide
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Endure, suffer, tolerate, bear, put up with, submit to, abide.<BR><b>2. </b>Abide, await, wait for.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dwell, abide, stay, have one's home.<BR><b>2. </b>Remain, abide, wait, stay, lie still.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Zealot, fanatic, dogmatist.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Two sided, with two sides, in two sides.

bilk
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Deceive (<i>by not fulfilling an engagement</i>), disappoint, frustrate, thwart, balk, leave in the lurch, elude.

O. U.<BR><b>7. </b>Placard, poster, broadside, advertisement.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Kiss, caress, fondle, toy, exchange kisses and caresses.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[Fr.] Odd, fantastic, strange, singular, whimsical, incongruous, extravagant, outlandish.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Gust, squall, sudden burst, blow.<BR><b>2. </b>Peal, blare, clang.<BR><b>3. </b>Explosion, outbreak, burst, discharge.<BR><b>4. </b>Blight, pestilential influence.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Blight, kill, destroy, ruin, annihilate, wither, shrivel.<BR><b>2. </b>Rend by explosion, burst, explode, split.

blear

blithe

block
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obstruct, close, blockade, stop, arrest, shut up, stop up, block up, fill up.<BR><b>2. </b>Mould, shape, form (on a block).<BR><b>3. </b>Make steady <i>or</i> firm, stiffen, brace.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Thick and heavy piece (<i>as of wood</i> or <i>stone</i>), mass.<BR><b>2. </b>Mould (<i>on which objects are made</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Simpleton, fool, blockhead. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> dunce.<BR><b>4. </b>Mass of houses (<i>in a square or a continuous row</i>), mass of buildings.<BR><b>5. </b>City block, square.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Nautical</i>) Pulley, tackle.<BR><b>7. </b>Executioner's block (<i>in fig. sense</i>), scaffold, execution.<BR><b>8. </b>Stoppage, obstruction, jam, pack.

bloom
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Efflorescence, flower, blossom, blow.<BR><b>2. </b>Efflorescence, flowering, blossoming, blow.<BR><b>3. </b>Flush, freshness, vigor, prime, heyday.<BR><b>4. </b>Flush, glow, carnation, rose, roseate hue.<BR><b>5. </b>Powdery film, delicate furze, down.<BR><b>6. </b>First freshness, delicate newness, delicacy, innocence.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Flower, blossom, put forth blossoms, blow.

blue
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Azure, cerulean, sapphirine, amethystine, sky colored.<BR><b>2. </b>Livid, ghastly, pallid.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Melancholy, dejected, dispirited, depressed, sad, glum, gloomy, mopish, downcast, desponding, downhearted, hypochondriac, hipped, chapfallen, low spirited, cast down, in the dumps, with a long face, in the blues, down in the mouth.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Dismal, depressing, doleful, gloomy, dispiriting, melancholy, disheartening.<BR><b>5. </b>Pedantic (<i>said of women</i>), on the blue stocking order, sapient.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Azure, sky color, cerulean, amethystine, sapphirine.

blues
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun plural</span><BR>[With <i>The</i>.] Melancholy, dejection, depression, despondency, hypochondria, dumps, vapors, low spirits, blue devils, the dismals.

bluff
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Broad and full, hearty and open. (<i>Said of the countenance</i>.)<BR><b>2. </b>Rough and hearty, blunt and frank, roughly good natured.<BR><b>3. </b>Steep, abrupt, precipitous, like a bluff.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Precipitous bank (<i>especially on the margin of a river</i> or <i>the sea</i>).

blunder
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mistake (<i>grossly</i>), err (<i>from want of care</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Flounder, stumble, go bungling.<BR><b>3. </b>Bungle, be awkward, miss the mark, miss the point, be stupid, inaccurate, <i>or</i> at loose ends.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Mistake (<i>of the grossest kind</i>), error (<i>from thoughtlessness</i>), gross mistake, piece of stupidity.

blunt
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dull, obtuse, pointless, edgeless.<BR><b>2. </b>Dull witted, dull, thick witted, obtuse, stupid, stolid.<BR><b>3. </b>Abrupt, bluff, plain, uncourtly, unceremonious, without formal civility.<BR><b>4. </b>Brusk (<i>or</i> brusque), rough, harsh, uncourteous, ungracious, impolite, rude.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dull, make dull.<BR><b>2. </b>Benumb, paralyze, deaden, stupefy, obtund, hebetate, make insensible, callous, <i>or</i> obtuse.<BR><b>3. </b>Moderate, allay, assuage, mitigate, quiet, alleviate, soften.

blur
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Blot, stain, spot, blemish, soil, tarnish, defect.<BR><b>2. </b>Confusion (<i>of vision</i>), dim and uncertain spot, confused glimmer.<BR><b>3. </b>Blot, stain, disgrace, spot, blemish, blotch.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obscure, darken, dim, bedim, partially erase.<BR><b>2. </b>Tarnish, stain, blot, sully, spot, blemish.

blush
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Redden (<i>in the cheeks</i>), color.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reddening (<i>of the cheeks</i>), suffusion of the face.

bluster
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Roar (<i>as the wind</i>), make a loud noise.<BR><b>2. </b>Vapor, swagger, bully, vaunt, swell, domineer, gasconade, play the bully. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> boast.<BR><b>3. </b>Make a great ado, make much ado about nothing.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Boisterousness, noise, tumult, turbulence.<BR><b>2. </b>Boasting, swaggering, bullying, blattering, vaporing, gasconade, fanfaronade.<BR><b>3. </b>Great ado, much ado about nothing.

blustering
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Windy, stormy, tempestuous, squally, gusty, tumultuous, turbulent, noisy, roaring.<BR><b>2. </b>Swaggering, boasting, bragging, braggart, blattering, pompous, assuming, important, arrogant, swelling, big, bullying, vaporing, self sufficient.

board
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Plank (<i>thin</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Table (<i>for food</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Food, diet, provision, fare, victuals, entertainment, meals.<BR><b>4. </b>Conclave, council, committee.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cover with boards.<BR><b>2. </b>Enter <i>or</i> go on board of (<i>a vessel</i>) by force.<BR><b>3. </b>Furnish with meals.

boast
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Brag, vaunt, gasconade, vapor, bluster, crow, crack, flourish, exalt one's self, magnify one's self, give one's self airs, talk big, ride a high horse.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Magnify (<i>unduly</i>), make much of, boast of, brag of.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Sculpture</i>) Shape roughly (<i>as a block of marble</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vaunt, brag, gasconade, rodomontade, vaporing, bravado, boasting, blustering, swaggering, fanfaronade, flourish of trumpets, much cry and little wool.<BR><b>2. </b>Cause of pride <i>or</i> laudable exultation.

boastful
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Boasting, vaunting, bragging, braggart, vaporing, blustering, exulting, triumphant, cock a hoop.

bob
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Move with a jerk.<BR><b>2. </b>Strike (<i>suddenly and lightly</i>), rap, knock.<BR><b>3. </b>Clip, cut short.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Steal, purloin, rob, pilfer, filch, cabbage, get by fraud.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Play back and forward, have a jerking motion.<BR><b>2. </b>Angle (<i>with a jerking motion</i>), fish.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Jerking motion.<BR><b>2. </b>Pendant, hanging appendage.

bode
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Betoken, portend, foreshow, foreshadow, prefigure, presage, augur, foretell, predict, forebode, prophesy, be ominous of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Forebode, presage, be ominous.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Morass, quagmire, slough, fen, marsh, swamp, moss.

boggle
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hesitate, vacillate, waver, falter, demur, shrink, hang back, shrink back, hang fire, be in suspense.<BR><b>2. </b>Dissemble, play fast and loose, shuffle.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Roaring, loud, stormy.<BR><b>2. </b>Noisy, furious, tumultuous, turbulent, vehement, violent, impetuous.<BR><b>3. </b>Noisy, vociferous, clamorous, obstreperous, loud.

bold
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fearless, dauntless, daring, valiant, valorous, doughty, undaunted, hardy, intrepid, courageous, brave, heroic, audacious, adventurous, gallant, spirited, mettlesome, manful, manly, stout hearted, bold spirited.<BR><b>2. </b>Confident, assured, self reliant, self possessed, self poised, free from bashfulness.<BR><b>3. </b>Impudent, insolent, rude, impertinent, saucy, forward, pushing, assuming, brazen faced, bold faced.<BR><b>4. </b>Conspicuous, striking, prominent, standing out to the view.<BR><b>5. </b>Steep, abrupt, precipitous, prominent.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Supporting cushion.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Support (<i>something weak</i> or <i>undeserving</i>), prevent from falling, hold up, prop up, defend, maintain.

bolt
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Arrow, dart, shaft, missile.<BR><b>2. </b>Thunderbolt, stroke of lightning.<BR><b>3. </b>Metal pin <i>or</i> fastening.<BR><b>4. </b>Sieve.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Fasten with a bolt <i>or</i> bolts.<BR><b>2. </b>Swallow (<i>without chewing</i>), gulp down, swallow whole.<BR><b>3. </b>Sift, pass through a sieve.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bounce, start suddenly, spring out abruptly.<BR><b>2. </b>Abscond, make off rapidly, run away, leave suddenly.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Attack with bombs.

bombast
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fustian, rodomontade, rant, altiloquence, magniloquence, sesquipedalianism, grandiloquence, <i>sesquipedalia verba</i>, turgid talk, inflated style, swelling <i>or</i> pompous phraseology.

brazen

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Break, fracture, rupture, opening, chasm, gap, crack, flaw, fissure, rent, rift.<BR><b>2. </b>Infraction, violation, infringement, non observance.<BR><b>3. </b>Quarrel, difference, variance, disagreement, dissension, schism, misunderstanding, alienation, disaffection, rupture, falling out.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Respired air.<BR><b>2. </b>Breathing, respiration, power to breathe.<BR><b>3. </b>Exhalation, odor, perfume, aroma.<BR><b>4. </b>Life, existence, animation, breath of life, vital spark.<BR><b>5. </b>Respite, pause, rest.<BR><b>6. </b>Moment, instant, breathing space.<BR><b>7. </b>Faint movement, slightest motion, faint breeze.

breathe
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Respire.<BR><b>2. </b>Live, exist.<BR><b>3. </b>Pause, rest, take breath, have a respite.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Respire.<BR><b>2. </b>Exhale, emit, give out, throw out.<BR><b>3. </b>Whisper, utter softly.<BR><b>4. </b>Indicate, manifest, express, show, send forth, diffuse.

breathing
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Respiration.<BR><b>2. </b>Aspiration, wish, desire, longing, craving, yearning.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Living, alive, live.

breathless
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Out of breath.<BR><b>2. </b>Dead, lifeless, defunct.

breed
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bring forth, bear, conceive and bring to birth, beget, produce, engender.<BR><b>2. </b>Nourish, nurture, foster, bring up, rear, raise.<BR><b>3. </b>Discipline, educate, instruct, train, teach, school, bring up, nurture, rear.<BR><b>4. </b>Originate, occasion, beget, produce, engender, generate, be the occasion of, give rise to, be the cause of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bring forth young, produce off spring.<BR><b>2. </b>Be born, be produced, have birth, arise, take rise, grow, develop.<BR><b>3. </b>Raise live stock, engage in breeding.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Race (<i>of animals</i>), lineage, pedigree, progeny, stock, family, line, extraction, strain.

breeze
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Zephyr, air, gentle gale, moderate wind, light wind.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Quarrel, disturbance, commotion, noise, tumult, uproar, stir, agitation.

brevity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Briefness, shortness.<BR><b>2. </b>Conciseness, terseness, compression, succinctness, pithiness.

brew
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Prepare by fermentation.<BR><b>2. </b>Contrive, plot, devise, project, hatch, concoct, foment, excite, stir up.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Make beer, be a brewer.<BR><b>2. </b>Be gathering, be forming.

bribe
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reward of treachery, price of corruption, corrupting gift.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Suborn, gain by a bribe, give a bribe to.

bridle
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Restraint, curb, check.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Put a bridle on, bit.<BR><b>2. </b>Restrain, check, curb, control, govern.<BR><b>3. </b>[Usually with <i>up</i>.] Ruffle, rustle, bristle, toss the head, be incensed, put on an air of offended dignity.

brighten
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Polish, burnish, furbish, make bright, illuminate, illumine, illume, irradiate.<BR><b>2. </b>Make cheerful, make joyous, cheer, animate, enliven, encourage, hearten, exhilarate, inspirit, inspire.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Grow bright <i>or</i> brighter, clear, clear up, improve, grow better, become more encouraging.

brilliant
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sparkling, glittering, splendid, lustrous, shining, bright, beaming, radiant, effulgent, refulgent, resplendent, glistening, gleaming. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> bright, 1.<BR><b>2. </b>Illustrious, glorious, celebrated, famous, renowned, distinguished, eminent, admirable.<BR><b>3. </b>Striking, prominent, decided, unusual, impressive, signal, dazzling.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Diamond (<i>cut into facets</i>).

brim
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Edge, border, rim, verge, margin, skirt, brink.<BR><b>2. </b>Shore, bank, border, margin, marge, rim, sands, coast.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> brinded

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Edge, border, margin, verge, brow.<BR><b>2. </b>Shore, bank, brim, rim, margin, marge, sands, border.

briny
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Salt.

brisk
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Active, lively, quick, agile, nimble, smart, alert, spry, spirited, vivacious, sprightly.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Point with a bristle, fasten a bristle on.<BR><b>2. </b>Make bristly, roughen, erect in bristles, corrugate, bethorn, bespine, ruffle.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Stand on end, stand up like bristles.<BR><b>2. </b>Be horrent.<BR><b>3. </b>[With <i>up</i>.] Become irritated, show anger, take offence, ruffle, bridle.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Fragile, crumbling, shivery, frail, frangible, brash, easily broken (<i>into pieces</i>), easily shivered.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pierce, tap, set running, open (<i>for the first time</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Open (<i>a subject</i>), suggest, hint, approach one on, break.<BR><b>3. </b>Utter, publish, proclaim, give out.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Widen, make broad, enlarge, liberalize.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beast (<i>in a wild state</i>), quadruped, four footed animal, ferocious animal.<BR><b>2. </b>Ruffian, barbarian, brutal monster.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irrational, void of reason.<BR><b>2. </b>Dumb, speechless, inarticulate, silent, voiceless, destitute of language.<BR><b>3. </b>Bestial, savage, barbarous. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> brutal.<BR><b>4. </b>Rough, rude, uncivilized.

Faculty, power, endowment, gift.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> Knock, thump, strike, hit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Come in contact, strike together, strike, thump.<BR><b>2. </b>Boom (<i>as the bittern</i>), make a hollow, resounding noise.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Sear, burn with a hot iron, burn with cautery.

caution
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Wariness, heed, heedfulness, circumspection, care, carefulness, watchfulness, vigilance, forethought, providence, prudence, discretion.<BR><b>2. </b>Warning, admonition, injunction, advice, counsel.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Scotch law</i>.) Security, guaranty, surety, pledge.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Warn, admonish, forewarn, put on one's guard.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Prudent, wary, careful, heedful, chary, circumspect, discreet, watchful, vigilant.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Procession (<i>of mounted men</i>).

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Knight, equestrian, horseman, chevalier, horse soldier.<BR><b>2. </b>Partisan of Charles I., royalist.<BR><b>3. </b>Beau, attendant (<i>on a lady</i>), partner (<i>in a dance</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Disdainful, haughty, arrogant, supercilious, scornful, insolent, curt.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Horse soldiers, horse, mounted soldiers, mounted men.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Grotto, cave, den, grot.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Frivolous objection, captious criticism, unwarranted censure, carping, censoriousness, wilful censure, objection for objection's sake.<BR><b>2. </b>Specious objection, specious controversion, specious disputation, sophistry, special pleading.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Hollow, empty space, void, vacant place.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Zero, naught <i>or</i> nought, nothing.<BR><b>2. </b>Character, symbol, device, monogram.<BR><b>3. </b>Secret character, private alphabet.<BR><b>4. </b>Person of no account, nobody, person without influence.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Practise arithmetic, use figures.

circle
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Round, plane figure.<BR><b>2. </b>Circumference, periphery, ring.<BR><b>3. </b>Orb, sphere, globe, ball.<BR><b>4. </b>Returning series.<BR><b>5. </b>Compass, enclosure.<BR><b>6. </b>Company, society, class, fraternity, coterie, clique, set.<BR><b>7. </b>Range, sphere, province, field, compass, bounds, circuit, region.

circuit
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Revolution, circular course.<BR><b>2. </b>Space, region, tract, district, province, range, sphere, field, compass, bounds.<BR><b>3. </b>Boundary, compass, boundary line, distance round.<BR><b>4. </b>Course, tour, round, perambulation, journey.

circuitous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Tortuous, devious, turning, winding, indirect, roundabout.

circular
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Round, annular, ring shaped.

circulate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Move round, move in a circle.<BR><b>2. </b>Spread, be diffused, have currency.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Spread, diffuse, disseminate, promulgate, propagate, give currency to, spread abroad.

circulation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Motion in a circle.<BR><b>2. </b>Diffusion, dissemination, promulgation, propagation, spread, spreading.<BR><b>3. </b>Currency, money, circulating medium.<BR><b>4. </b>Extent of subscription, number of copies distributed, number of takers, number of copies disposed of.

circumference
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Periphery.

circumlocution
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Periphrasis, periphrase, circuit <i>or</i> compass of words, indirect expression, roundabout mode of speech, involved expression.

circumlocutory
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Periphrastical, periphrastic, roundabout, indirect, involved, diffuse.

circumscribe
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bound, encircle, surround, enclose.<BR><b>2. </b>Confine, restrict, limit, keep within bounds.

circumspect
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Cautious, wary, careful, watchful, heedful, considerate, judicious, vigilant, attentive, discreet, prudent, observant.

circumstance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Incidental, accidental, <i>or</i> subsidiary fact.<BR><b>2. </b>Event, fact, incident, occurrence.

circumstantial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Particular, minute, detailed.<BR><b>2. </b>Indirect, inferential, presumptive, founded on circumstances.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Thwart, check, check mate, outgeneral.<BR><b>2. </b>Deceive, cheat, defraud, trick, cozen, overreach, delude, hoodwink, dupe, gull, bamboozle, chouse, outwit, beguile, mislead, inveigle, impose upon.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reservoir, tank.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Be identical (<i>in place</i> or <i>time</i>), fall exactly together, be conterminous, fill identical spaces <i>or</i> times, fit exactly, cover each other exactly.<BR><b>2. </b>Correspond, square, tally, cohere.<BR><b>3. </b>Agree, concur, harmonize, be of the same mind.

coincidence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exact overlapping, identical size <i>or</i> duration, exact equality, precise falling together.<BR><b>2. </b>Correspondence, coherence.<BR><b>3. </b>Agreement, concurrence, consistency.

coincident
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exactly conterminous, exactly overlying, identical in extent <i>or</i> duration.<BR><b>2. </b>Correspondent, tallying, squaring.<BR><b>3. </b>Agreeing, concurring, concurrent.

collapse
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Falling together, falling in (<i>as the sides of a flue</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Prostration, exhaustion, sinking, extreme depression.<BR><b>3. </b>Break down, downfall, utter failure, dead failure, abortion, <i>brutum fulmen</i>, &quot;lame and impotent conclusion,&quot; flash in the pan.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fall together, fall in.<BR><b>2. </b>Break down, come to nothing, fail utterly, go out in smoke, vanish in thin air.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Neck band.<BR><b>2. </b>Neck harness.<BR><b>3. </b>Ring, fillet, belt, band, guard.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Seize by the collar <i>or</i> throat.<BR><b>2. </b>Put a collar on, fit with a collar, fillet, belt.

collateral
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indirect, subordinate, not directly to the point.<BR><b>2. </b>Corroboratory, confirmatory, concurrent.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Commendatory, laudatory, encomiastic, flattering (<i>in the good sense</i>).

component
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Composing, constituting, constituent.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Constituent, element, ingredient, component part.

comport
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Agree, accord, harmonize, tally, correspond, square, fall in, chime in.

compose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Constitute, form, make, compound, put together, make up.<BR><b>2. </b>Indite, write, frame, invent, contrive, imagine, create, draw up, put <i>or</i> set down in writing, express by writing.<BR><b>3. </b>Adjust, settle, regulate.<BR><b>4. </b>Tranquillize, assuage, soothe, appease, pacify, calm, still, quiet, quell.

composed
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Calm, quiet, unruffled, undisturbed, unmoved, tranquil, placid, sedate, collected, self possessed, imperturbable, cool.

composition
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Constitution, formation, making.<BR><b>2. </b>Compound, mixture.<BR><b>3. </b>Union, conjunction, combination, arrangement (of parts).<BR><b>4. </b>Writing, literary work, invention (<i>esp. in music, painting</i>, or <i>sculpture</i>).<BR><b>5. </b>Compromise, agreement, arrangement.

compost
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Manure, fertilizer, fertilizing mixture.

composure
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Quiet, tranquillity, calmness, sedateness, placidity, coolness, equanimity, self possession.

compound
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mix, mingle, intermix, intermingle, blend, combine, unite, amalgamate, (<i>either physically</i> or <i>mentally</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Compromise, settle, adjust, compose.<BR><b>3. </b>Commute, pay with an abatement, pay by substitution.<BR><b>4. </b>Connive at, bargain with.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Compromise, agree, come to terms, come to an agreement, make an arrangement.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Complex, composite, compounded.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mixture, composition, combination.<BR><b>2. </b>Medley, olio, farrago, hodge podge, hotch potch <i>or</i> hotchpot, mess (<i>colloq.</i>), jumble.<BR><b>3. </b>[<i>In the East Indies</i>.] Yard (<i>round a building</i>), enclosure.

comprehend
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Comprise, include, enclose, embrace, contain, embody, take in.<BR><b>2. </b>Grasp (<i>mentally</i>), understand (<i>fully</i>), apprehend, conceive, imagine, see, discern, perceive, enter into the idea of, catch the idea of.

comprehension
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inclusion, comprising, embracing.<BR><b>2. </b>Scope, reach, sweep, range, compass, embrace, field, sphere, limits, domain, province.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Logic</i>) Intension, connotation, force, depth, etc. (<i>of a notion</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Grasp (<i>of our understanding</i>), power to understand, conception, understanding, intelligence.<BR><b>5. </b>Intellect, mind, reason, mental capacity, understanding, intelligence.

comprehensive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Extensive, wide, broad, large, capacious, full, sweeping, wide reaching, wide embracing, of great scope, of extensive application.

compress
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Press together, close tightly, shut firmly.<BR><b>2. </b>Bind tightly, wrap closely.<BR><b>3. </b>Squeeze <i>or</i> press together <i>or</i> into smaller compass, condense.<BR><b>4. </b>Squeeze, force, crowd, press.<BR><b>5. </b>Make brief, abbreviate, condense, make terse <i>or</i> pithy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Surgery</i>) Bandage, compressing pad.

compression
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Condensation, pressing together, squeezing, pinching, confining.<BR><b>2. </b>Tight closure, close shutting, firm closing.<BR><b>3. </b>Brevity, terseness, succinctness, pithiness, condensation, conciseness.

comprise
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Comprehend, include, enclose, embrace, contain, embody, take in.

compromise
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Agreement, composition, adjustment, settlement, mutual concession, abatement of differences.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Adjust, settle, compose, compound.<BR><b>2. </b>Jeopardize (<i>irretrievably</i>), imperil, bring into danger, put at hazard, put in jeopardy, expose the repute of.<BR><b>3. </b>Engage, pledge, implicate, commit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Agree, compound, come to an agreement, come to an understanding, settle <i>or</i> compose <i>or</i> compound differences <i>or</i> disputes.

compulsion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Coercion, constraint, application <i>or</i> employment of force.

compulsory
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compelling, constraining, coercive.<BR><b>2. </b>Binding, obligatory, enforced, necessary, unavoidable, not to be evaded.

compunction
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Repentance, remorse, contrition, penitence, sorrow, regret, misgiving, qualm, reluctance, reproach of conscience, sting of conscience.

computation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reckoning, calculation, estimate, account.

compute
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Reckon, calculate, estimate, count, number, rate, cast, cast up, sum up.

con
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Study, read over carefully, consider minutely, fix in the mind, commit to memory, learn by heart, con over.

concatenate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Connect, unite, join, link together.

concave
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Hollow, hollowed, depressed.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> concavity, 2.

conceal
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hide, secrete, cover, screen, bury, cover up.<BR><b>2. </b>Disguise, dissemble, keep secret.

concede
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Surrender, yield, grant, give up.<BR><b>2. </b>Allow, admit, grant.

conceit
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conception, image, notion, thought, fancy, imagination, idea, belief.<BR><b>2. </b>Whim, vagary, illusion, freak of fancy.<BR><b>3. </b>Opinion, estimate, estimation, judgment, impression.<BR><b>4. </b>Vanity, conceitedness, egotism, self conceit, self complacency, self esteem, self sufficiency, priggery, priggishness, priggism.<BR><b>5. </b>Quip, quirk, point, odd thought, odd turn, affected witticism, far fetched fancy.

conceive
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Be <i>or</i> become pregnant with, bear in the womb.<BR><b>2. </b>Form (in the mind), devise, contrive, plan, purpose.<BR><b>3. </b>Imagine, form a distinct image of, image, make sensibly real.<BR><b>4. </b>Think, realize in the mind, comprehend, understand, fathom.<BR><b>5. </b>Imagine, suppose, suppose possible, assume as a possible case.<BR><b>6. </b>Apprehend, take, view, look at, regard, fancy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Become pregnant.<BR><b>2. </b>Think, imagine, have an idea, form a conception.<BR><b>3. </b>Suppose, apprehend, think, imagine, fancy, take it.

concentrate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Condense, bring into a small compass, bring toward a central point.<BR><b>2. </b>Boil down, reduce by evaporation, rectify, reduce to extreme purity and strength.

concentration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Condensation, compression into a small compass, collection upon a single point.<BR><b>2. </b>Reduction by evaporation.

concept
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Universal, general <i>or</i> abstract notion, conception. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> idea.

conception
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conceiving.<BR><b>2. </b>Apprehension, the mind's eye. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> imagination.<BR><b>3. </b>Notion, idea, thought, fancy, conceit, impression.<BR><b>4. </b>General notion, generic idea. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> concept.

concert
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Contrive, plan, plot, devise, design, concoct.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Agreement, concord, concordance, harmony.<BR><b>2. </b>Musical entertainment.

concession
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Yielding.<BR><b>2. </b>Grant, boon.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Propitiate, reconcile, pacify, appease.<BR><b>2. </b>Win, gain, engage, secure, draw over, win over.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reconciling, pacifying, pacific, pacificatory.<BR><b>2. </b>Winning, persuasive.

concise
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Brief, short, laconic, summary, compendious, succinct, terse, pithy, sententious, comprehensive, pointed, compact, condensed, compressed.

conclave
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Secret council, private assembly.<BR><b>2. </b>Secret assembly room of the Romish Cardinals.<BR><b>3. </b>Body of cardinals.

conclude
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>End, finish, terminate, close, bring to an end.<BR><b>2. </b>Gather (<i>as a consequence</i>), infer, judge, deduce.<BR><b>3. </b>Determine, judge, decide.<BR><b>4. </b>Settle, arrange, complete, bring to a successful issue.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Stop, estop, bar, hinder, restrain, cut off.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Determine, resolve, decide, make up one's mind, come to the conclusion <i>or</i> decision.<BR><b>2. </b>End, close, come to a conclusion <i>or</i> close.<BR><b>3. </b>Draw inferences, make deductions, reason, syllogize.<BR><b>4. </b>Settle opinion, come to a final decision.

conclusive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Decisive, convincing, unanswerable, irrefutable, clinching <i>or</i> clenching.<BR><b>2. </b>Final, ultimate, without appeal.

concoct
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Devise, plan, plot, contrive, design, invent, project, brew, frame, mature, prepare, hatch.

concomitant
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Accompanying, concurrent, attendant, attending, conjoined.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Attendant, accessary <i>or</i> accessory, accompaniment, attending <i>or</i> accompanying circumstance, accessary fact.

concord
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Agreement, amity, friendship, peace, harmony, unanimity, unity, union, good understanding.<BR><b>2. </b>Consonance, concordance, harmony, accord, agreement, adaptation.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Music</i>) Harmony, accord.

concrete
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Solidify, harden, cake, become firm <i>or</i> solid, <i>be</i> consolidated, coagulate, congeal, thicken.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Firm, solid, solidified, consolidated, compact.<BR><b>2. </b>Concreted, formed by admixture, complex, compound, agglomerated, conglomerated.<BR><b>3. </b>Completely real, individualized, total, entire, free from abstraction.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Concretion, mixture, compound.<BR><b>2. </b>Cemented stones and gravel.

concur

concurrent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Agreeing, harmonizing, coincident.<BR><b>2. </b>Conjoined, united, associate, associated, attendant, concomitant.<BR><b>3. </b>Joint and equal, of equal authority.

concussion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Shaking, agitation.<BR><b>2. </b>Clash, shock, crash, violent collision.

condemn
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sentence, doom.<BR><b>2. </b>Pronounce guilty, utter (judicial) sentence against.<BR><b>3. </b>Disapprove utterly, proscribe, reprobate.<BR><b>4. </b>Censure, blame, disapprove, reprove, upbraid, pass censure on.<BR><b>5. </b>Adjudge (<i>a ship</i>) to be unseaworthy, decide (<i>anything</i>) unfit for use.<BR><b>6. </b>Confiscate, declare (to be) forfeited.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Act of condemning, condemning, sentencing, dooming.<BR><b>2. </b>Sentence of punishment, judgment, sentence, penalty.<BR><b>3. </b>Utter disapproval, proscription, banning.<BR><b>4. </b>Guilt, sin, wrong, ground of condemnation, condemning fact, ill desert, what deserves condemnation.<BR><b>5. </b>Blame, censure, reproof, disapproval, disapprobation.

condensation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compression.<BR><b>2. </b>Reduction, abridgment, contraction.

condense
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compress, consolidate, concentrate; make dense, compact, <i>or</i> close; press together.<BR><b>2. </b>Abridge, abbreviate, shorten, epitomize, reduce, diminish, contract, curtail.<BR><b>3. </b>Reduce to a liquid state, liquefy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Grow dense.<BR><b>2. </b>Become liquid, liquefy.

condescend
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deign, vouchsafe, graciously stoop.<BR><b>2. </b>Stoop, descend, degrade one's self, lower one's self, so forget one's self.

condign
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[<i>Said only</i> or <i>chiefly of punishment</i>.] Deserved, merited, suitable, adequate.

condiment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Seasoning, relish, appetizer, sauce.

condition
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Situation, state, case, plight, predicament, circumstances.<BR><b>2. </b>Rank (<i>of life</i>), estate, grade, class <i>or</i> order of society.<BR><b>3. </b>Consideration, provision, proviso, stipulation, arrangement, article of agreement, rule of proceeding.<BR><b>4. </b>Prerequisite, necessity, necessary antecedent <i>or</i> attendant, <i>sine qua non</i>.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Subject to conditions, put under limits, assign terms, conditions, <i>or</i> limits to, limit, restrict, make contingent, put as contingent <i>or</i> dependent, cognize under conditions <i>or</i> limits.

condone
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Pardon, forgive, overlook, let go <i>or</i> pass.

conducive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Conducing, contributing, subservient, instrumental, subsidiary, promotive.

conduct
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Management, direction, administration, guidance, leadership.<BR><b>2. </b>Convoy, escort, guard.<BR><b>3. </b>Deportment (<i>in general</i>, or <i>as a matter of habit</i>), demeanor, carriage, bearing, manners, career, manner of life, course of life, actions, ways, mode of action. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> behavior.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lead, direct, guide, escort, convoy.<BR><b>2. </b>Command, lead, govern, preside over.<BR><b>3. </b>Manage, regulate, carry on, direct.<BR><b>4. </b>Lead (<i>in music</i> or <i>ceremonial</i>), direct, take the lead in.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Physics</i>) Carry, transmit, propagate.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Converse, discourse, parley, advise, talk, hold a conference, talk together, compare notes, interchange views.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>[<i>Appropriately used when the gift is from a person of superior rank to another of lower rank</i>.] Bestow, give, grant, vouchsafe.

conference
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Now rare</i>.)<BR><b>1. </b>Conversation, discourse, talk.<BR><b>2. </b>Meeting for consultation, interview, colloquy, parley.

confess
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Acknowledge (<i>as a crime</i> or <i>fault</i>), own, avow, admit.<BR><b>2. </b>Admit, grant, concede, recognize.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Attest, prove, show, exhibit, manifest, be proof of.<BR><b>4. </b>Receive <i>or</i> hear one's confession (<i>as a priest</i>), shrive.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Acknowledge one's sins (<i>to a priest</i>), go to the confessional.

confession
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Acknowledgment, admission, avowal.<BR><b>2. </b>(Secret) acknowledgment of one's sins (<i>to a priest</i>).

confidant

confide
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Trust, intrust, commit, consign, give in trust.

confidence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Trust, faith, belief, reliance, dependence.<BR><b>2. </b>Boldness, courage, intrepidity, assurance, firmness, self reliance.<BR><b>3. </b>Secret, private <i>or</i> confidential communication.<BR><b>4. </b>Intimacy, confidential relations.

confident
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Assured, certain, sure, positive, fully convinced, cocksure (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Bold, presumptuous, sanguine.

confidential
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Private, not to be disclosed, not to be communicated.<BR><b>2. </b>Trusty, faithful, to be trusted.

configuration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Form, figure, shape, conformation, outline.

confine
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Boundary, border, limit, frontier.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Restrain, shut up, shut in.<BR><b>2. </b>Imprison, immure, incarcerate.<BR><b>3. </b>Limit, circumscribe, bound, restrict.

confinement
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Restraint.<BR><b>2. </b>Imprisonment, incarceration, captivity, duress, durance.<BR><b>3. </b>Lying in, childbed, delivery, parturition, childbirth.

confirm
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Establish, fix, settle, assure, make firm.<BR><b>2. </b>Strengthen, add strength to.<BR><b>3. </b>Corroborate, substantiate, verify.<BR><b>4. </b>Ratify, sanction, bind.<BR><b>5. </b>Admit to the Communion, invest with full membership in the church.

confirmation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Settlement, establishment.<BR><b>2. </b>Corroboration, substantiation, verification, proof.<BR><b>3. </b>Ratification, sanction.<BR><b>4. </b>Admission to the Communion, full investiture (<i>with the privileges of the church</i>).

confiscate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Cause to be forfeited, condemn to public use.

conflagration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Great burning, general fire.

conflict
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Clash, interfere, be inconsistent <i>or</i> inharmonious, be contrary, be opposed.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Struggle, encounter, contest, combat, battle, fight, collision, strife in arms.<BR><b>2. </b>Clashing, interference, inconsistency, antagonism, opposition, disagreement, discord, inharmony.

confluence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Meeting, junction, conflux, union, flowing together.<BR><b>2. </b>Concourse, assembly, assemblage, congregation, multitude, crowd, collection, throng, army, host, swarm, horde.

conform
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Make conformable, bring into compliance, adjust, adapt.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Comply, yield assent.<BR><b>2. </b>Agree, harmonize, tally, square, correspond, comport.<BR><b>3. </b>Comply with the usages of the Church (<i>of England</i>).

conformity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Accordance, agreement, congruity, harmony.<BR><b>2. </b>Correspondence, likeness, similitude, resemblance.<BR><b>3. </b>Yielding, submission, obedience, compliance with the will of.<BR><b>4. </b>Compliance with the usages of the Church (<i>of England</i>).

confound
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mingle confusedly, confuse, crowd together in disorder.<BR><b>2. </b>Confuse with each other, mistake one for another, mistake between.<BR><b>3. </b>Perplex, bewilder, embarrass, mystify, pose, nonplus, flurry.<BR><b>4. </b>Surprise, amaze, astonish, astound, stupefy, bewilder, stun, startle, dumfounder, paralyze, take by surprise, strike with wonder, strike dumb, petrify with wonder.<BR><b>5. </b>Destroy, overthrow, ruin, overwhelm, cast down, demolish, annihilate, bring to nought.<BR><b>6. </b>Abash, confuse, disconcert, discompose, shame, mortify.

confront
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Face, stand in front of, stand over against, be opposite to.<BR><b>2. </b>Oppose, stand opposed, challenge, threaten, encounter, stand athwart the path of, rise in hostility before.<BR><b>3. </b>Bring face to face, bring into the presence of.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mingle, intermingle, mix, blend, confound.<BR><b>2. </b>Disorder, disarrange, derange, disturb, jumble, throw into disorder <i>or</i> confusion.<BR><b>3. </b>Perplex, obscure, darken, render uncertain.<BR><b>4. </b>Mystify, embarrass, pose, nonplus, bewilder, flurry.<BR><b>5. </b>Abash, shame, mortify, discompose, disconcert, confound.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Confusedness, disorder, disarrangement, derangement, disarray, jumble, chaos, anarchy.<BR><b>2. </b>Tumult, turmoil, commotion, ferment, stir, agitation.<BR><b>3. </b>Distraction, perplexity, embarrassment, bewilderment, astonishment.<BR><b>4. </b>Shame, mortification, abashment, embarrassment.<BR><b>5. </b>Overthrow, destruction, defeat, ruin, annihilation, demolition.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Satisfied, contented, easy in mind.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Satisfy, appease, make easy, make contented.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Satisfaction, ease, contentment, peace.

contented
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Satisfied, content, easy in mind, at peace.

contention
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strife, discord, dissension, wrangling, wrangle, quarrel, squabble, feud, rupture, falling out, high words.<BR><b>2. </b>Dispute, debate, bickering, altercation, controversy, logomachy, war of words, strife of words.

contentious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Quarrelsome, cross, petulant, perverse, pugnacious, litigious, wrangling.<BR><b>2. </b>Disputatious, captious, cavilling.

contest
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dispute, controvert, argue, debate, litigate, contend against, call in question.<BR><b>2. </b>Strive to hold, struggle to defend.<BR><b>3. </b>Contend for, strive to carry, compete for, make the object of competition <i>or</i> rivalry <i>or</i> emulation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Contend, strive, struggle, vie, fight, compete, cope.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dispute, altercation, debate, controversy, contention, quarrel, difference, high words, strife of words, war of words.<BR><b>2. </b>Struggle, battle, conflict, fight, combat, encounter, rencounter, strife in arms.<BR><b>3. </b>Competition, rivalry, contention.

context
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Words immediately preceding <i>or</i> following, adjoining matter, connection, connected thought <i>or</i> thoughts.

contiguous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Touching, meeting, conterminous, adjacent, adjoining, in contact.

continent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Chaste, temperate in sexual passion, free from lust.<BR><b>2. </b>Temperate (<i>in general</i>), moderate, self commanding, self controlled, restrained.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Mainland, great tract of land.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Extension (<i>in time</i> or <i>space</i>), prolongation, protraction, continuance, perpetuation.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lessen, shorten, narrow, diminish, abridge, reduce, epitomize, draw together.<BR><b>2. </b>Incur, make, get, take, catch, absorb take in.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Shrivel, shrink, shrink up, draw in.<BR><b>2. </b>Agree, stipulate, bargain, covenant, make a bargain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Compact, bargain, stipulation, covenant, convention, concordat, treaty, agreement, pact, arrangement.

counterpart
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Corresponding part.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Duplicate, copy.<BR><b>3. </b>Correlative, correlate, complement, supplement, reverse (<i>to obverse</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Match, fellow, mate, tally, twin, the very image.

counterpoise
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Counterbalance, balance, countervail.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Equal weight, neutralizing force.

countrified
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Rustic, rude, country.

couple
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Brace, pair, two (<i>of the same kind</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Man and wife, married pair.<BR><b>3. </b>Link, bond, tie, coupling, leash.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Join, conjoin, connect, unite, pair, link together.<BR><b>2. </b>Marry, wed.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unite, pair.<BR><b>2. </b>Copulate, embrace.

courier
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Messenger, express, runner.

court
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Royal household, princely retinue.<BR><b>2. </b>Judicial tribunal, court of justice.<BR><b>3. </b>Courtyard, inclosed area, quadrangle.<BR><b>4. </b>Solicitation(s), addresses, civilities, flattering attention, respects, homage.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flatter, coddle, try to please, endeavor to ingratiate one's self with, fawn upon, pay court to.<BR><b>2. </b>Woo, pay one's addresses to, make love to.<BR><b>3. </b>Seek, solicit, strive to gain.<BR><b>4. </b>Invite, solicit, woo.

courteous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Polite, civil, affable, urbane, complaisant, gracious, courtly, ceremonious, debonair, respectful, obliging, well bred.

courtly
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Polished, elegant, polite. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> courteous.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Wooing.

covenant
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Agreement, bargain, contract, compact, stipulation, arrangement, treaty, convention, concordat, pact.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Bargain, stipulate, agree, make a stipulation.

cover
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Overspread, overlay.<BR><b>2. </b>Conceal, hide, secrete, cloak, veil, screen, shroud, mask, disguise.<BR><b>3. </b>Shield, shelter, protect, guard, defend.<BR><b>4. </b>Clothe, invest, envelop, fold up, inwrap, wrap up.<BR><b>5. </b>Put a covering on.<BR><b>6. </b>Comprehend, embrace, include, comprise, contain, embody.<BR><b>7. </b>Counterbalance, countervail, balance, compensate, make up for, be equal to.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Covering, tegument, integument, capsule, top, case.<BR><b>2. </b>Screen, veil, disguise, cloak.<BR><b>3. </b>Shelter, protection, guard, defence, shield, safeguard.<BR><b>4. </b>Underwood, underbrush, shrubbery, undergrowth, thicket, woods.<BR><b>5. </b>Plate, dish.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Thicket, shade, shrubbery, underwood.<BR><b>2. </b>Shelter, refuge, asylum, harbor, sanctuary, retreat, defence, hiding place.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Hidden, concealed, secret, disguised, clandestine, underhand, sly, insidious, stealthy.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Overawe, intimidate, frighten, daunt, abash, discourage, dishearten, break, subdue by fear.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[Written also <i>Cosy</i> and <i>Cosey</i>.]<BR><b>1. </b>Snug, comfortable, easy.<BR><b>2. </b>[<i>Eng.</i>] Chatty, talkative, social, conversable.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sour, tart, rough, acrid.<BR><b>2. </b>Morose, surly, testy, touchy, cross, growling, snarling, snappish, cantankerous, waspish, petulant, peevish, churlish, harsh, acrimonious, caustic, captious, censorious, splenetic, out of sorts, ill tempered.<BR><b>3. </b>Difficult, perplexing, trying, unmanageable, tough, intractable, hard to deal with.

crack
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Break, cleft, breach, chink, fissure, crevice, cranny, opening, rift, rent.<BR><b>2. </b>Report, clap, pop, burst, explosion.<BR><b>3. </b>Snap (<i>of a whip</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Break (<i>partially</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Split, chop, cleave, rend asunder.<BR><b>3. </b>Snap (<i>as a whip</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Craze, drive insane, madden.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Break, split, burst, chap, open in chinks.<BR><b>2. </b>[With <i>of</i>.] Brag, bluster, vapor, vaunt, boast, gasconade, crow.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Excellent, capital, tiptop, first rate, first class.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stuff, gorge, glut, fill full, fill to repletion.<BR><b>2. </b>Crowd, press, compress.<BR><b>3. </b>Prepare for examination, grind, coach.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Eat to satiety, eat greedily, stuff, gorge <i>or</i> glut one's self, gluttonize.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Study for examination.

cramp
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Spasm, crick, convulsion.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Check, restriction, restraint, obstruction.<BR><b>3. </b>Cramp iron.<BR><b>4. </b>Cramping machine, boot cramp.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affect with spasms, convulse.<BR><b>2. </b>Restrain, obstruct, hinder, check, confine.<BR><b>3. </b>Fasten with a cramp, confine <i>or</i> hold with a cramp <i>or</i> cramp iron.<BR><b>4. </b>Stretch <i>or</i> shape with a cramp, fashion with a boot cramp.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Belief, trust, faith, confidence, credence, reliance.<BR><b>2. </b>Reputableness, esteem, regard, good repute, good reputation, high character.<BR><b>3. </b>Influence (<i>of a good name</i>), power.<BR><b>4. </b>Merit, honor, proof of desert.<BR><b>5. </b>Trust (<i>in future payment</i>), loan.<BR><b>6. </b>Money due, securities, evidence of debt (<i>on the part of others</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Believe, give faith to, put faith in, rely upon, confide in, doubt not, make no doubt of, take upon credit.<BR><b>2. </b>Place to the credit of, carry to the credit of one's account, enter upon the credit side.<BR><b>3. </b>Trust (<i>for future payment</i>), loan (<i>on trust</i> or <i>security</i>).

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Decline, fail, deteriorate, wither, waste, perish, be impaired, waste away, fall into decay.<BR><b>2. </b>Rot, putrefy, be spoiled.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Decline, decadence, declension, falling off, deterioration, degeneracy, caducity.

deceit
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Deception, fraud, imposition, imposture, finesse, artifice, duplicity, guile, trickery, chicanery, cozenage, cheating, double dealing, crooked ways, dark ways, underhandedness, deceitfulness.

deceive
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Delude, cheat, dupe, gull, cozen, fool, befool, trick, circumvent, overreach, chouse, beguile, hoodwink, impose upon, make a fool of, play a trick upon, pull wool over one's eyes.<BR><b>2. </b>Disappoint, frustrate.<BR><b>3. </b>Beguile, wile away, while away.

decency
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Propriety, decorum, proper formality.<BR><b>2. </b>Modesty, delicacy, purity.

decent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Proper, becoming, fit, befitting, suitable, decorous, seemly, comely.<BR><b>2. </b>Modest, delicate, pure.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Tolerable, passable, moderate, respectable.

deception
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Imposture, imposition. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> deceit.<BR><b>2. </b>Cheat, ruse, wile, stratagem, chouse. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> trick.

deceptive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Deceitful, deceiving, delusive, illusive, illusory, misleading, fallacious, false.

deciduous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Botany</i>) Non perennial, temporary, caducous.

decipher
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unravel, unfold, interpret, reveal, explain, expound.<BR><b>2. </b>Read, make out.

decisive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Conclusive, final.

deck
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Adorn, embellish, decorate, ornament, array, beautify.<BR><b>2. </b>Dress, clothe, apparel, robe.<BR><b>3. </b>Cover with a deck, cover, cover in.

declaim
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Harangue, speak (<i>rhetorically</i>), mouth, rant, spout (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Recite a speech, practise speaking.

declamation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Declaiming, haranguing, mouthing, ranting, spouting (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Harangue, set speech.<BR><b>3. </b>Exercise in speaking.

declaration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affirmation, assertion, asseveration, averment, protestation, avowal.<BR><b>2. </b>Proclamation, publication, public <i>or</i> official announcement.

declare
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Affirm, assert, aver, asseverate, state, proclaim, publish, promulgate, communicate, announce, utter, make known.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Make a declaration, come out, pronounce, proclaim one's self.

declination
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bending, inclination.<BR><b>2. </b>Deterioration. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> declension, 1.<BR><b>3. </b>Deviation, departure, oblique movement.<BR><b>4. </b>Declinature. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> declension, 3.

decline
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lean downward, incline, slope.<BR><b>2. </b>Decay, sink, droop, languish, pine, fail, become feeble.<BR><b>3. </b>Deteriorate, degenerate, be impaired.<BR><b>4. </b>Decrease, lessen, diminish, wane, fall away.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Refuse, reject, avoid.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Grammar</i>) Inflect, vary.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deterioration, degeneracy, decay, diminution, falling off, declension, declination.<BR><b>2. </b>Consumption, phthisis, marasmus, atrophy, gradual wasting, progressive emaciation.

decompose
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Decompound, disintegrate, analyze, resolve, resolve into its elements.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Decay, putrefy, become corrupt, fall into decay, go to pieces, be resolved into its elements.

decomposition
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Analysis, resolution, disintegration.<BR><b>2. </b>Decay, corruption, putrescence, disintegration, crumbling, dissolution, rotting, falling to pieces.

decorate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Adorn, deck, ornament, embellish, beautify, enrich, garnish.

decoration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Adorning, decking, ornamenting, ornamentation, embellishing, embellishment, beautifying, enriching, enrichment, garnishing.<BR><b>2. </b>Ornament, embellishment, adornment, enrichment.

decorous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Decent, becoming, suitable, proper, befitting, seemly, comely, fit.

decorum
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Decency, propriety, seemliness, appropriate behavior, dignified behavior, dignity.

decoy
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Allure, lure, entice, inveigle, seduce, tempt, entrap, ensnare.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Lure, allurement.

decrease
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Diminish (<i>gradually</i>), lessen, wane, decline, ebb, subside, dwindle, contract, abate, grow less.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> Diminish, lessen, retrench, curtail, reduce, lower, make less.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Diminution, lessening, decrement, reduction, wane <i>or</i> waning, declension, decline, ebb, ebbing, subsidence, contraction, abatement.

decree
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Order, ordain, appoint, enjoin, command, determine, decide, enact.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Edict, enactment, regulation, law, order, mandate, fiat, ordinance, statute.

decrepit
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Superannuated, effete, shattered, worn <i>or</i> broken down with age, infirm through age.

decry
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Disparage, depreciate, discredit, condemn, traduce, cry down, run down, bring into disrepute, bring discredit on.
