<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Consecration, devotion.<BR><b>2. </b>Address, inscription.

deduce
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Derive, conclude, infer.

deduct
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Subtract, withdraw, remove, take away, take out.

deed
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Act, action, performance, exploit, achievement, feat.<BR><b>2. </b>Reality, fact, truth.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Indenture.

deface
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Disfigure, deform, mar, spoil, injure, soil, tarnish.

defalcate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>[<i>Applied especially to public accounts, estimates, etc.</i>] Lop, lop off, cut off, deduct a part of, retrench, curtail, reduce, abate, deduct from.

defamation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Slander, calumny, detraction, obloquy, aspersion, abuse, backbiting, scandal, false accusation.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Asperse, slander, malign, calumniate, traduce, vilify, revile, libel, blacken, abuse, blemish, run down, speak ill of.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Omission, neglect, failure.<BR><b>2. </b>Want, lack, destitution, defect, deficiency.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Fail to keep one's engagement <i>or</i> contract, break one's trust, be guilty of defaulting <i>or</i> defalcation.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Clarify, clear, purify, refine, purge of extraneous matter.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Clear, clarify, become pure, cleanse itself.<BR><b>2. </b>Go to stool, ease one's self, evacuate the bowels, void excrement.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deficiency, lack, want, destitution, default.<BR><b>2. </b>Imperfection, blemish, flaw.<BR><b>3. </b>Fault, failing, foible.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Abandon allegiance, break fealty, desert, revolt, fall away from duty.

defective
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deficient, insufficient, inadequate, incomplete.<BR><b>2. </b>Imperfect, faulty, marred.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Postpone, delay, adjourn, procrastinate, put off, stave off, let lie over.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Respectful, reverential.

defiance

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Defective, insufficient, imperfect, incomplete, inadequate, unsatisfactory.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Lat.] Shortage. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> deficiency.

defile
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Soil, dirty, stain, tarnish, make foul <i>or</i> filthy.<BR><b>2. </b>Sully, taint, pollute, corrupt, vitiate, debase, contaminate, poison.<BR><b>3. </b>Debauch, corrupt, seduce, deflour, rob of virginity.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  File off, march in a line.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Determinate, determined, defined, precisely bounded.<BR><b>2. </b>Precise, exact, determinate, certain.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Grammar</i>) Limiting, defining.

definition
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Explanation (<i>of the meaning</i>), exact meaning.<BR><b>2. </b>Description (<i>by a statement of characteristic properties</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Defining, exact statement of the meaning.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Determinate, positive, express, explicit, categorical, unconditional.<BR><b>2. </b>Final, conclusive, decisive.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dishonor, disgrace, humiliation.<BR><b>2. </b>Deterioration, abasement, debasement, degeneracy, degeneration, decadence, caducity, decline, vitiation, perversion.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Geology</i>) Wearing away (<i>of rocks, etc.</i>), abrasion.

degrade

deify
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Raise to the rank of a deity, place among the gods, apotheosize.<BR><b>2. </b>Idolize, cultivate idolatrously, make a god of, make into an object of worship, praise <i>or</i> revere as a deity.<BR><b>3. </b>Make godlike, exalt, elevate, ennoble.

deity

delicacy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pleasantness, agreeableness, deliciousness, daintiness, savoriness, relish.<BR><b>2. </b>Dainty, tidbit, titbit.<BR><b>3. </b>Fineness, softness, smoothness, tenderness, lightness, nicety, niceness, elegance.<BR><b>4. </b>Slightness, slenderness, weakness, frailty, tenderness.<BR><b>5. </b>Carefulness, scrupulousness, fastidiousness, daintiness, discrimination, tact, nice perception.<BR><b>6. </b>Refinement, purity, sensibility, fine feeling.

delirious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Insane (<i>as in fevers</i>), mad, deranged, demented, wandering, lightheaded, crazy, raving, frantic, frenzied.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Wandering (<i>as in fevers</i>), incoherence, hallucination, derangement, insanity, frenzy, raving, madness, alienation of mind.

delude
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Deceive, beguile, mislead, cheat, cozen, chouse, gull, dupe, circumvent, overreach, trick, impose upon, lead astray, lead into error.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Trick, imposition, imposture, cheat, fraud, artifice, wile, snare, ruse, dodge, fetch, clap trap.<BR><b>2. </b>Illusion, deception, fallacy, error, hallucination, mockery, phantasm, false show.

delve
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active, verb neuter</span><BR>  Dig.

demagogue
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Ringleader of the populace, factious leader, popular agitator.

demand
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Claim, require, exact, challenge, call for, ask for.<BR><b>2. </b>Necessitate, require, rightfully claim, make necessary.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Ask, inquire, make inquiry.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Claim, requisition, requirement, exaction.<BR><b>2. </b>Want, call, desire to obtain.<BR><b>3. </b>Question, inquiry, interrogation.

demented
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Idiotic, foolish, infatuated, insane, crazy, crack brained, daft, deranged.

demise
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conveyance, alienation, transfer, transferrence, making over.<BR><b>2. </b>Death (<i>of a royal</i> or <i>a distinguished person</i>), decease.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ahenate, transfer, consign, devolve, convey, make over, deliver over.<BR><b>2. </b>Bequeath, devise, will, grant by will.

democracy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Government by the people.<BR><b>2. </b>Republic, representative government.<BR><b>3. </b>[<i>U. S.</i>] Democrats, democratic party.

demolish
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Destroy, overthrow, raze, level, ruin, dash to pieces, break to pieces.

demolition
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Overthrow, destruction, ruin.

demonstrate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Prove, establish, show, make evident, make certain, show beyond the possibility of doubt.

demonstration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Proof, rigorous <i>or</i> absolute establishment.<BR><b>2. </b>Manifestation, show, exhibition, display.

demonstrative
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conclusive, apodictic, absolute, certain, producing demonstration.<BR><b>2. </b>Energetically expressive, free in expression (<i>of feeling</i>), unreserved, open, prone to display of feeling.

demoralize
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Corrupt, deprave, vitiate, deprive of moral principle.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Military</i>) Deprive of courage <i>or</i> confidence, break down the <i>morale or</i> discipline of.

demur
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hesitate, pause, stop, waver, be in doubt, stop to consider.<BR><b>2. </b>Object, raise objections, scruple, state scruples, take exceptions.

demure
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affectedly modest, prudish, overmodest, putting on shyness <i>or</i> coyness.<BR><b>2. </b>Sober, sedate, grave, modest, coy, downcast.

den
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cavern, cave.<BR><b>2. </b>[<i>Always in bad sense, implying squalor, misery</i>, or <i>vice</i>.] Haunt, retreat, resort, place of resort.

denizen
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Eng. law</i>.) Naturalized citizen, adopted citizen.<BR><b>2. </b>Inhabitant, dweller, resident.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Name, designate, entitle, style, call, dub, christen, phrase.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Arithmetic</i>) Compound.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Signify, mean, imply, betoken, indicate, typify, note, mark, designate, point out.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Fr.]<BR><b>1. </b>Catastrophe (<i>of a drama</i> or <i>a novel</i>), unravelling of the plot.<BR><b>2. </b>Issue, upshot, conclusion, termination, <i>finale</i>, consummation, winding up, finishing stroke, final event.

density
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Closeness, compactness.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Cleansing, detersive.

deteriorate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Impair, degrade, debase, vitiate, make worse.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Degenerate, decline, become impaired, grow worse.

deterioration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Debasement, degradation, depravation, vitiation, perversion.<BR><b>2. </b>Degeneration, degeneracy, caducity, decline, impairment.

determination
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Determining, settling, fixing, ascertainment, settlement, deciding, decision.<BR><b>2. </b>Decision, resolution, conclusion, judgment, purpose, resolve, result.<BR><b>3. </b>Direction, tendency, leaning.<BR><b>4. </b>Resoluteness, resolution, fixity of purpose, firmness, constancy, persistence.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Ceasing, termination.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Logic</i>) Definition, qualification, limitation, adding of determinants <i>or</i> predicates.

detest
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Hate (<i>extremely</i>), abominate, abhor, loathe, execrate, nauseate, shrink from, recoil from.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Execrable, abominable, odious, hateful, cursed, accursed, abhorred, damnable.<BR><b>2. </b>Loathsome, disgusting, sickening, repulsive, offensive, nauseating.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Explode with a loud report, detonize.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Detonize, cause to explode <i>or</i> burst with a loud report.

detonation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Explosive report, bursting noise.

detour
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Fr.] Circuitous route, indirect way, roundabout way.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Digress, diverge, deflect, veer, tack, wheel, turn aside, alter one's course, wheel about.<BR><b>2. </b>Err, stray, swerve, wander, go astray, go out of one's way, lose one's way.<BR><b>3. </b>Differ, vary, diverge.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Turn aside, cause to deviate.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Discriminating, knowing, sagacious, perspicacious, judicious, acute, intelligent, ingenious, clear headed, clear sighted, keen sighted, quick sighted, eagle eyed, hawk eyed, Argus eyed.

discharge
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unload, disburden, unburden, relieve of a load.<BR><b>2. </b>Emit, expel, excrete, eject, void, throw off, send out, give forth.<BR><b>3. </b>Set off, fire off, let fly, give vent to, shoot, fire.<BR><b>4. </b>Pay, liquidate, cash.<BR><b>5. </b>Release, absolve, exonerate, acquit, clear, relieve, liberate, free, set free.<BR><b>6. </b>Dismiss, discard, cashier, break, turn away, send away.<BR><b>7. </b>Remove, destroy, put away, clear from.<BR><b>8. </b>Perform, execute, fulfil, observe, acquit one's self of.<BR><b>9. </b>Remove, take out (<i>as the cargo of a vessel</i>).<BR><b>10. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Cancel, rescind, annul, nullify, invalidate, make void.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unloading, disburdening.<BR><b>2. </b>Emission, ejection, expulsion, excretion, vent, evacuation, voiding.<BR><b>3. </b>Firing, explosion, blast, burst, firing off.<BR><b>4. </b>Observance, performance, fulfilment, execution.<BR><b>5. </b>Payment, settlement, liquidation, satisfaction, clearance.<BR><b>6. </b>Release, liberation, exemption.<BR><b>7. </b>Acquittal, exoneration, absolution.

disciple
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Scholar, pupil, learner.<BR><b>2. </b>Follower, adherent, supporter.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Training, drilling, drill, exercise, diligent practice.<BR><b>2. </b>Control, regulation, government, good order, subjection.<BR><b>3. </b>Branch of knowledge, elements of culture.<BR><b>4. </b>Punishment, chastisement, correction.<BR><b>5. </b>Rule of practice, regulations.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Instruct, train, breed, educate, teach, drill, exercise, form, bring up.<BR><b>2. </b>Regulate, control, govern, school, bring under subjection.<BR><b>3. </b>Punish, chastise, correct.

disclaim
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disown, disavow, deny any knowledge of.<BR><b>2. </b>Renounce, reject, cast off.

disclaimer
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disavowal.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Renunciation (<i>of a claim</i> or <i>a title</i>), relinquishment.

disclose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Uncover, expose, bring to view, bring to light.<BR><b>2. </b>Reveal, divulge, show, unfold, unveil, tell, utter, betray, communicate, lay open, make known.

discomfit
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Defeat, overthrow, rout, overcome, overpower, conquer, vanquish, subdue, beat, checkmate, put to flight, put down, get the upper hand of, scatter in flight.<BR><b>2. </b>Foil, disconcert, balk, frustrate one's plans perplex.

discomfiture
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Rout, defeat, overthrow, ruin.

discomfort
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Uneasiness, disquiet, inquietude, trouble, annoyance.

discompose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disorder, derange, disarrange, embroil, jumble, unsettle, confuse, disturb, throw into disorder <i>or</i> confusion.<BR><b>2. </b>Displease, disquiet, ruffle, agitate, harass, worry, annoy, plague, trouble, vex, fret, nettle, irritate, provoke, chafe.<BR><b>3. </b>Disconcert, perplex, bewilder, embarrass, abash, put out.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Frustrate, defeat, balk, baffle, upset, thwart, contravene, interrupt, undo.<BR><b>2. </b>Discompose, confuse, perplex, bewilder, embarrass, disturb, abash, put out, unbalance, throw off one's balance.

disconnect
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Disjoin, separate, disengage, disunite, sever. Compare Detach.

disconsolate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inconsolable, desolate, forlorn, heart broken, broken hearted, comfortless, cheerless, sorrowful, melancholy, sad.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Dissatisfaction, uneasiness, inquietude, restlessness, discontentment.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disagreement, contention, strife, dissension, variance, opposition, wrangling, difference, rupture, falling out.<BR><b>2. </b>Dissonance, discordance, harshness, jarring, want of harmony.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Allowance, deduction, reduction, drawback, abatement, rebate.

discourage
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dishearten, dispirit, depress, deject.<BR><b>2. </b>Dissuade, deter, keep back.<BR><b>3. </b>Disfavor, discountenance, throw cold water upon, put a damper on, cover with a wet blanket.

discourse
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Reason, reasoning faculty, reasoning.<BR><b>2. </b>Dissertation, treatise, disquisition, homily, sermon.<BR><b>3. </b>Conversation, talk, converse, oral communication, verbal intercourse.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Speak, expatiate, hold forth, deliver a discourse.<BR><b>2. </b>Talk, converse, parley, confer, advise, hold a conversation, hold a parley <i>or</i> conference, talk together.<BR><b>3. </b>Reason, make inferences, draw conclusions.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Utter, emit, give forth, pour forth.

discourteous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Uncivil, impolite, uncourtly, uncomplaisant, ungentlemanly, disrespectful, inurbane, unmannerly, uncourteous, brusk <i>or</i> brusque, abrupt, rude, ill bred, ill mannered.

discredit
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Doubt, question, loss of credit <i>or</i> credence.<BR><b>2. </b>Disrepute, dishonor, disgrace, reproach, opprobrium, obloquy, odium, ignominy, ill repute.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disbelieve, give no credit to, place no confidence in, refuse credence to, question, doubt.<BR><b>2. </b>Disgrace, dishonor, bring reproach upon, make disreputable, blow upon, destroy confidence in, bring into disfavor, make distasteful, deprive of credit.

discrete
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Separate, distinct, disjunct, discontinuous.<BR><b>2. </b>Disjunctive, discretive.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Prudence (<i>in things immediately before us</i>), judgment, caution, wariness, carefulness, circumspection, considerateness, judiciousness. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> prudence.<BR><b>2. </b>Sound judgment, good sense, discrimination, mature judgment, maturity, responsibility.<BR><b>3. </b>Will, pleasure, choice, liberty of judgment.

discursive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reasoning, argumentative, capable of reasoning.<BR><b>2. </b>Traversing a field of particulars, derived through particulars, passing from many to one, from manifoldness to unity.<BR><b>3. </b>Roving, wandering, rambling, desultory, taking a wide range.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Despise, contemn, scout, scorn, spurn, look down upon, hold in contempt, consider beneath notice.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Scorn, contempt, contumely, haughtiness, superciliousness, arrogance, <i>hauteur</i>.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unbodied, incorporeal, immaterial, spiritual, bodiless, divested of the body.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Play, amusement, diversion, pastime, sport, merriment.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Play, gambol, frisk, frolic, sport, make merry, wanton, caper.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Amuse, divert, entertain, cheer, solace, beguile, relax.

dispose
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Arrange, range, rank, group, marshal, set, place, place in order.<BR><b>2. </b>Adjust, regulate, settle, determine, set right.<BR><b>3. </b>Incline, lead, move, induce, bias, predispose.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Control, regulate, rule, settle, decide.<BR><b>2. </b>Bargain, compound, make terms, arrange, have an understanding.

dispute

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Anatomy.<BR><b>2. </b>Scrutiny, analysis, examination, investigation, sifting.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Conceal, hide, disguise, cloak, cover.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Conceal one's real purposes, disguise the feelings <i>or</i> character.

disseminate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Spread, propagate, diffuse, disperse, circulate, promulgate, spread abroad.

dissent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Withhold assent, refuse <i>or</i> decline to agree, disagree (<i>in an opinion</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Refuse to conform (<i>to the Church of England</i>), be a non conformist.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disagreement, difference of opinion.<BR><b>2. </b>Non conformity, refusal to conform (<i>to the Church of England</i>).

dissenter
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Non conformist, sectary, dissident.

dissertation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Disquisition, treatise, discourse, essay.

dissident
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Dissenter, non conformist, sectary.

dissimilar
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unlike, different, heterogeneous, diverse, divergent, various.

dissipate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disperse, dispel, scatter, drive away.<BR><b>2. </b>Waste, squander, lavish, consume, spend lavishly, throw away.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vanish, disappear, scatter, disperse.<BR><b>2. </b>Live dissolutely, be dissolute, practise debauchery, indulge in dissipation.<BR><b>3. </b>Live idly and luxuriously, enervate one's self, be an idler and spendthrift.

dissociate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Disjoin, disunite, separate, sever, dissever, divide, part, sunder, detach, disconnect.

dissociation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Disunion, separation, severance, serving, dividing, disjoining, dissevering, parting, sundering, detachment, disconnection.

dissolute
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Loose, licentious, lax, debauched, wanton, lewd, corrupt, profligate, rakish, depraved, dissipated, reprobate, abandoned, graceless, shameless, wild.

dissolve
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Liquefy, melt.<BR><b>2. </b>Disunite, sever, separate, divide, loose, disorganize, break apart.<BR><b>3. </b>Destroy, ruin.<BR><b>4. </b>Terminate, bring to an end, put an end to, break up.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Melt, liquefy, be melted.<BR><b>2. </b>Vanish, disappear, fade, melt away, be dissipated.<BR><b>3. </b>Perish, crumble, be destroyed.

dissonant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Discordant, unharmonious, harsh, grating, jarring, out of tune.<BR><b>2. </b>Disagreeing, incongruous, inconsistent, discrepant.

dissuade
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Urge <i>or</i> exhort against, attempt to divert, urge not to.<BR><b>2. </b>Turn from a purpose, divert by persuasion, render averse, persuade not to.

distain
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Stain.

distance
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Remoteness.<BR><b>2. </b>Degree of remoteness <i>or</i> removal.<BR><b>3. </b>Remote region, distant quarter.<BR><b>4. </b>Interval, space, space intervening.<BR><b>5. </b>Reserve, coldness, stiffness, distant behavior, frigidity.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Outdo, surpass, excel, outstrip, leave behind.

distant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Remote, far.<BR><b>2. </b>Reserved, frigid, cold, cool, stiff, uncordial.<BR><b>3. </b>Slight, faint, indirect, indistinct, obscure.

distaste
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disrelish, disgust.<BR><b>2. </b>Aversion, dislike, repugnance, displeasure, dissatisfaction.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Nauseous, nauseating, unpalatable, unsavory, loathsome, disgusting.<BR><b>2. </b>Disagreeable, offensive, unpleasant, un pleasing, repugnant, repulsive.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Expand, dilate, bloat, enlarge, swell, stretch, swell out.

distention
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> distension

distinct
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Separate, different.<BR><b>2. </b>Definite, defined, clear, plain, unmistakable, unconfused, well defined.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Discrimination, notice of difference, distinguishing.<BR><b>2. </b>Difference, point of difference, characteristic difference.<BR><b>3. </b>Repute, reputation, celebrity, note, name, fame, renown, account, credit, respectability, eminence, superiority.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Distinguishing, discriminative, characteristic.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Illustrious, famous, noted, eminent, celebrated.<BR><b>2. </b>Conspicuous, marked, extraordinary, supreme, transcendent, consummate.

distracted
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Deranged, insane, mad, frantic, furious, raving, wild, crazed, beside one's self.

Take, seize, distrain.

Suspect, fancy, apprehend.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Question, hesitate to believe, consider questionable, have doubts about.<BR><b>2. </b>Distrust, suspect, not confide in.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indecision, hesitation, hesitancy, irresolution, uncertainty, suspense, misgiving.<BR><b>2. </b>Suspicion, distrust, mistrust.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[<i>Said of women</i>.] Slovenly (<i>in dress</i>), slatternly, ill dressed, vulgar looking, awkward.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Slattern, trollop, ill dressed <i>or</i> vulgar looking woman.

down
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">preposition</span><BR> <b>1. </b>From the top to the bottom of.<BR><b>2. </b>Along the course of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR><b>1. </b>Downward, in a descending course, from a high to a low position.<BR><b>2. </b>On the ground, the floor, etc., prostrate.<BR><b>3. </b>From a thin to a dense state, into a denser consistence.<BR><b>4. </b>Below the horizon.<BR><b>5. </b>Into disrepute, into disgrace, into disfavor <i>or</i> disuse.<BR><b>6. </b>Low, humbled, in distress, in adversity.

downfall
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Ruin, destruction, fall.

dowry
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Dower.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Slumber, drowse, nap, sleep lightly, be half asleep, be drowsy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Light sleep, drowse, nap, light slumber.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strumpet, prostitute, trull. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> courtesan.<BR><b>2. </b>Slut, draggle tail, trollop, slattern, dowdy, slovenly woman.<BR><b>3. </b>Brownish yellow cloth, dull brown woollen stuff, dun colored cloth.<BR><b>4. </b>Dun, dull brown, brownish yellow, dun color.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Dun, dull brown, brownish yellow.

draft
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Drawing, selection.<BR><b>2. </b>Bill of exchange.<BR><b>3. </b>[Written also <i>Draught</i>.] Outline, delineation, rough sketch, rough copy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Detach, select.<BR><b>2. </b>Make an outline of, make a draft of, make a rough sketch of.

drag
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Draw, pull, haul, tug, draw heavily and slowly.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Trail, be drawn along.<BR><b>2. </b>Linger, move slowly, make slow progress.

drain
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Draw off.<BR><b>2. </b>Empty, exhaust.<BR><b>3. </b>Make dry, clear of water <i>or</i> moisture.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Flow off.<BR><b>2. </b>Become dry.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Sewer, channel, trench, ditch, water course.

drama
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dramatic composition, play, theatrical piece, spectacle.<BR><b>2. </b>Dramatic literature.<BR><b>3. </b>Historic <i>or</i> cosmical pageant (<i>series of events invested with dramatic unity</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>The stage, dramatic representation, histrionic art.

drastic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Powerful, active, efficacious.

draw
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pull, drag, haul, tug, pull along.<BR><b>2. </b>Attract, bring toward, pull toward.<BR><b>3. </b>Suck, drain, suck dry.<BR><b>4. </b>Inhale, inspire, breathe in, take into the lungs.<BR><b>5. </b>Extract, take out, draw out.<BR><b>6. </b>Induce, move, lead, allure, entice, engage, persuade, influence.<BR><b>7. </b>Produce, bring, bear.<BR><b>8. </b>Extend, protract, stretch, lengthen out.<BR><b>9. </b>Delineate, sketch, depict, trace, trace out, describe (<i>as a line</i>).<BR><b>10. </b>Deduce, derive, infer.<BR><b>11. </b>Extort, force out.<BR><b>12. </b>Compose, write, prepare, draw up.<BR><b>13. </b>Gain, win.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Pull.<BR><b>2. </b>Move, come, go, proceed.<BR><b>3. </b>Sketch, practise drawing <i>or</i> the art of delineation.<BR><b>4. </b>Produce inflammation, vesicate, blister.<BR><b>5. </b>Request payment by draft, make a draft.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disadvantage, detriment, fault, imperfection, deficiency, defect.<BR><b>2. </b>Discount, deduction, reduction, rebate, abatement, allowance.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Course, bearing, direction.<BR><b>2. </b>Aim, purpose, intention, intent, proposal, design, scope, tendency, object, mark.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Geology</i>) Diluvium, diluvial formations.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Mining</i>.) Passage (<i>under ground, between shafts</i>).<BR><b>5. </b>Sweep, rush, current, sweeping pressure, driving impulse.<BR><b>6. </b>Heap, heaped pile, driven mass, drifted pile.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Drive into heaps.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Float, be wafted, be borne <i>or</i> carried by the current <i>or</i> aimlessly.<BR><b>2. </b>Accumulate in heaps, be driven into heaps.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Without a centre, deviating from the centre, deviating from a circle.<BR><b>2. </b>With different centres, non concentric.<BR><b>3. </b>Irregular, abnormal, anomalous, peculiar, uncommon, unnatural, singular, strange, wayward, odd, aberrant, erratic, whimsical.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deviation from circularity, ellipticity, oblateness, flatness, flattening.<BR><b>2. </b>Distance from centre to focus.<BR><b>3. </b>Irregularity, peculiarity, oddness, oddity, singularity, waywardness, strangeness, aberration.

echo
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reverberation, reflected sound, repercussion of sound.<BR><b>2. </b>Assenting repetition, slavish imitation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Resound, reverberate, be sounded back.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reverberate, re echo.<BR><b>2. </b>Repeat, sound again.<BR><b>3. </b>Sound loudly, resound, reverberate.

eclectic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Selecting, selective.

eclecticism

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Occultation, eclipsing.<BR><b>2. </b>Obscuration, darkening, dimming, clouding, veiling, hiding, shrouding, disappearance, concealment, vanishing, occultation.<BR><b>3. </b>Extinguishment, extinction, obliteration, blotting out, destruction, annihilation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Darken, obscure, dim.<BR><b>2. </b>Cloud, veil, shroud, hide, hide from view.<BR><b>3. </b>Throw into the shade, utterly surpass, put out of competition.<BR><b>4. </b>Extinguish, blot out, put out, annihilate, annul.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Suffer eclipse, be eclipsed, darkened, veiled, hidden, dimmed, <i>or</i> obscured.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Eject, discharge, exhale, breathe, breathe out, send forth, throw out, give out.<BR><b>2. </b>Issue (<i>for circulation</i>), put into circulation.

emollient
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Softening, relaxing, soothing.

emolument
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Gain, lucre, pay, compensation, remuneration, profits, wages, salary, stipend, income, hire, pecuniary profit.<BR><b>2. </b>Advantage, profit, benefit.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Feeling, passion, excitement (<i>of sensibility</i>), mental agitation.

emphasis
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stress (<i>on certain words</i>), force of utterance.<BR><b>2. </b>Impressiveness, significance, weight.

emphatic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>emphatical</b>)</b><BR> Expressive, significant, strong, forcible, energetic, decided, positive, unequivocal, distinct.

empirical
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> empiric

empiricism
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dependence on experience, reliance on the evidence of sense alone.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Philos.</i>) Empirical philosophy, sensationalism, sensualism, theory of the sole validity of sense.<BR><b>3. </b>Quackery, charlatanism, charlatanry.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Busy, engage, engross, exercise, occupy.<BR><b>2. </b>Use, apply, make use of.<BR><b>3. </b>Intrust with an agency, enlist in one's service, give employment to.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> employment.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>[Written also <i>Intwine</i>.]<BR><b>1. </b>Twine, twist together.<BR><b>2. </b>Encircle, surround, embrace, wind about, wind around.

enumerate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Reckon, compute, count, number, tell, cite, recount, numerate, call over, relate in detail, mention one by one, specify.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Declare, speak, proclaim, publish, express, relate, promulgate, state, propound, announce, enounce.<BR><b>2. </b>Utter, pronounce, articulate.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Articulate, speak, utter articulate sounds.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Enfold, inwrap, wrap, fold, wrap up, put a wrapper about.<BR><b>2. </b>Surround, encircle, encompass, enfold, fold, cover, hide.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> envelope.

enviable

ephemeral
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  short lived, transitory, transient, fleeting, flitting, evanescent, fugitive, fugacious, momentary, brief.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Narrative, heroic.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Narrative, poem, epic poem, heroic poem.

epicure
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Gourmand, <i>gourmet</i>, refined glutton, dainty feeder, high liver, gustatory sensualist, voluptuary of the palate.<BR><b>2. </b>Voluptuary, sensualist, Sybarite, Epicurean, free liver, man of pleasure.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> epicure, 2.<BR><b>2. </b>Adherent of Epicurus, hedonist, eudaemonist.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>epidemical</b>)</b><BR> General, prevailing, prevalent, pandemic.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cuticle, scarf skin.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Botany</i>) Exterior coating.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Inscription (<i>on a tomb or monument</i>), lapidary composition.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Name, appellation, designation, title, qualifying word <i>or</i> term, descriptive term, predicate.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Abridgment, abstract, compend, compendium, conspectus, syllabus, brief, breviary, summary, synopsis, digest, sum and substance.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Abridge, abstract, summarize, abbreviate, shorten, condense, reduce, contract, make an abstract of.

epoch
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Period, date, era, age, point <i>or</i> period of time (<i>remarkable for some event</i>).

equable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Even, uniform, equal, steady, regular, even tempered, always the same.

equal
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Like, alike, tantamount, equivalent; of the same extent, measure, degree, <i>or</i> value, identical in quantity <i>or</i> value.<BR><b>2. </b>Of the same rank.<BR><b>3. </b>Uniform, even, regular, equable.<BR><b>4. </b>Impartial, unbiassed, equitable, fair, just, even handed.<BR><b>5. </b>Proportionate, commensurate.<BR><b>6. </b>Adequate, competent, fit, sufficient, of sufficient strength <i>or</i> ability.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  peer, compeer, fellow.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Equalize, make equal, make alike.<BR><b>2. </b>Rival, rise to the same level with.<BR><b>3. </b>Be adequate to, be sufficient for, be equal to, be commensurate with.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Accoutrement, furniture, apparatus, rigging, gear, outfit.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Upright, just, impartial, unbiassed, unprejudiced, evenhanded.<BR><b>2. </b>Reasonable, fair, impartial, just, right, proper.

equity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Justice, right.<BR><b>2. </b>Justice, rectitude, uprightness, righteousness, impartiality, fairness, reasonableness, fair play.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Theoretical <i>or</i> ideal justice, justice (<i>as distinguished from conformity to mere enactments or statutes</i>), spirit of law (<i>as against its mere letter</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Equitable claim.

equivalent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Equal, commensurate, tantamount, equipollent.<BR><b>2. </b>Synonymous, interchangeable, equipollent, of the same meaning <i>or</i> import.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ambiguous, of doubtful meaning, to be taken in a double sense.<BR><b>2. </b>Uncertain, doubtful, dubious, indeterminate.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Elude, escape, escape from, steal away from, get away from (<i>by artifice</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Avoid, shun, decline.<BR><b>3. </b>Surpass (<i>one's powers</i>), baffle, foil, elude.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Equivocate, shuffle, fence, quibble, dodge, prevaricate, palter.

evasive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Equivocating, shuffling, sophistical, elusive, elusory, shifty.

even

everlasting
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Endless, unending, ever during, perpetual, incessant, ceaseless, continual, uninterrupted, interminable, unceasing, never ceasing, never ending, eternal.<BR><b>2. </b>Imperishable, undying, never dying, ever living, deathless, immortal.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Continual, ceaseless, unintermitting, perpetual, constant, never remitted, uninterrupted.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Eternity.<BR><b>2. </b>Cudweed, goldylocks, immortelle.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Law</i>.) Dispossession, deprivation.

evidence
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Testimony, proof, ground of belief.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Prove, show, manifest, evince, make manifest, make clear.

evident
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Plain, clear, manifest, apparent, obvious, palpable, patent, unmistakable.

evil
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bad, ill.<BR><b>2. </b>Wicked, sinful, vicious, corrupt, perverse, wrong, base, vile, nefarious, malicious, malign, bad.<BR><b>3. </b>Mischievous, hurtful, harmful, injurious, pernicious, destructive, baneful, noxious, deleterious, bad.<BR><b>4. </b>Unhappy, unfortunate, adverse, unpropitious, disastrous, calamitous, woful, bad.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Calamity, ill, woe, misery, pain, suffering, sorrow, misfortune, disaster, reverse.<BR><b>2. </b>Wickedness, sin, depravity, malignity, wicked disposition, corruption, wrong, viciousness, baseness, badness.<BR><b>3. </b>Wrong, injury, mischief, harm.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Disembowel, embowel, paunch, gut, take out the bowels of.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Summon, call forth, call up, summon forth.<BR><b>2. </b>Excite, arouse, elicit, call out, rouse, provoke.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Evolving, unfolding, expansion, evolvement, development.<BR><b>2. </b>Descent by continuous differentiation, development, doctrine of development, ascent from simplicity to complexity.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Military</i>) Movement, marching.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Mathematics</i>) Extraction of roots.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Geometry</i>) Unfolding, unrolling (<i>of a curve</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Unroll, unfold, expand, open, develop.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strict, rigid, rigorous, severe, scrupulous.<BR><b>2. </b>Precise, without the least error.<BR><b>3. </b>Accurate, correct, close, literal, faithful.<BR><b>4. </b>Accurate, critical, nice.<BR><b>5. </b>Methodical, regular, precise, careful, punctilious, punctual, orderly.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Extort, require authoritatively.<BR><b>2. </b>Claim, demand.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Hyperbole, overstatement, stretching, extravagant statement, high coloring.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Atone for, do penance for, make satisfaction or reparation for.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Atonement, satisfaction, reparation.<BR><b>2. </b>Expiatory offering, penitential act.

expiration
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Emission of breath.<BR><b>2. </b>Death, decease, demise, exit, departure.<BR><b>3. </b>Termination, cessation, close, end, conclusion.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Breathe out, emit from the lungs.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Decease, draw the last breath. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> die.<BR><b>2. </b>End, terminate, cease, conclude, stop, come to an end.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Illustrative, elucidative, expository, serving to explain.<BR><b>2. </b>Accounting, justifying, justificative, justificatory, warranting, giving reasons, vindicative, vindicatory, tracing to causes <i>or</i> principles.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Interpretation, to be accounted for <i>or</i> made intelligible.

explicit
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Express, clear, plain, positive, definite, determinate, categorical, unambiguous, unreserved.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Discharge, burst, displode, detonate.<BR><b>2. </b>Discard, repudiate, scout, scorn, contemn, cry down, treat with contempt, bring into disrepute.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Burst, displode, detonate, be discharged.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[<i>Recent</i>.] Exploiting. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> the verb.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Examination, scrutiny, inquiry, research, inquisition.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Explanatory, illustrative, exegetical, elucidative.

expostulate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>[Followed by <i>with</i>.] Remonstrate, reason earnestly and dissuasively.

exposure
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exposing. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> expose, in all senses.<BR><b>2. </b>Position (<i>with reference to the points of the compass</i>), aspect, prospect, outlook, frontage, front.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Visionary, imaginative, whimsical, capricious.<BR><b>2. </b>Chimerical, imaginary, ideal, fantastical, wild.

fancy
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Imagination (<i>properly, as exercised in sportive</i> or <i>whimsical moods</i>), <i>which see</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Pleasing conceit, happy conception, striking thought, ideal image, bright stroke.<BR><b>3. </b>Notion, idea, thought, conception, conceit, impression, apprehension, image.<BR><b>4. </b>Liking, fondness, inclination, <i>penchant</i>, taste.<BR><b>5. </b>Caprice, humor, whim, crotchet, quirk, freak, vagary, whimsey, maggot, fantasy, odd fancy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Imagine, think, suppose, apprehend, conjecture, believe, take it.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conceive, imagine, form a conception of, figure to one's self.<BR><b>2. </b>Like, be pleased with, have a fancy for.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Imaginative, of the fancy, fancied.<BR><b>2. </b>Ornamental (<i>rather than useful</i>), elegant, fine, nice.<BR><b>3. </b>Fanciful, extravagant, beyond all real worth.

fanfare
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Fr.] Flourish of trumpets.

fang
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Tusk, pointed tooth.<BR><b>2. </b>Claw, talon, nail.

fantasia
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Music</i>) Fantastical air, capricious composition, <i>capriccio</i>.

fantastic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>fantastical</b>)<BR><b>1. </b>Imaginary, fanciful, chimerical, visionary, unreal, merely ideal.<BR><b>2. </b>Whimsical, capricious, odd, queer, grotesque, strange, wild, <i>bizarre</i>.

fantasy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> fancy.

farce
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Burlesque, caricature, travesty, parody, after piece, low comedy, ludicrous representation.<BR><b>2. </b>Mere show, ridiculous pageantry, empty parade, utter sham.

farewell
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb, interjection</span><BR>  Adieu, good by.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Adieu, valediction, leave taking.<BR><b>2. </b>Leave, departure, last look, last glance.

farrow
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Litter of pigs.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active, verb neuter</span> <BR> Bring forth, bear (<i>said only of swine</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Gone without calving (<i>said only of cows</i>).

fascinate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stupefy, bewitch, transfix, overpower, affect <i>or</i> bind with a spell.<BR><b>2. </b>Charm, enchant, bewitch, enrapture, entrance, captivate, catch, delight, enamour.

fascination
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Enchantment, spell, charm, witchery, witchcraft, magic, sorcery.

fashion
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Form, figure, shape, make, cut, cast, stamp, mould, pattern, model, appearance, conformation, configuration.<BR><b>2. </b>Way, manner, method, sort.<BR><b>3. </b>Custom (<i>particularly as respects dress</i>), mode, style, usage, conventionality, conventionalism, general practice.<BR><b>4. </b>Gentility, high life, formal breeding.<BR><b>5. </b>People of fashion, the <i>beau monde</i>, the elegant world, the gay world.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Form, shape, mould, make, give figure to.<BR><b>2. </b>Adapt, accommodate, fit, suit, adjust.

fashionable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>According to (prevailing) fashion, in fashion, <i>a la mode</i>, the rage, having a run.<BR><b>2. </b>Following fashion, addicted to fashion, who set fashion, of fashion, who affect elegance.<BR><b>3. </b>Customary, usual, prevailing, current, in vogue.

fast
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Abstain from food, forbear eating, go without food, go hungry.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fasting, abstinence from food.<BR><b>2. </b>Fast day, day of fasting, banyan day.<BR><b>3. </b>Time of fasting.<BR><b>4. </b>Rope (<i>to fasten a vessel to wharf</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fastened, fixed, close, tight.<BR><b>2. </b>Immovable, firm.<BR><b>3. </b>Constant, steadfast, stanch.<BR><b>4. </b>Fortified, strong, impregnable.<BR><b>5. </b>Sound, deep, profound.<BR><b>6. </b>Swift, quick, fleet, rapid.<BR><b>7. </b>Dissipated, wild, giddy, reckless, thoughtless, thriftless, extravagant.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Firmly, tightly, immovably.<BR><b>2. </b>Swiftly, quickly, rapidly.<BR><b>3. </b>Extravagantly, prodigally, recklessly, wildly.

fasten
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Secure, bind, tie, attach, make fast, belay (<i>naut.</i>), bend (<i>naut.</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Join, connect, unite, hold together.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Be fixed, fix one's self, cling, cleave, catch hold.

fastidious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Squeamish, difficult, queasy, critical, dainty, over nice, over delicate, hard to please.

fastness
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fort, fortress, stronghold, castle, fortified place.

fatal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deadly, mortal, lethal.<BR><b>2. </b>Calamitous, destructive, ruinous, mischievous, baneful, baleful, pernicious, most harmful.<BR><b>3. </b>Fraught with fate, fateful.

fathom
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Six feet, two yards.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sound, try the depth of, measure by a sounding line.<BR><b>2. </b>Divine, penetrate, reach, understand, comprehend.

fatigue
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Weariness, lassitude, exhaustion.<BR><b>2. </b>Labor, toil, hardship.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Military</i>) Extra duty (<i>distinct from that of arms</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Tire, weary, exhaust, jade, fag.

fatten
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Make fat.<BR><b>2. </b>Fertilize, make fertile.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Grow fat.

fatuity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foolishness, imbecility, idiocy, feebleness of intellect, want of understanding.<BR><b>2. </b>Folly, madness, inane absurdity, infatuation.

fatuous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foolish, witless, drivelling, idiotic.<BR><b>2. </b>Infatuated, mad, senseless, absurdly foolish.<BR><b>3. </b>Illusory, deceptive.

fault
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Defect, blemish, flaw, imperfection, failing, weakness, frailty, moral defect.<BR><b>2. </b>Misdeed, misdemeanor, offence, trespass, wrong, delinquency, transgression, error, lapse, slip, indiscretion.<BR><b>3. </b>Mistake (<i>of judgment</i>), error, slip.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Default, lack, want.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Geology</i>) Dislocation, disturbance of strata.

fauna
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Animals.

favorable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Friendly, kind, willing, well disposed, propitions, auspicious.<BR><b>2. </b>Conducive, contributing, propitious.<BR><b>3. </b>Advantageous, beneficial, auspicious, convenient, suitable, adapted, fit.

fawn
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Young deer.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Crouch, cringe, bow, stoop, kneel, creep, dangle, fall on one's knees, curry favor, play the sycophant.

fealty
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Allegiance, homage, loyalty (<i>to a feudal lord</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Fidelity, loyalty, faithfulness, honor, good faith, devotion.

feasible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Practicable.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Act, deed, exploit, achievement.<BR><b>2. </b>Trick, act of dexterity.

feature
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lineament.<BR><b>2. </b>Cast of the face, turn of expression.<BR><b>3. </b>Fashion, make, conformation, aspect, appearance.<BR><b>4. </b>Outline, prominent part.<BR><b>5. </b>Characteristic, trait, point, item, mark.

fecundity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fruitfulness, fertility, productiveness, prolific character <i>or</i> quality.

feeble
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Weak, not strong.<BR><b>2. </b>Debilitated, enervated, sickly, infirm, languishing, languid, declining, drooping, frail.<BR><b>3. </b>Faint, imperfect, dim, without vigor, lacking intensity <i>or</i> vividness <i>or</i> force.

feed
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Give food to, furnish with provisions, supply with nourishment.<BR><b>2. </b>Supply, contribute to, provide for.<BR><b>3. </b>Nourish, cherish, sustain.<BR><b>4. </b>Supply with material.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Eat, take food, take nourishment.<BR><b>2. </b>Subsist, sustain life.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Food (<i>for beasts</i>), provender, fodder.<BR><b>2. </b>Allowance (<i>of fodder</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Feeding mechanism, feeder.

feign
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Invent, imagine, devise, fabricate, forge.<BR><b>2. </b>Counterfeit, simulate, affect, assume, pretend to, put on, make a show of.

feint
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pretence, blind, make believe, false appearance.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Military</i>) Mock attack, pretended movement.

felicitate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Congratulate, wish joy to, rejoice with.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Rarer</i>.) Delight, bless, beatify, happify (<i>rare</i>), fill with happiness.

felicitous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fit, appropriate, apt, pertinent, opportune, seasonable, well timed, happy, skilful, ingenious.<BR><b>2. </b>Prosperous, successful, fortunate, lucky, auspicious, propitious.

fell
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Cruel, inhuman, barbarous, ruthless, relentless, unrelenting, implacable, pitiless, malignant, malign, malicious, savage, ferocious, sanguinary, bloody, blood thirsty, Vandalic.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Prostrate, level, hurl down, knock down, lay prostrate, bring to the ground.<BR><b>2. </b>Cut down, hew down, lay low.<BR><b>3. </b>Hem (<i>the lap of a seam</i>).

felon
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Culprit, criminal, malefactor, convict, outlaw.<BR><b>2. </b>Whitlow.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> felonious.

felony
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Crime (<i>punishable by death</i> or <i>by imprisonment</i>), high crime, heinous crime, gross offence.

fencing
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Manual defence (<i>with small swords</i> or <i>foils</i>), art of self defence, swordsmanship, fence.

ferment
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Yeast, leaven, barm.<BR><b>2. </b>Fermentation, fungic transformation.<BR><b>3. </b>Agitation, commotion, tumult, heat, glow, fever, state of excitement.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Set in fermentation, set fermenting, produce fermentation in, transform by means of a ferment.<BR><b>2. </b>Excite, agitate, heat.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Work, be in a ferment, undergo fermentation, be fermented.<BR><b>2. </b>Be excited, be agitated, be on fire.

ferocious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Untamed (<i>like a wild beast</i>), savage, fierce, wild, ravenous, rapacious, ferine.<BR><b>2. </b>Barbarous, cruel, inhuman, brutal, fell, ruthless, relentless, merciless, pitiless, sanguinary, bloody, Vandalic.

ferocity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Savageness, fierceness, ferociousness, wildness, rapacity.<BR><b>2. </b>Barbarity, cruelty, inhumanity.

fertile
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Prolific, fecund, breeding, bearing.<BR><b>2. </b>Fruitful, productive, rich, plenteous, luxuriant, exuberant, teeming.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Botany</i>) Fruit bearing, pistillate, female.

fertilize
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Enrich, make fertile, make fruitful.<BR><b>2. </b>Fecundate, impregnate, supply with pollen <i>or</i> semen.

fervent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hot, glowing, melting, seething.<BR><b>2. </b>Ardent, earnest, eager, zealous, warm, glowing, animated, impassioned, fervid.

fervid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hot, burning, boiling, seething, fiery, fervent.<BR><b>2. </b>Ardent, earnest, glowing. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> fervent, 2.

fervor
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Heat, warmth.<BR><b>2. </b>Ardor, intensity, zeal, earnestness, eagerness, fervency.

festal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Convivial. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> festive.

fester
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rankle, corrupt, suppurate, ulcerate.<BR><b>2. </b>Become malignant, grow virulent <i>or</i> violent, rankle.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pustule, sore, abscess, imposthume, gathering.<BR><b>2. </b>Festering, rankling.

festival
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Feast, holiday, festive celebration, (joyful) anniversary, day of rejoicing, <i>fete</i>.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Convivial, jovial, joyous, gay, merry, mirthful, festal.

fetid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Stinking, offensive, noisome, mephitic, rank, rancid, malodorous, strong smelling, rank smelling.

fetter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Shackle (<i>for the feet</i>), chain, bond, clog, hamper.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Shackle (<i>the feet</i>), clog, trammel, hamper, put fetters on.<BR><b>2. </b>Chain, bind, tie, confine, restrain, hamper, trammel, encumber.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Quarrel, broil, contention, clashing, dissension, jarring, rupture, bickering, falling out.<BR><b>2. </b>Blood feud, hereditary enmity, clan quarrel, family feud.<BR><b>3. </b>Fee, fief.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Decree, order, ordinance, command.

fickle
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Wavering, inconstant, unsteady, unstable, variable, vacillating, volatile, mercurial, changeable, fitful, irresolute, unsettled, capricious, like a weather cock.

fiction
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Invention, fancy, fantasy, imagination.<BR><b>2. </b>Novel, romance, work of fiction, feigned story.<BR><b>3. </b>Fabrication, figment, invention, fable, falsehood, lie.<BR><b>4. </b>Fictitious literature.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Feigned, invented, imaginary, fanciful, unreal, purely ideal.<BR><b>2. </b>False, counterfeit, spurious, supposititious.

fidelity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Faithfulness, devotedness, devotion, truth, true heartedness, loyalty, fealty, adherence to duty, observance of good faith.<BR><b>2. </b>Accuracy, closeness, exactness, faithfulness, precision.

fidget
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Move nervously about, twitch, hitch, hitch about.<BR><b>2. </b>Fret, chafe, worry, be uneasy, be restive, be impatient, worry one's self.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Uneasiness, restlessness, impatience, fidgetiness.

fiend
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Demon, devil, infernal spirit, malignant supernatural being.<BR><b>2. </b>Supremely malignant person, demon, devil, monster, utterly malicious being, atrocious being, monster of cruelty <i>or</i> malice.

fierce
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Savage, ferocious, ravenous, furious, infuriate, barbarous, fell.<BR><b>2. </b>Violent, vehement, impetuous, turbulent, tearing, uncurbed, untamed, fiery, passionate.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Invention, fiction, fabrication, fable.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Typical, representative, emblematical.<BR><b>2. </b>Tropical, metaphorical.<BR><b>3. </b>Flowery, florid, ornate.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fibre, thread.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Botany</i>) Tendril, cirrus, fibril.

filch
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Pilfer, purloin, steal, crib.

file
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Toothed <i>or</i> threaded tool, rasp.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Military</i>) Row (<i>of soldiers ranged one behind another</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Bundle of papers.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rasp, rub down with a file, smooth <i>or</i> finish with a file.<BR><b>2. </b>Place on file.<BR><b>3. </b>Smooth, polish.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  March in a file.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pirate, freebooter, buccaneer, sea robber, sea rover.<BR><b>2. </b>[<i>Recent</i>.] Lawless adventurer.

fillet
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Band, bandage.

filly
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Female colt, mare foal.<BR><b>2. </b>Young mare.<BR><b>3. </b>Wanton girl, wayward piece.

filter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Strain, pass through a strainer <i>or</i> filter.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Percolate, transude, exude, strain, ooze.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Strainer.

filth
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dirt, nastiness, foul matter.<BR><b>2. </b>Grossness, foulness, corruption, pollution, impurity, nastiness, defilement, uncleanness.

finale
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[It.] End, termination, conclusion, closing part (<i>primarily and strictly, of an opera or a concert</i>).

finance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Monetary theory, science <i>or</i> art of monetary relations, theory of revenue <i>or</i> fiscal relations.<BR><b>2. </b>Revenue, money, money matters.

financial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Monetary, pecuniary, fiscal.

finery
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Gewgaws, trinkets, ornaments, decorations, trimmings, fine things, showy dress, tinsel trappings.

finesse
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Artifice, strategy, stratagems, ruses, manoeuvring, wiles, cunning, craft.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Use stratagem, practise tricks, employ artifice, manoeuvre.

finite
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Bounded, limited, contracted, terminable, conditioned.

firebrand
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Brand.<BR><b>2. </b>Incendiary, agitator.

firefly
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Elater (<i>of South America</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Glow worm (<i>Lampyris noctiluca</i>).

fireproof
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Incombustible.

firm
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compact, compressed, solid, dense, hard, not soft, not fluid.<BR><b>2. </b>Fixed, fast, rooted, established, settled, confirmed, stable, secure, immovable.<BR><b>3. </b>Steady, steadfast, unshaken, resolute, stanch, constant.<BR><b>4. </b>Strong, robust, sinewy, sturdy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Concern, house, company, partnership.

fiscal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Financial.

fissure
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Cleft, crevice, chink, crack, cranny, break, breach, gap, interstice, opening, chasm, rift, fracture.

fitful
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Variable, irregular, spasmodic, impulsive unstable, fickle, whimsical, fanciful capricious, fantastic, humorsome, odd.<BR><b>2. </b>Eventful, checkered, full of vicissitude.

fitness
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Suitableness, adaptation, aptness, aptitude, appropriateness, pertinence, propriety.<BR><b>2. </b>Qualification, preparation.

flabby
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Soft, yielding, inelastic, limp. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> flaccid.

flaccid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Soft, limber, limp, flabby, yielding, lax, drooping, relaxed, inelastic, hanging loose, pendulous.

flag
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hang loose, droop.<BR><b>2. </b>Languish, droop, faint, decline, pine, sink, succumb, become weak, grow languid, lose vigor, become dejected.<BR><b>3. </b>Pall, grow stale, become vapid, lose interest.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flag stone, flat paving stone.<BR><b>2. </b>Banner, streamer, colors, standard, pennon, pennant, ensign, gonfalon.<BR><b>3. </b>Iris, flower de luce, flower de lis (<i>Iris pseudacorus</i>).

flagellate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Whip, scourge, castigate, flog, thrash, beat, cudgel, drub.

flagrant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flaming, glowing, burning, raging.<BR><b>2. </b>Notorious, crying, glaring, enormous, flagitious.

flake
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Scale, lamina, layer.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Scale, scale off, come off in flakes.

flare
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Waver, flicker, flutter, stream broadly sideways, blaze unsteadily.<BR><b>2. </b>Glare, dazzle, shine forth suddenly, flame, blaze.<BR><b>3. </b>Widen, widen out, spread outward, flue, splay.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Glare, unsteady light.

flash
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Momentary blaze, sudden burst of light, gleam, glare.<BR><b>2. </b>Instant, moment, twinkling, twinkling of an eye.<BR><b>3. </b>Slang (<i>of thieves and gypsies</i>), cant language.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Emit a sudden light.<BR><b>2. </b>Break (forth) suddenly.

flashy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Showy, ostentatious, flaunting, gawdy, tawdry, pretentious, tinsel, glittering but superficial.<BR><b>2. </b>Insipid, tasteless, mawkish, flat, vapid, stale.

flatten
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Make flat (<i>in all the senses of the adjective; which see</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Compliment, gratify by praise.<BR><b>2. </b>Cajole, wheedle, blandish, humor, coax, court, coddle, pay court to, fawn upon, curry favor with, try to win by adulation, make much of.<BR><b>3. </b>Encourage by plausible representations, inspire with false hopes.

flatulence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>flatulency</b>)</b><BR> Windiness (<i>in the bowels</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Windy.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Flutter, make a show, make a parade, cut a dash, be ostentatious.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Wave ostentatiously, brazenly, insolently, <i>or</i> boldly.<BR><b>2. </b>Display with effrontery, toss, flourish, disport, vaunt, boast.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Taste, savor, relish, zest, smack, gust, gusto.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Unusual</i>.) Aroma, perfume, fragrance, odor.<BR><b>3. </b>Subtle quality, essence, spirit, soul, aroma.

fleeting
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Transitory, transient, ephemeral, temporary, passing, evanescent, fugitive, flitting, flying, brief, short lived, here to day and gone to morrow.

flexibility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pliancy, pliability, flexibleness, limberness, litheness, suppleness.<BR><b>2. </b>Compliance, yielding disposition, ductility, complaisance, pliancy, affability, tractableness, easy temper.

flexible

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flutter.<BR><b>2. </b>Fluctuate, waver, float, flutter, flare.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flying, soaring, mounting, volitation.<BR><b>2. </b>Fleeing, hasty departure, flying.<BR><b>3. </b>Flock (<i>of birds</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Volley, shower.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Giddy, wild, volatile, mercurial, frivolous, capricious, fickle, whimsical, unbalanced, light headed, without ballast.

flirt
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Throw (<i>with a jerk</i>), toss, fling, pitch, hurl, chuck, shy.<BR><b>2. </b>Twirl, flutter, whirl, whisk.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Coquet, philander, make love, make a show of love, affect to be in love, play at courtship.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Coquette, jilt.<BR><b>2. </b>Jerk, sudden fling.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Fly rapidly, dart along.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Collection (<i>of sheep, etc.</i>), company.<BR><b>2. </b>Congregation.<BR><b>3. </b>Lock of wool.<BR><b>4. </b>Cotton and woollen refuse.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Congregate, herd, gather in crowds.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Plants (<i>of a country</i>), vegetation, vegetable life.

florid

flounder
