flourish
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Thrive, grow.<BR><b>2. </b>Prosper, succeed, be successful, go on well.<BR><b>3. </b>Boast, brag, vaunt, vapor, gasconade, bluster, make a show, be ostentatious, show off, cut a dash, make a flourish.<BR><b>4. </b>Attain one's prime, be at the height of one's powers, be in vigor, exercise one's full powers.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Brandish, wave.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ostentation, parade, show, display, dash.<BR><b>2. </b>Bombast, grandiloquence, altiloquence, fustian, flowery speech, high sounding words.<BR><b>3. </b>Fanciful strokes (<i>of a pen, etc</i>.).

flout
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Insult, mock, jeer, gibe, fleer, deride, taunt, chaff, scoff at, sneer at, treat with contempt.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Sneer, jeer, gibe, scoff, fleer, fling, be contemptuous.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Insult, mocking, mockery, mock, sneer, jeer, gibe, fling, scoffing, scoff, taunt.

fluctuate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oscillate, undulate, wave, be unsteady, rise and fall, roll hither and thither, move to and fro, move up and down.<BR><b>2. </b>Vary, change, rise and fall.<BR><b>3. </b>Waver, vacillate, be irresolute <i>or</i> inconstant <i>or</i> unsettled.

fluctuation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oscillation, undulation, rolling, unsteadiness, rising and falling.<BR><b>2. </b>Variation, change, shifting, rise and fall.<BR><b>3. </b>Wavering, inconstancy, vacillation, hesitation.

fluent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flowing, gliding, liquid, current.<BR><b>2. </b>Smooth.<BR><b>3. </b>Copious, affluent, ready (<i>in speech</i>).

fluffy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Nappy, downy, flossy.

fluid
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Liquid and gaseous, liquid <i>or</i> gaseous (<i>as the case may be</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Liquid, liquor; gas, vapor.

fluke
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Anchor flake, grappling flap.<BR><b>2. </b>Tail flap (<i>of a whale</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Flounder, turbot, flowk (<i>Platessa flesus</i> or <i>maximus</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Lucky stroke, stroke of luck (<i>primarily, at billiards</i>).<BR><b>5. </b>Fluke worm, liver worm, gourd worm (<i>Distoma hepaticum</i>).

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flow <i>or</i> rush suddenly, spread suddenly, start forth.<BR><b>2. </b>Glow, redden.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Redden, color, cause to glow.<BR><b>2. </b>Animate, elevate, elate, excite, erect, make proud.<BR><b>3. </b>Drench, flood, cleanse by flooding.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Glowing, bright, fresh, vigorous.<BR><b>2. </b>Prolific, exuberant, fecund, fertile, prodigal, lavish.<BR><b>3. </b>Level, even, plane, flat.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Redness, ruddiness, rosiness, glow, bloom, blush.<BR><b>2. </b>Sudden impulse, thrill, shock.

flutter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hover, flap the wings quickly.<BR><b>2. </b>Flap, move rapidly, flirt.<BR><b>3. </b>Tremble, palpitate, beat <i>or</i> move tremulously.<BR><b>4. </b>Flaunt, make a show, make a parade, cut a dash, be ostentatious.<BR><b>5. </b>Fluctuate, waver, oscillate, vacillate, be fickle, be inconstant, be unsteady, be in doubt <i>or</i> uncertainty.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Agitation, tremor, quick motion.<BR><b>2. </b>Confusion, hurry, commotion, agitation, excitement, perturbation, flurry, fluster, hurry skurry.

forage

forbearance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Forbearing, shunning, abstinence, avoidance.<BR><b>2. </b>Patience, lenity, indulgence, long suffering, command of temper.

forbidding
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Repellent, repulsive, unpleasant, abhorrent, odious, disagreeable, unpleasant, offensive.

ford
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Wading place, shallow.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Stream, current, flood.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Wade through (<i>a river</i>), cross on foot, cross by wading.

forebode
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foretell, predict, presage, portend, augur, betoken, foreshadow, foreshow, prognosticate, prefigure, be ominous of.<BR><b>2. </b>Foreknow, be prescient of, have foreknowledge of, have prescience of, have premonition of, have presentiment of, divine.

forecast
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foresee, anticipate, look forward to, provide against, calculate <i>or</i> estimate beforehand.<BR><b>2. </b>Contrive, plan project, devise, scheme.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foresight, prevision, forethought, anticipation, provident regard to the future.<BR><b>2. </b>Contrivance, scheming, planning.

foreclose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Preclude, prevent, stop, debar, hinder, shut out.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Deprive of the power of redeeming (<i>a mortgage</i>).

forefather
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Progenitor, ancestor, father, foregoer.

foreknowledge
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Foresight, prescience, previous knowledge.

foremost
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  First, most advanced, front, leading.

forensic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Juridical, judicial, proper to courts.<BR><b>2. </b>Disputative, proper <i>or</i> belonging to debate <i>or</i> discussion.

forerunner
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Precursor, harbinger, herald, foregoer, avant courier.<BR><b>2. </b>Prelude, prognostic, sign, omen, premonition, precursor.

foresee
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Foreknow, forecast, see beforehand, have prescience of, be prescient of.

foreshadow
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Prefigure, presage, forebode, prognosticate, presignify, indicate <i>or</i> suggest beforehand, foretell dimly.

foresight
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foreknowledge, prescience, prevision.<BR><b>2. </b>Forecast, forethought, precaution, prudence, anticipation, provident regard to the future.

forestall
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Shut off, preclude, prevent, hinder (<i>by prior influences</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Anticipate, foretaste, antedate, take in advance.<BR><b>3. </b>Engross, monopolize, regrate, get exclusive possession of (<i>in order to enhance prices</i>).

foretell
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Predict, prophesy.<BR><b>2. </b>Prognosticate, foreshow, foreshadow, presignify, betoken, portend, augur, bode, forebode, presage.

forfeit
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fine, mulct, amercement, penalty, forfeiture.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Lose (<i>by some offence, by neglect, or by breach of condition</i>), alienate.

forfeiture
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Loss (<i>by some offence, etc</i>.), amercement, confiscation.<BR><b>2. </b>Fine, mulct, amercement, penalty, forfeit.

forge
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Smithy (<i>for heavy work</i>), ironworks.<BR><b>2. </b>Furnace (<i>to make iron more malleable</i>), shingling mill.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beat (<i>metal</i>), hammer out, form (<i>by heating and hammering</i>), fabricate, frame.<BR><b>2. </b>Devise, invent, frame, coin.<BR><b>3. </b>Falsify, counterfeit, fabricate.

forger
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Maker, contriver.<BR><b>2. </b>Counterfeiter, falsifier.

forgery
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Counterfeiting, falsification.<BR><b>2. </b>Counterfeit.

forlorn
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deserted, abandoned, forsaken, friendless, solitary, lost.<BR><b>2. </b>Wretched, miserable, pitiable, destitute, desolate, helpless, comfortless, disconsolate, woebegone.

formal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Express, explicit, positive, strict, official, in due form, according to established form.<BR><b>2. </b>Regular, methodical, set, fixed, rigid, stiff.<BR><b>3. </b>Ceremonious, precise, punctilious, stiff, starch, starched, prim, affectedly exact.<BR><b>4. </b>Constitutive, essential.<BR><b>5. </b>External, as mere form, merely formal.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Metaphysics</i>) Organic, formative, primordial, innate, <i>a priori</i>.

formality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Custom, established mode, settled method, rule of proceeding.<BR><b>2. </b>Ceremony, conventionality, etiquette, mere form.

formation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Creation, production.<BR><b>2. </b>Composition, constitution, making up.<BR><b>3. </b>Arrangement, combination, disposal, disposition.

formative
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Plastic, creative, shaping, determinative.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Grammar</i>) Derivative, non radical, inflectional.

former
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Maker, framer, author, creator, constructer.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Previous, prior, anterior, antecedent, preceding, forgoing.<BR><b>2. </b>Quondam, <i>ci devant</i>, late, old time.<BR><b>3. </b>Past, gone by, bygone, foregone, previous.<BR><b>4. </b>First named, first mentioned.

formerly
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Heretofore, anciently, aforetime, of old, in times past, in days of yore, long ago, in past ages.

formidable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Fearful, dreadful, terrible, redoubted, frightful, terrific, horrible, tremendous.

formula
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Form, rule, model, formulary.

forsake
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Leave, quit, desert, abandon, cast off.<BR><b>2. </b>Abandon, renounce, forswear, forego, relinquish, drop, give up, give over.

forswear
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Renounce (<i>upon oath</i>), reject, leave, quit, desert, forsake, abandon, drop.<BR><b>2. </b>Deny, abjure, recant, retract, renounce.

fort
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fortification, fortress, stronghold, bulwark, castle, citadel, fastness, fortified place.

forte
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Peculiar talent, special gift, chief excellence, strong point, that in which one excels.

fortify
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Protect by fortifications, surround with fortifications.<BR><b>2. </b>Brace, strengthen, stiffen, reinforce, add strength to.<BR><b>3. </b>Strengthen, confirm, corroborate.

fortitude
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Endurance (<i>with courage</i>), firmness, resolution, patience, strength of mind, passive courage.

fortress
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fortification, fort, stronghold, castle, citadel, fastness, bulwark, fortified place (<i>of great magnitude</i>).

fortuitous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Accidental, casual, contingent, incidental, chance, happening by chance.

fortunate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Successful, prosperous, favored, happy. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> lucky.<BR><b>2. </b>Propitious, auspicious, favorable, advantageous, lucky, happy.

fortune
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Chance, accident, luck, hap, fortuity, casualty.<BR><b>2. </b>Livelihood, means of living.<BR><b>3. </b>Estate, substance, property, possessions.<BR><b>4. </b>Wealth, riches, opulence, affluence.<BR><b>5. </b>Destiny, fate, destination, doom, lot, star, future condition.<BR><b>6. </b>Event, issue, result.<BR><b>7. </b>Success, favorable issue.

forum
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Tribunal, court, court of justice.

forward
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>forwards</b>)</b><BR> Onward, in advance, ahead.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Onward, progressive, advancing.<BR><b>2. </b>Front, fore, anterior, head, at the fore part, near the fore part.<BR><b>3. </b>Ready, prompt, willing, eager, earnest, zealous.<BR><b>4. </b>Bold, confident, presumptuous, presuming, impertinent, pert, flippant, brazen, assuming, brazen faced, brassy (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>5. </b>Early, premature.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Advance, promote, further, foster, support, aid, favor, encourage, help on, help forward.<BR><b>2. </b>Quicken, hasten, accelerate, expedite; speed, despatch, hurry.<BR><b>3. </b>Transmit, ship, send on, send forward.

fosse
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Fortification</i>) Ditch, moat, graff.

fossil
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Petrifaction.

foster
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Nurse, nourish, feed, support, sustain.<BR><b>2. </b>Rear, breed, bring up, rear up, cherish, encourage, favor, patronize, promote, stimulate, forward, further, advance, help on, help forward.

foul
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Impure, nasty, squalid, dirty, polluted, filthy, unclean, soiled, tarnished, stained, sullied.<BR><b>2. </b>Disgusting, loathsome, offensive, noisome.<BR><b>3. </b>Unfair, dishonorable, underhanded, sinister.<BR><b>4. </b>Base, scandalous, infamous, vile, wicked, dark, abominable, detestable, disgraceful, shameful, scurvy.<BR><b>5. </b>Obscene, vulgar, coarse, low.<BR><b>6. </b>Abusive, insulting, scurrilous, foul mouthed foul spoken.<BR><b>7. </b>Stormy, rainy, cloudy.<BR><b>8. </b>Turbid, thick, muddy, feculent.<BR><b>9. </b>Entangled, tangled, in collision.

founder
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Originator, institutor, establisher, planter.<BR><b>2. </b>Caster (<i>of metals</i>), moulder.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sink (<i>as a ship by filling with water</i>), go to the bottom.<BR><b>2. </b>Fail, miscarry.<BR><b>3. </b>Trip, stumble, fall.

fracas
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Uproar, tumult, disturbance, outbreak, noisy quarrel, row (<i>colloq.</i>).

fraction
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Part, portion, fragment, section, piece, bit, scrap.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Arithmetic</i>) Part of a unit.

fractional
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Broken, fragmentary.<BR><b>2. </b>Pertaining to fractions, of fractions.

fractious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Cross, captious, petulant, touchy, testy, peevish, fretful, splenetic, pettish, snappish, waspish, irritable.

fracture
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Breaking, rupture.<BR><b>2. </b>Break, crack, breach, cleft, fissure, rift, flaw, rent, opening.

fragile
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Brittle, frangible, easily broken.<BR><b>2. </b>Frail, weak, feeble. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> infirm.

fragility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Brittleness, frangibleness.<BR><b>2. </b>Frailty, weakness, feebleness.

fragment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Remnant, scrap, chip, fraction, detached part, part broken off.

fragmentary
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Fractional, broken, disconnected, scattered.

fragrance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>fragrancy</b>)</b><BR> Perfume, aroma, redolence, balminess, incense, pleasing scent grateful odor, sweetness of smell.

fragrant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Aromatic, spicy, redolent, balmy, odoriferous, odorous, perfumed, sweet smelling, sweet scented.

frail
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fragile, frangible, brittle, easily broken (<i>across</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Weak, feeble, fragile. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> infirm.<BR><b>3. </b>Liable to err, easily led astray, of infirm virtue.

frame
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Construct, build, put together.<BR><b>2. </b>Form, compose, make, constitute.<BR><b>3. </b>Invent, devise, plan, contrive.<BR><b>4. </b>Fabricate, forge.<BR><b>5. </b>Put into a frame.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Skeleton, framing, framework, carcass.<BR><b>2. </b>Form, structure, fabric, system, scheme, constitution.<BR><b>3. </b>Condition, state, temper, mood, state of mind <i>or</i> feeling.

framework
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Skeleton, frame, framing, carcass.

frank
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Open, ingenuous, free, sincere, candid, artless, frank hearted, unreserved, without disguise.

frantic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Furious, raving, raging, mad, distracted, wild, infuriate, frenzied.

fraternal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Brotherly.

fraternity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Association, society, company, circle, brotherhood, sodality, league, clan, united body.<BR><b>2. </b>Brotherhood, brotherly relation.<BR><b>3. </b>Brotherliness, brotherhood.

fraud
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Deceit, deception, duplicity, imposition, imposture, guile, trick, cheat, chouse, artifice, stratagem, wile, humbug, hoax.

fraudulent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Dishonest, knavish, treacherous, deceitful, deceptive, false, crafty, wily, tricky, trickish.

fraught
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Filled, stored, freighted, laden, charged, abounding, pregnant, big.

fray
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Combat, battle, fight.<BR><b>2. </b>Broil, quarrel, riot, contention. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> affray.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Rub, wear, fret, chafe.

freak
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Whim, whimsey, caprice, fancy, humor, crotchet, maggot, vagary, quirk.<BR><b>2. </b>Gambol, antic, caper.

freight
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Load, lade, charge, burden <i>or</i> burthen.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cargo, lading, load, burden.<BR><b>2. </b>Freightage, freight money, charge for freight.

frenzy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Sometimes written <i>Phrensy</i>.] Madness, rage, fury, distraction, raving, insanity, lunacy, derangement, mania, delirium, aberration of mind.

frequency
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oftenness, frequent occurrence.<BR><b>2. </b>Commonness, common occurrence.

frequent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oft repeated, of frequent occurrence.<BR><b>2. </b>Common, usual, every day, of common occurrence.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Haunt, visit often, resort to frequently, attend much <i>or</i> regularly.

fret
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rub, chafe, wear (<i>by friction</i>), abrade, fray, gall, wear away.<BR><b>2. </b>Vex, tease, irritate, gall, ruffle, provoke, nettle, affront, make angry.<BR><b>3. </b>Annoy, worry, weary, harass, wear.<BR><b>4. </b>Ripple, ruffle, agitate, roughen.<BR><b>5. </b>Wear, wear away, gnaw into, corrode, cover with depressions.<BR><b>6. </b>Variegate, diversify, ornament with raised <i>or</i> depressed work.<BR><b>7. </b>Ornament with frets <i>or</i> fretting <i>or</i> fretwork.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Chafe, fume, rage, be vexed, be irritated, be chafed, be peevish, be fretful, be angry.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Agitation, irritation, vexation, fretfulness, fretting, peevishness.<BR><b>2. </b>Herpes, tetter, ringworm.<BR><b>3. </b>Fretwork, intertwined linear ornament, square raised ornament, key ornament.<BR><b>4. </b>Ridge, raised line, whelk, wale.

friable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Crumbling, pulverable, easily crumbled.

friction
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Attrition, abrasion, confrication, rubbing.<BR><b>2. </b>Rubbing <i>or</i> rolling resistance, resistance from roughness.

friend
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Confidant, intimate, dear companion, loved <i>or</i> loving associate, bosom friend.<BR><b>2. </b>Ally, associate, member of the same party, adherent of the same cause, fellow partisan, fellow adherent.<BR><b>3. </b>Favorer, encourager, well wisher, patron, advocate, adherent, defender, supporter, good genius.<BR><b>4. </b>Quaker.

frigid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cold, cool, gelid, of a low temperature.<BR><b>2. </b>Dull, uninteresting, uninterested, unanimated, lifeless, cold, destitute of enthusiasm, without fervor, spiritless, tame.<BR><b>3. </b>Forbidding, formal, prim, stiff, rigid, repellent, repelling, repulsive, chilling, freezing.

frigidity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Coldness, coolness, chilliness, frigidness, gelidity, gelidness, low temperature.<BR><b>2. </b>Dulness, frigidness, lifelessness, want of animation.<BR><b>3. </b>Frigidness, formality, primness, stiffness, rigidity, repelling manner, forbidding manner, chilliness, chill.

frisk
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Leap, skip, hop, jump, frolic, romp, gambol, dance.

frisky
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Gay, lively, playful, sportive, frolicsome, coltish, full of frolic.

fritter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pancake, fried cake, batter cake.<BR><b>2. </b>Fragment, piece, shred, bit, scrap, splinter, flinder (<i>Scotch</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Slice, cut into small pieces.<BR><b>2. </b>Break into fragments, break to pieces, shiver, shatter.

frivolity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Levity, puerility, trifling, triviality, frivolousness, folly, fribbling, frippery, flummery.

frivolous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Trifling, trivial, worthless, light, petty, flimsy, idle, puerile, childish, trashy, foolish.

frolic
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Gambol, escapade, lark, wild prank, flight of levity, spree (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Fun, pleasantry, drollery.<BR><b>3. </b>Scene of merriment, merry making.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Frolicsome, merry, sportive, playful, gamesome, gay, lively, frisky, joyous, prankish, coltish, full of frolic.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Be merry, be frolicsome, play pranks, cut capers.

frolicsome
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Sportive, playful, gamesome, gay, lively, frisky, coltish, full of frolic, frolic.

frost
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rime, hoar frost, frozen dew, white frost.<BR><b>2. </b>Cold manner, reserve, frigidity, iciness, stiffness, want of cordiality, unsociability.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Ice, cover with frosting.<BR><b>2. </b>Whiten, sprinkle with white, sprinkle with gray hairs.<BR><b>3. </b>Frost bite, injure by frost <i>or</i> cold, nip.<BR><b>4. </b>Sharpen, point (<i>said of a horse</i>).

frothy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foamy, spumy.<BR><b>2. </b>Trifling, light, empty, trivial, vain, frivolous, unsubstantial.

frown
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Scowl, look stern.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Scowl, stern look.

frowzy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[Written also <i>Frouzy</i> and <i>Frowsy</i>.]<BR><b>1. </b>Fetid, rank, noisome, stinking, offensive, illscented, strong smelling.<BR><b>2. </b>Rough and tangled (<i>as the hair</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Disordered, disorderly, slovenly, slatternly, dowdy.

fructify
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Fertilize, make fruitful.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Be fruitful, bear fruit, bring forth fruit, bear, be productive.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Provident, economical, saving, sparing, choice, chary, careful, thrifty, unwasteful.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Economy, thrift, thriftiness, good husbandry.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Productive, abounding in fruit.<BR><b>2. </b>Prolific, fertile, fecund.<BR><b>3. </b>Plentiful, plenteous, abundant, rich.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Enjoyment (<i>in the possession</i> or <i>the use of anything</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Fulfilment.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Support (<i>of a lever</i>), prop.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>[Written also <i>Fulfill</i>.]<BR><b>1. </b>Accomplish, effectuate, realize, effect, execute, bring to pass, complete, consummate, bring to completion, perfect, bring to perfection <i>or</i> greater perfection, carry out <i>or</i> to its intention.<BR><b>2. </b>Observe, obey, perform, do, discharge, keep, adhere to, comply with, be faithful to.<BR><b>3. </b>Meet, satisfy, answer, comply with, fill, fill out.

fulminate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Explode, detonate.<BR><b>2. </b>Utter denunciations, thunder, pour out threats, hurl denunciations, fulmine.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Utter with a menace, proclaim with denunciation, hurl, thunder, fulmine.<BR><b>2. </b>Explode, burst, rend asunder.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Seed, kernel, matured ovule.<BR><b>2. </b>Corn (<i>wheat, rye, oats, barley, maize, etc</i>.), cereals, cereal products.<BR><b>3. </b>Particle, atom, bit, scrap, jot, whit, mite, ace, iota, tittle, scintilla, trace, spark, shadow, glimmer.<BR><b>4. </b>Twentieth part of a scruple, twenty fourth part of a pennyweight.<BR><b>5. </b>Fibre, texture.<BR><b>6. </b>Temper, disposition, humor.<BR><b>7. </b>Dye, tint, color, stain, tinge, hue, shade, tincture.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Accustom, familiarize, inure, use, train, harden.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Cut (<i>clumsily</i>), hew, chop, mangle, hackle, haggle.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Notch, cut.<BR><b>2. </b>Hired horse, worn out horse.<BR><b>3. </b>Drudge, over worked man.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Hired, mercenary, hireling, hackney.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flutter.<BR><b>2. </b>Hang about, hang over.

hub
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Nave (<i>of a wheel</i>).

hubbub
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Uproar, clamor, din, racket, outcry, confusion, disorder, hullabaloo.<BR><b>2. </b>Tumult, disorder, confusion, disturbance, riot.

huckster
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Retailer, hawker, pedler, hucksterer.

huddle
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Throw together in confusion, throw in a heap, crowd confusedly.<BR><b>2. </b>Hurry away, push away in a heap.<BR><b>3. </b>[With <i>up</i>.] Make hurriedly, contrive carelessly, fudge up.<BR><b>4. </b>[With <i>on</i>.] Hurry on, hustle on, put on in disorder.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Crowd, press together in confusion.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Crowd, tumult, disorder, confusion, disturbance.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Color, tint, tinge, shade.

humane
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Kind, benevolent, benignant, obliging, accommodating, tender, sympathetic, charitable, compassionate, clement, gentle, kindhearted, tender hearted, good hearted.<BR><b>2. </b>Proper to man, manlike, worthy of man.<BR><b>3. </b>Elevating, refining, cultivating, humanizing, spiritual, rational.

humanist
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Student of polite literature, devotee of culture.

humanity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Human nature.<BR><b>2. </b>Mankind, the human race.<BR><b>3. </b>Kindness, benevolence, benignity, philanthropy, tenderness, sympathy, charity, humaneness, kind heartedness, fellow feeling, good nature, milk of human kindness.<BR><b>4. </b>Human spirit, spirit <i>or</i> essence of man, reason, rationality, culture, spirit of truth and beauty.

humble
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Meek, modest, unassuming, unpretending, unobtrusive, lowly, submissive, free from pride, free from haughtiness, without arrogance.<BR><b>2. </b>Low, small, poor, unpretending.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Humiliate, shame, mortify, degrade, crush, break, subdue, abash, make ashamed, bring down, put down, take down, put out of countenance.<BR><b>2. </b>Make humble, make lowly, render meek <i>or</i> modest <i>or</i> unpretending, free from pride.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Dull, prosy, dronish, stupid, wearisome, tiresome, dry, dreary.

humid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Wet, moist, damp, dank.

humidity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Moisture, dampness.

humiliate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Mortify, shame, abash, put to shame, put down. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> humble, 1.

humility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Humbleness, meekness, submissiveness, lowliness, self abasement, lowliness of mind, freedom from pride <i>or</i> arrogance, freedom from self righteousness.

humor
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Moisture, fluid (<i>of animal bodies</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Cutaneous eruption.<BR><b>3. </b>Temper, disposition, bent, bias, vein, propensity, predilection, turn of mind.<BR><b>4. </b>Mood, temper, state of feeling, frame of mind.<BR><b>5. </b>Mood, fancy, whim, caprice, freak, vagary, crotchet, whimsey, maggot, wrinkle.<BR><b>6. </b>Pleasantry, facetiousness, fun, jocoseness, jocularity, kindly wit, comic <i>or</i> ludicrous feeling <i>or</i> tone.<BR><b>7. </b>Sense of the ludicrous, feeling of the comic, perception of what is funny.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indulge, gratify, give way to, consult the wishes of.<BR><b>2. </b>Favor, suit the nature of, meet the requirements of.

immaculate

immanent

immature
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unripe, crude, green, raw, unformed, unprepared, rudimental, imperfect, unfinished.<BR><b>2. </b>Premature, hasty, untimely, unseasonable, out of season.

immediate

immediately
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Closely, proximately.<BR><b>2. </b>Directly, without any intervention.<BR><b>3. </b>Instantly, forthwith, just now, without delay, this moment, directly, <i>instanter</i>.

immemorial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Beyond memory, that cannot be remembered, olden, ancient, hoary, reaching back beyond tradition.

immense
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Illimitable, boundless, unbounded, unlimited, interminable, measureless, infinite.<BR><b>2. </b>Vast, enormous, prodigious, stupendous, huge, gigantic, colossal, Cyclopean, Herculean, very great.

immerse

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Impending, threatening, impendent, near at hand.<BR><b>2. </b>Threatening harm, perilous, dangerous, alarming.

immobile
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fixed, motionless, steadfast, stable, inflexible, immovable.<BR><b>2. </b>Rigid, stiff, expressionless, without play of features, dull, stolid.

immodest
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indelicate, indecorous, shameless, gross, coarse.<BR><b>2. </b>Bold, forward, brazen, impudent, destitute of proper reserve.<BR><b>3. </b>Impure, obscene, indecent, smutty, lewd, unchaste, filthy, coarse, gross, broad.

immolate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Sacrifice, offer up, offer in sacrifice, kill as a victim.

immortal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Undying, deathless, ever living, imperishable, incorruptible, unfading, indestructible, indissoluble, never dying.<BR><b>2. </b>Eternal, everlasting, endless, perpetual, ceaseless, never ending.<BR><b>3. </b>[<i>By hyperbole</i>.] Lasting, enduring, permanent, abiding, lasting through all time <i>or</i> as long as the world endures.

immunity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Freedom, exemption, release, exoneration.<BR><b>2. </b>Privilege, prerogative, right, liberty, charter, franchise.

immure
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Confine, shut up.<BR><b>2. </b>Imprison, incarcerate.

immutability
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Unchangeableness, changelessness, invariableness, invariability, constancy, permanence, stability.

imp
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Sprite, hobgoblin, flibbertigibbet, little demon <i>or</i> devil, malignant spirit.

impact
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Impulse, shock, impression, stroke.<BR><b>2. </b>Collision, impinging, contact, striking.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Pack together, pack close, press close together, drive firmly together.

impair
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deteriorate, injure, vitiate, make worse, harm.<BR><b>2. </b>Lessen, diminish, decrease, make less.<BR><b>3. </b>Weaken, enfeeble, enervate.

impale
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Thrust upon a stake, kill by impaling.<BR><b>2. </b>Fence, surround with palings, enclose with palisades.

impalpable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Intangible, very fine, delicate, attenuated, not palpable, not to be felt, not perceptible by the touch.<BR><b>2. </b>Imperceptible, shadowy, indistinct, inapprehensible, unsubstantial.

impart
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Give, grant, bestow. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> confer.<BR><b>2. </b>Communicate, divulge, disclose, reveal, tell, make known.

impartial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unbiassed, unprejudiced, candid, disinterested, equitable, just, fair, honorable, even handed.

impartiality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Disinterestedness, candor, equitableness, justice, fairness, honor, honorableness, fair play.

impassable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Impervious, impermeable, impenetrable, pathless, affording no passage, that cannot be travelled.

impassioned
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Passionate, vehement, impetuous, glowing, intense, excited, animated, fervid, fervent, zealous, warm, ardent.

impassive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> impassible.

impatience
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disquietude, restlessness, uneasiness.<BR><b>2. </b>Vehemence, impetuosity, haste, eagerness, precipitation.<BR><b>3. </b>Lack of forbearance, want of patience, irritability, irritableness, heat, violence of temper.

impeach
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Arraign, accuse, indict.<BR><b>2. </b>Arraign for malfeasance in office, accuse of maladministration.<BR><b>3. </b>Discredit, asperse, call in question, censure, denounce, disparage, criminate, impair, lessen.

impeccable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Sinless, faultless, immaculate, stainless, incapable of wrong.

impede
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Hinder, obstruct, stop, clog, check, retard, delay, interrupt, thwart, restrain, block, encumber.

impediment
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Hindrance, obstruction, obstacle, check, bar, difficulty, stumbling block, encumbrance.

impel
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Drive, push, urge, put in motion, press on, urge forward.<BR><b>2. </b>Induce, move, persuade, influence, instigate, incite, actuate, stimulate, set on, stir up.

impend
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Threaten, hang over, be imminent, be in store, stare one in the face.<BR><b>2. </b>Be near, draw near, approach, be at hand.

impenetrable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Not to be penetrated, not to be pierced.<BR><b>2. </b>Dull, obtuse, senseless, insensible, indifferent, impassive, unsympathetic, stolid, cold.<BR><b>3. </b>Unfathomable, reticent, that keeps his own counsel, not to be found out.

impenitent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Uncontrite, unrepentant, obdurate, hardened, seared, recusant, relentless, incorrigible, irreclaimable.

imperative
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Commanding, authoritative, peremptory.<BR><b>2. </b>Binding, obligatory.

imperial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Belonging <i>or</i> relating to an empire.<BR><b>2. </b>Kingly, regal, royal, sovereign.<BR><b>3. </b>Majestic, grand, exalted, magnificent, noble, great, regal, royal, kingly <i>or</i> queenly, supreme, sovereign, consummate.

imperious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Dictatorial, magisterial, domineering, tyrannical, despotic, overbearing, lordly, haughty, arrogant.

impermeable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Impervious, impenetrable, impassable.

impersonate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Personate, take <i>or</i> act the part of, act, enact, imitate, ape, mimic, mock, take off.<BR><b>2. </b>Incarnate, personify, invest with personality.

impersonation

impertinence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>impertinency</b>)<BR><b>1. </b>Irrelevance, irrelevancy.<BR><b>2. </b>Rudeness, intrusiveness, impudence, insolence, incivility, sauciness, forwardness, boldness, presumption, effrontery, pertness, assurance, face, front, brass, brazen face.<BR><b>3. </b>Impertinent action, piece of impertinence, piece of rudeness, etc.

impertinent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irrelevant, inapposite, inapplicable, not to the point, not pertaining to the matter in hand, non pertinent.<BR><b>2. </b>Intrusive, meddling, officious, insolent, rude, impudent, saucy, forward, pert, bold, malapert, unmannerly.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Calm, cool, composed, unmoved, undisturbed, tranquil, unruffled, collected, placid, inexcitable, sedate, not to be disturbed.

impervious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Impermeable, impenetrable, impassable.

impetuous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Vehement, violent, furious, fierce, passionate, precipitate, hasty, hot, over zealous, headlong.

impetus
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Momentum, force, propulsive force.

impiety
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irreverence, ungodliness, irreligion, profanity.<BR><b>2. </b>Ungodliness, wickedness, unrighteousness, sin, sinfulness, iniquity, unholiness.<BR><b>3. </b>Act of impiety, sin, iniquity.<BR><b>4. </b>Unfilial character, lack of filial devotion.

impinge
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Strike, hit, fall against, strike against, dash against, clash upon, collide with.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Instrument, tool, utensil.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Involution, entanglement.<BR><b>2. </b>Tacit inference, necessary conclusion.

implicit
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Implied, inferred, understood, tacit.<BR><b>2. </b>Unreserved, unhesitating, firm, undoubting, steadfast, unshaken.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Entreat, supplicate, beseech, pray, pray to.<BR><b>2. </b>Crave, solicit, beg, pray for, petition for.

imply
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Involve (<i>as a consequence</i>), include (<i>by implication</i>), import, signify, mean.

impolitic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Imprudent, injudicious, indiscreet, ill advised, ill judged, inexpedient.

import
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bring into (<i>a country from abroad</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Imply, denote, purport, signify, betoken, mean.<BR><b>3. </b>Concern, be of importance to, be of consequence to, be of interest to.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Signification, meaning, purport, sense, drift, gist, spirit, bearing, tenor, intention.<BR><b>2. </b>Imported merchandise.<BR><b>3. </b>Importance, consequence, weight, moment, significance.

importune
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Press (<i>by entreaty</i>), urge (<i>by repeated requests</i>), beset, entreat, dun, solicit earnestly.

impose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Put, lay, set, place.<BR><b>2. </b>Prescribe, enjoin, appoint.<BR><b>3. </b>Obtrude, palm, pass off.

imposing
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Grand, stately, august, majestic, impressive, noble, commanding.

impostor

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Cheat, trick, deception, imposition, hoax, fraud, delusion, artifice, ruse, dodge, wile, deceit, stratagem, chouse, crafty device.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Put into a pound.<BR><b>2. </b>Confine, encage, imprison, shut up, coop up.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unassailable, inexpugnable, not to be taken by assault, not to be stormed, secure from capture, tenable against all odds.<BR><b>2. </b>Unassailable, invulnerable, invincible, immovable, not to be shaken, irrefragable.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Affecting, touching, moving, stirring, powerful, striking, overpowering.

imprint
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Print, stamp, mark by pressure.<BR><b>2. </b>Impress, inculcate, fix deeply.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unlikely, not probable.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Thriftless, unthrifty, imprudent, prodigal, wasteful, without forecast, without foresight, careless of the future.

improvise
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active, verb neuter</span><BR>  Improvisate, compose <i>or</i> poetize extempore.

imprudent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indiscreet, inconsiderate, incautious, injudicious, unadvised, ill advised, ill judged, rash, careless, heedless.<BR><b>2. </b>Improvident (<i>which see</i>).

impudent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Insolent, insulting, presumptuous, bold, shameless, impertinent, rude, saucy, pert, flippant, cool (<i>colloq.</i>), brazen, forward, bold faced brazen faced.

impugn
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Attack (<i>by words</i> or <i>arguments</i>), assail, oppose, resist, contradict, gainsay, call in question.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Thrust, push, impetus, impelling force.<BR><b>2. </b>Passion, instinct, appetite, inclination, proclivity.<BR><b>3. </b>Incitement, instigation, motive, influence, sudden thought <i>or</i> feeling.

impulsive

inability

inalienable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Not to be alienated, not transferable.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Empty, void.<BR><b>2. </b>Vain, frivolous, trifling, puerile, worthless, empty.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[With <i>The</i> prefixed.] Void, vacuity, vacuum, empty space.

Falling, impinging.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Event, occurrence, circumstance.

inclement

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inclining, leaning, slope slant.<BR><b>2. </b>Trending, verging, oblique direction.<BR><b>3. </b>Disposition, predilection, predisposition, bent, bias, proneness, proclivity, tendency, leaning, aptitude, propensity, <i>penchant</i>.<BR><b>4. </b>Desire, wish, partiality, fondness, liking.

inclusive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inclosing, encircling.<BR><b>2. </b>Including both, both being included.

incoherent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Loose, detached, non adhesive, non cohesive.<BR><b>2. </b>Incongruous, inconsistent, inconsequential, without connection, disconnected.<BR><b>3. </b>Unintelligible, irrational, confused, wild, rambling.

incommensurate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disproportionate.<BR><b>2. </b>Inadequate, insufficient, unequal.

incompatibility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Inconsistency, incongruity, unsuitableness, want of agreement, want of adaptation, contrariety, contradictoriness, irreconcilable opposition.

incompatible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inconsistent, incongruous, unsuitable, unadapted, contradictory, irreconcilable, incapable of agreement <i>or</i> coexistence.

incompetent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unable, incapable, not competent.<BR><b>2. </b>Insufficient, inadequate.<BR><b>3. </b>Disqualified, incapacitated, unfit, unfitted.

incomplete
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Defective, deficient, imperfect, partial.<BR><b>2. </b>Unfinished, uncompleted, unaccomplished, unexecuted, not completed, left undone.

incomprehensible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inconceivable, unimaginable, not to be comprehended, past finding out, unfathomable, inexhaustible.<BR><b>2. </b>Inconceivable, unthinkable, incogitable, unintelligible, incapable of being made coherent.

inconclusive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unconvincing, indecisive, not conclusive.

incongruity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Unsuitableness, inconsistency, unfitness, inappropriateness, discrepancy, incompatibility, incoherence, absurdity, contrariety, contradiction, contradictoriness.

incongruous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inconsistent, unfit, inappropriate, incompatible, incoherent, discrepant, absurd, unsuitable, contrary, contradictory.

inconsolable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Disconsolate, woe begone, comfortless, heart broken, broken hearted, forlorn, crushed, hopeless.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Changeableness, fickleness, vacillation, wavering, unsteadiness.<BR><b>2. </b>Unstableness, instability, mutability, variableness.

incontrovertible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Indisputable, unquestionable. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> incontestable.

incorporate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unite, combine, mix, blend, merge, consolidate, form into one body.<BR><b>2. </b>Form into a corporation, form into a body politic.<BR><b>3. </b>Incarnate, embody.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Incorporeal, immaterial, supernatural, spiritual.<BR><b>2. </b>Non corporate, not incorporated.<BR><b>3. </b>Intimately united, consolidated, blended, merged.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Combination, union, blending, mixture, intimate union, consolidation.<BR><b>2. </b>Association (<i>as a body politic</i>).

infernal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hellish, Tartarean, Stygian, of hell.<BR><b>2. </b>Diabolical, devilish, demoniacal, fiendish, fiendlike, satanic, atrocious, nefarious, dark, damnable, accursed, abominable.

infest
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Throng, overrun, beset, take complete possession of, swarm in.<BR><b>2. </b>Disturb, annoy, vex, tease, harass, plague, torment, trouble, molest, worry.

infiltrate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Soak (<i>into a porous substance</i>), be absorbed, pass by filtration.

infinitesimal
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Infinitely small.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Infinitely small quantity, quantity converging to zero, infinitely diminishing quantity, quantity whose limit is zero, vanishing fluxion.

infinity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> infinitude.<BR><b>2. </b>Unlimited degree, infiniteness.<BR><b>3. </b>Absoluteness, self determination, self existence, eternity.

infirm
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Weak, feeble, enfeebled, frail, weakened, debilitated.<BR><b>2. </b>Irresolute, vacillating, wavering, faltering.<BR><b>3. </b>Insecure, unstable, unsound.

inflame
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Excite, stimulate, enkindle, incite, fire, rouse, arouse, animate, inspirit, set on, work up, stir up.<BR><b>2. </b>Exasperate, irritate, nettle, provoke, anger, enrage, incense, madden, infuriate.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Take fire.<BR><b>2. </b>Become excited, grow angry.<BR><b>3. </b>Grow red, feverish, and angry.

inflammation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Burning, conflagration, setting on fire.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Swelling and redness.<BR><b>3. </b>Excitement, anger, animosity, turbulence, heat, violence, rage.

inflate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Swell (<i>by blowing</i>), distend, expand, bloat, blow up.<BR><b>2. </b>Puff up, make conceited.<BR><b>3. </b>Enlarge, increase.

inflation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Swelling (<i>by air</i>), distension, expansion, blowing up.<BR><b>2. </b>Conceit, conceitedness, self conceit, self sufficiency, self complacency, self importance, vain gloriousness, vain glory.<BR><b>3. </b>Increase, enlargement.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Commerce</i>) Over enlargement (<i>of currency</i>), over issue.

inflexible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stiff, rigid.<BR><b>2. </b>Pertinacious, dogged, stubborn, obstinate, unyielding, refractory, headstrong, wilful, cantankerous, intractable, heady, obdurate, cross grained.<BR><b>3. </b>Firm, resolute, steadfast, immovable, persevering.<BR><b>4. </b>Inexorable, unyielding, immovable by entreaties.

inflict
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Impose, lay on.

infliction
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inflicting, imposition.<BR><b>2. </b>Punishment, judgment.

influence
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Authority, sway, control, predominance, ascendency, power of impelling <i>or</i> directing, controlling power, directing agency.<BR><b>2. </b>Reputation, credit, weight of character.<BR><b>3. </b>Influx, inflow, inflowing.<BR><b>4. </b>Mystic power, unseen <i>or</i> mysterious agency.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Control, sway, bias, lead, direct, modify, affect.<BR><b>2. </b>Move, induce, impel, instigate, persuade, actuate, incite, rouse, arouse, work upon, prevail upon.

influential
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Potent, powerful, controlling.<BR><b>2. </b>Of influence, of authority.

influx
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Introduction, flowing in.

inform
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Animate, inspire, quicken, give life to.<BR><b>2. </b>Acquaint, apprise, advise, tell, notify, make known to, mention to, give notice to, signify to, send word to, write word to.

informal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irregular, out of the usual course, not according to the prescribed form.<BR><b>2. </b>Unconventional, unceremonious.<BR><b>3. </b>Simple, natural, familiar, easy.

informality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irregularity, want of conformity to (the) prescribed rule.<BR><b>2. </b>Absence of ceremony, unconventionality, unceremoniousness.<BR><b>3. </b>Simplicity, naturalness, ease, familiarity.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Informant.<BR><b>2. </b>Accuser, complainant, informant.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Breaking, breach, infringement, violation, transgression, disobedience, nonobservance.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Break, violate, transgress, disobey, break through, trench upon, set at nought.

infuriate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>infuriated</b>)</b><BR> Enraged, raging, incensed, furious, wild with anger.

infuse
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Instil, ingraft, implant, inspire, breathe into, introduce, inculcate.<BR><b>2. </b>Introduce, diffuse, shed.<BR><b>3. </b>Steep (<i>in liquor</i>), macerate.

infusion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Introduction, inculcation, instil lation.<BR><b>2. </b>Infusing, steeping, macerating.<BR><b>3. </b>Steeped liquor.

ingenious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inventive, gifted, able, sagacious, clever, bright, ready.<BR><b>2. </b>That shows invention, exhibiting ingenuity.

inspire
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Inhale air, draw in the breath.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inhale, breathe in.<BR><b>2. </b>Breathe into, fill with the breath.<BR><b>3. </b>Infuse, instil.<BR><b>4. </b>Animate, inspirit, enliven, cheer.<BR><b>5. </b>Affect by supernatural influence, fill with supernatural knowledge, endow with superhuman insight.<BR><b>6. </b>Endow with extraordinary insight, fill <i>or</i> endow with genius.<BR><b>7. </b>Elevate, exalt, stimulate to aspiration, fill with enthusiasm.<BR><b>8. </b>Animate, imbue, inform, quicken, enliven, fill.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Establish, found, originate, appoint, settle, fix, set up.<BR><b>2. </b>Enact, ordain, establish, pass.<BR><b>3. </b>Begin, commence, set in operation, set going, set on foot.<BR><b>4. </b>Invest with a sacred office, invest with the care of souls.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Doctrine, dogma, precept, maxim, principle, tenet.<BR><b>2. </b>Scientific body, literary <i>or</i> philosophical society.<BR><b>3. </b>School, academy, gymnasium, seminary, place of education, institution of learning, institution.

institution
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Establishing, founding, foundation, enactment, etc. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> institute, <i>v. a</i>., 1 and 2.<BR><b>2. </b>Establishment, organized society.<BR><b>3. </b>Investiture.<BR><b>4. </b>Established custom, organized relation, organized <i>or</i> established practice.<BR><b>5. </b>Institute, school, academy, seminary, gymnasium, college, university, place of education.

instruct
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Teach, inform, enlighten, indoctrinate, exercise, train, school, educate.<BR><b>2. </b>Direct, command, order, enjoin, prescribe to.

instruction
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Teaching, information, education, indoctrination, training, schooling, discipline, tuition, nurture, breeding.<BR><b>2. </b>Advice, counsel, precept.<BR><b>3. </b>Direction, order, command, mandate.

instrument
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Tool, implement, utensil.<BR><b>2. </b>Medium, agent, means.<BR><b>3. </b>Writing, document, charter, deed, indenture.<BR><b>4. </b>Musical instrument.

instrumental
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conducive, subservient, serviceable, helping, helpful, assisting, auxiliary, ancillary, subsidiary, ministerial.<BR><b>2. </b>Of (<i>musical</i>) instruments.

insubordinate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Disobedient, unruly, mutinous, riotous, seditious, disorderly, turbulent, ungovernable, refractory.

insufficient
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inadequate, incompetent, deficient.<BR><b>2. </b>Unsuited, unfitted, incapable, unqualified.

insular
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Surrounded by water, with the characteristics of an island.<BR><b>2. </b>Of islands, belonging to islands, characteristic of islands.<BR><b>3. </b>Narrow, contracted, prejudiced, petty, illiberal, limited, restricted.

insulate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Detach, isolate, separate, disconnect, disunite, disengage.

insulation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Isolation, separation, disconnection, disengagement.

insult
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Affront, offence, indignity, outrage, abuse, contumely.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Affront, offend, abuse, treat with insolence, offer an indignity to, show <i>or</i> display insolence toward, commit an indignity upon.

insulting
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Insolent, abusive, vituperative, grossly abusive, contumelious.

insuperable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Insurmountable, impassable.<BR><b>2. </b>Insurmountable, too great to be overcome, that cannot be got over.

insurgent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Rebellious, seditious, insubordinate, disobedient, mutinous.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Rebel, revolter.

insurmountable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> insuperable.

insurrection
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Rebellion, revolt, sedition, mutiny, rising, uprising.

intact
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Untouched, uninjured, unhurt, unharmed, scathless.<BR><b>2. </b>Undiminished, unbroken, whole, entire, without a fracture.

intangibility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Intangibleness.

intangible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Impalpable, that cannot be touched, that cannot be felt.<BR><b>2. </b>Impalpable, imperceptible, indefinite, vague, dim.

integral
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Whole, entire, total.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Mathematics</i>) Fluent.

integrity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Wholeness, entireness, entirety, completeness.<BR><b>2. </b>Rectitude, uprightness, probity, honesty, virtue, goodness, principle, moral soundness.

intellect
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Understanding, reason, mind, sense, brains, thinking principle, reasoning faculty, rational faculty, discursive faculty, intellectual powers, intellectual faculties, cognitive faculty, cognitive powers, power of cognition.

intellectual
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mental, of the intellect, of the understanding, pertaining <i>or</i> relating to the intellect.<BR><b>2. </b>Of intellect, marked by intellect, of marked intellect, full of intellect <i>or</i> intelligence.

intelligence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Information, knowledge, acquired knowledge.<BR><b>2. </b>News, tidings, advice, notice, notification, instruction.<BR><b>3. </b>Spirit, spiritual being.<BR><b>4. </b>Penetration, acumen, quickness, brightness, quick understanding, discernment, clear apprehension.

intelligent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Instructed, enlightened, well informed.<BR><b>2. </b>Astute, acute, quick, alert, knowing, clever, bright, apt, shrewd, discerning, clear sighted, keen sighted, quick sighted, sharp sighted, sharp witted, keen eyed, long headed, clear headed.

intelligible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Clear, plain, distinct, comprehensible, that may be understood.

intemperance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Excess (<i>in any action</i> or <i>in any indulgence</i>), want of moderation.<BR><b>2. </b>Habitual excess in drinking intoxicating liquors.

intense
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Close, strict, intent, severe, strained, stretched.<BR><b>2. </b>Extreme, very great, of high <i>or</i> great degree.<BR><b>3. </b>Forcible, energetic, vigorous, powerful.<BR><b>4. </b>Ardent, vehement, earnest.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Strengthen, deepen, quicken, make intense, make more intense.

intensive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Intensifying, emphatic, serving to add force.<BR><b>2. </b>Capable of intensification.

intent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Eager, earnest, close, closely fixed.<BR><b>2. </b>Bent, resolutely bent, set.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Design, purpose, intention, aim, end, meaning, drift, purport, object, scope, mark, purview.

intention

intentional
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Designed, intended, premeditated, contemplated, preconcerted, studied, deliberate.

inter
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Bury (<i>with funeral rites</i>), inhume, entomb, inurn, commit to the earth.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Forbid, prohibit, inhibit, proscribe.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Prohibition, interdiction.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Eccles</i>.) Ban, suspension of religious privileges.

interest
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Concern, affect, touch, be of importance to.<BR><b>2. </b>Engage, enlist, attract.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Good, benefit, profit, weal, advantage.<BR><b>2. </b>Share, portion, part, participation.<BR><b>3. </b>Concern, regard, sympathy, pleased attention.<BR><b>4. </b>Authority, influence.<BR><b>5. </b>Selfishness, self interest, private interest.<BR><b>6. </b>Premium (<i>for the use of money</i>), profit (<i>from money loaned</i>).

internal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Interior, inner, inward, inside.<BR><b>2. </b>Spiritual, incorporeal, mental, in the mind <i>or</i> heart.<BR><b>3. </b>[<i>Said of meaning</i> or <i>sense</i>.] Inner, interior, under, hidden, deeper, higher, spiritual, secret, metaphorical, emblematic, symbolical.<BR><b>4. </b>Intrinsic, real, genuine, true.<BR><b>5. </b>Domestic, home, interior (<i>as opposed to foreign</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reciprocal action, interaction.

interpolate

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Intrude, thrust in.<BR><b>2. </b>Put in, insert, set <i>or</i> place between.<BR><b>3. </b>Offer (<i>or</i> bring in <i>or</i> to bear) by way of mediation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mediate, intercede, arbitrate.<BR><b>2. </b>Remark (<i>by way of interruption</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Interfere, intermeddle.<BR><b>4. </b>Interfere, go <i>or</i> come to the rescue, bring succor.

intractable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Stubborn, obstinate, perverse, refractory, dogged, headstrong, unmanageable, ungovernable, indocile, obdurate, cross grained, wilful, inflexible, unyielding, contumacious, cantankerous, froward, unruly, pig headed, mulish.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Plot, conspiracy, cabal, machination, stratagem, manoeuvre, wile, finesse, ruse.<BR><b>2. </b>Amour, love affair, <i>liaison</i>, illicit intimacy.<BR><b>3. </b>Gallantry, libertinism.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Manoeuvre, form plots.<BR><b>2. </b>Carry on an amour <i>or</i> amours.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>intrinsical</b>)<BR><b>1. </b>Inherent, internal, inward, inborn, inbred, native, natural, ingrained, not extrinsic.<BR><b>2. </b>Real, genuine, true, essential.

intrude
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obtrude, force one's self, thrust one's self, enter where one is not welcome, interlope.<BR><b>2. </b>Encroach, trench, infringe, trespass.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Obtrude, force in, thrust in, press in, foist in, worm in.

intuitive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Apprehended immediately, perceived at once (<i>without reasoning</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Immediate, full, clear, distinct.

intumescence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Swelling, tumefaction, turgescence, inturgescence.

inundate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flood, deluge, submerge, overflow, overwhelm, drown.<BR><b>2. </b>Fill to superfluity, flood, deluge, glut.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>March into, enter in force, enter with an army.<BR><b>2. </b>Infringe, violate, encroach upon, trench upon.

invalidate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Nullify, annul, cancel, overthrow, make void, render of no effect.

invariable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unchangeable, immutable, unalterable, changeless.<BR><b>2. </b>Constant, unchanging, uniform, changeless, unvarying.

invasion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Attack, assault, aggression, incursion, irruption, inroad, foray, raid.<BR><b>2. </b>Encroachment, infringement, violation.<BR><b>3. </b>Invading. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> the verb.

invective
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abuse, contumely, reproach, censure, railing, vituperation, sarcastic attack, rhetorical assault.<BR><b>2. </b>Satire, sarcasm, pasquinade, philippic, diatribe, fling.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abusive, reproachful, censorious, captious, railing, scolding.<BR><b>2. </b>Satirical, sarcastic, assailing.

inveigle
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Entice, decoy, beguile, entrap, ensnare, lure.

invention
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inventing, origination, creation.<BR><b>2. </b>Contrivance, device, design.<BR><b>3. </b>Ingenuity, power of inventing.<BR><b>4. </b>Fabrication, forgery, fiction, coinage.

inventive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Ingenious, creative, quick at contrivance, fertile in expedients.

inventory
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  List (<i>as of the goods of a merchant</i> or <i>of a deceased person</i>), roll, schedule, record, account, register. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> catalogue.

inverse
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inverted (<i>as respects order</i> or <i>relation</i>), reversed, indirect.

invert
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Turn upside down.<BR><b>2. </b>Reverse, place in contrary order.

invertebrate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> invertebral

investigate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Examine, scrutinize, canvass, study, sift, consider, overhaul, explore, probe, dissect, look into, search out, search into, inquire into, follow up.

investigation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Examination, study, scrutiny, inquiry, research, exploration, inquisition, sifting.

investiture
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Installation, induction, habilitation.

inveterate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obstinate, besetting, chronic, deep seated, long established.<BR><b>2. </b>Habituated, habitual, accustomed, confirmed, hardened.

invidious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Offensive, hateful, odious, likely to excite ill will.

invigorate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Strengthen, fortify, animate, quicken, energize, give vigor to, give life and energy to.

inviolable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Sacred, inviolate, stainless, holy.

inviolate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unbroken, unviolated.<BR><b>2. </b>Unhurt, uninjured, unprofaned, unpolluted, unstained, stainless.<BR><b>3. </b>Sacred, inviolable.

inviting
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Alluring, attractive, winning, engaging, captivating, pleasing, fascinating, bewitching.<BR><b>2. </b>Prepossessing, promising.

invoice
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  List (<i>of articles of merchandise shipped</i> or <i>sold</i>), inventory, bill, schedule.

invoke
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Implore, supplicate, pray, entreat, beg, beseech, importune, solicit, conjure, adjure, call upon, pray to, appeal to, prefer a request to.

involuntary
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Instinctive, automatic, blind, independent of volition.<BR><b>2. </b>Unwilling, reluctant, compulsory, against one's will.

involve
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Envelop, inwrap, wrap, cover.<BR><b>2. </b>Include (<i>as a consequence</i>), imply, comprise, embrace, contain, lead to.<BR><b>3. </b>Entangle, implicate.<BR><b>4. </b>Complicate, make intricate.<BR><b>5. </b>Join, conjoin, connect, unite, mingle, blend.<BR><b>6. </b>Twine, intwine, intertwine, interweave, interlace, inweave, intertwist, twist together.

invulnerable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Incapable of being wounded, secure from injury, that cannot be wounded.<BR><b>2. </b>Unassailable, irrefragable, invincible, incontrovertible.

iota
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Jot, whit, tittle, bit, grain, particle, atom, scrap, mite, scintilla, spark, glimmer, shadow, trace.

irascible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Irritable, touchy, testy, waspish, quick, snappish, splenetic, petulant, choleric, peppery, hot, hasty, like tinder, like touchwood.

irate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Angry, provoked, piqued, irritated, ireful, in a passion.

ire
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Poetical</i>.) Wrath, anger, rage, fury, choler, indignation, resentment, passion, exasperation.

iridescence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Play of colors (<i>like those of the rainbow</i>).

iridescent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Rainbow like, irisated, nacreous, pavonine.

irksome
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Wearisome (<i>in consequence of being distasteful</i>), tiresome, wearying, weary, devoid of interest. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> tedious.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Mockery (<i>saying one thing and meaning the opposite</i>).

irradiate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Illuminate, illumine, illume, brighten, light up, make bright, shine upon, throw light upon, cast lustre upon, adorn with light.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Emit rays, be radiant, give out light, be luminous <i>or</i> lustrous.

irrational
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Brutish, brute, void of reason, without reason.<BR><b>2. </b>Absurd, unreasonable, preposterous, foolish, silly, unwise; injudicious, extravagant.<BR><b>3. </b>Demented, alienated (<i>in mind</i>), crazy, lunatic, aberrant.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Mathematics</i>) Surd.

irreconcilable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unappeasable, inexorable, implacable, inexpiable.<BR><b>2. </b>Inconsistent, incompatible, incongruous.

irrefutable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Indisputable, unanswerable. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> irrefragable.

irregular
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Anomalous, abnormal, anomalistic, unusual, unconformable, aberrant, exceptional, eccentric, erratic, devious.<BR><b>2. </b>Uncertain, unpunctual, capricious, desultory, fitful, variable, changeable.<BR><b>3. </b>Immethodical, disordered, disorderly.<BR><b>4. </b>Unsymmetrical, uneven.<BR><b>5. </b>Disorderly, dissolute, loose, immoral, wild.

irrelevant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inapplicable, impertinent, aside from the point, foreign to the purpose, not bearing upon the point in question, having nothing to do with the matter, travelling out of the record.

irremediable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irreparable, irrecoverable, remediless, beyond correction, beyond redress, past mending.<BR><b>2. </b>Incurable, remediless, immedicable, irremedicable, hopeless, irrecoverable, beyond cure.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Irremediable, remediless, irrecoverable, irretrievable, not to be repaired.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Uncontrollable, insuppressible, not to be repressed.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> irreprehensible.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Overpowering, incapable of being successfully resisted, that carries all before it.<BR><b>2. </b>Irrefragable (<i>which see</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Undetermined, undecided, wavering, vacillating, unsettled, unsteady, hesitating, hesitant, faltering, infirm of purpose.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unaccountable.

irreversible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unchangeable, unalterable, irrevocable, irrepealable.<BR><b>2. </b>Immutable, invariable, changeless.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Water, moisten, wet.

irritable
