Point in dispute.<BR><b>9. </b>Antagonism, contest, controversy, controversial <i>or</i> antagonistic stand.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deliver, send out, put forth.<BR><b>2. </b>Distribute, give out.<BR><b>3. </b>Put into circulation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Flow, flow out <i>or</i> forth, spring, gush, come out, rush out.<BR><b>2. </b>Proceed, flow, emanate, arise, spring, originate, follow, ensue, come, take rise, be the effect, be derived, go forth, grow out.<BR><b>3. </b>End, terminate, result.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vindication, defence, exculpation, exoneration.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Theology</i>) Absolution, remission of sin.

justify
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vindicate, warrant, defend, maintain, exculpate, excuse, exonerate, set right.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Theology</i>) Absolve, acquit, free from sin, clear from guilt.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Printing</i>.) Adjust.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Young, youthful, childish, puerile.<BR><b>2. </b>Suited to youth, intended for youth.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>(<i>Rare</i>.) Deadly, mortal, fatal.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>lethargical</b>)</b><BR> Drowsy, dull, torpid, heavy, stupid, stupefied, comatose, morbidly sleepy.

lethargy
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Stupor, torpor, coma, stupefaction, hypnotism, stupidity, morbid drowsiness.

levee
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Time of rising.<BR><b>2. </b>[<i>U. S</i>.] Ceremonious party, reception, entertainment, <i>soiree</i>.<BR><b>3. </b>[<i>Europe</i>.] Morning reception (<i>by a prince</i> or <i>great personage</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>[<i>U. S</i>.] Embankment (<i>along a river to prevent inundation</i>).

levity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lightness, want of weight.<BR><b>2. </b>Frivolity, flightiness, giddiness, volatility, want of seriousness.

levy
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Raise, muster, call together.<BR><b>2. </b>Collect, gather.

lexicon
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Dictionary, glossary, vocabulary, word book.

liability
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Responsibility, accountableness, accountability, bounden duty.<BR><b>2. </b>Exposedness.

liaison
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Fr.]<BR><b>1. </b>Amour, intrigue, illicit intimacy, criminal intimacy.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) Connection, union, bond of union, relation.

libel
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Malicious publication, defamation, defamatory writing.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Charge, statement of complaint.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lampoon, defame (<i>by some publication</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Proceed against by a libel, bring a charge against.

liberal
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Generous, bountiful, free, beneficent, munificent, princely, charitable, open hearted, free hearted, unselfish, disinterested.<BR><b>2. </b>Enlarged, catholic, tolerant, unbigoted, high minded, magnanimous, honorable, chivalrous.<BR><b>3. </b>Large, full, unstinted, abundant, bounteous, ample, plentiful.<BR><b>4. </b>Refined, liberalizing, refining, befitting a freeman, humanizing.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Liberalist, advocate of liberal principles.

liberality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Generosity, bounty, beneficence, munificence, disinterestedness, bountifulness, charity.<BR><b>2. </b>Present, gift, benefaction.<BR><b>3. </b>Catholicity, toleration, magnanimity, candor, impartiality, largeness of mind, large mindedness, freedom from narrowness, freedom from bigotry.

liberate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Release, free, emancipate, manumit, disinthrall, ransom, discharge, deliver, set free, set at liberty, let go, let loose, let out.

libertine
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Rake, debauchee, profligate, <i>roue</i>, dissolute man, man of pleasure.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Licentious, dissolute, depraved, corrupt.

liberty
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Freedom (<i>after previous restraint</i>), liberation from foreign restraint, independence, self direction, self government.<BR><b>2. </b>Privilege, immunity, franchise.<BR><b>3. </b>Leave, permission, license.

license
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Permission, privilege, leave, right.<BR><b>2. </b>Permit, warrant.<BR><b>3. </b>Laxity, excessive liberty, exorbitant freedom, disorder, anarchy, lawlessness.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Permit, allow, grant authority to, give a permit <i>or</i> warrant to.

low

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Pull, tug, haul, drag.

lukewarm
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Tepid, blood warm, slightly warm, thermal.<BR><b>2. </b>Indifferent, unconcerned, listless, cold, torpid, dull.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Compose, quiet, calm, still, hush, tranquillize, put to rest.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Subside, cease, abate, decrease, diminish, become calm.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Calm, calmness, temporary quiet, cessation.

S</i>.] Sawed <i>or</i> split timber.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Heap in disorder.<BR><b>2. </b>Fill with trumpery, choke, crowd, obstruct, encumber.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Trudge, move heavily.<BR><b>2. </b>Rumble.<BR><b>3. </b>[<i>U. S</i>.] Cut timber, prepare logs for lumber.

S</i>.] One tenth of a cent.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Grind, comminute, pulverize, powder, levigate.<BR><b>2. </b>Stamp (<i>as coin</i>) on the edge.<BR><b>3. </b>Full (<i>as cloth</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Throw (<i>as silk</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Variegated, dappled, party colored, mottled.<BR><b>2. </b>Heterogeneous, diversified, mingled, composite, mixed.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Variegated, spotted, motley, speckled, dappled, piebald, of various colors.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Full of mountains, hilly.<BR><b>2. </b>Huge, enormous, tremendous, bulky.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Chaps, jaws, cavity between the jaws.<BR><b>2. </b>Aperture (<i>in a vessel for receiving or discharging anything</i>), opening, orifice.<BR><b>3. </b>Entrance (<i>as of a cave</i> or <i>a river</i>), inlet.<BR><b>4. </b>Cry, voice.<BR><b>5. </b>Oracle, mouthpiece, speaker, spokesman.<BR><b>6. </b>Grimace, wry face, mow.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Vociferate, rant.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hatred, hate, dislike, enmity, abhorrence, detestation, antipathy.<BR><b>2. </b>Odiousness, repulsiveness.<BR><b>3. </b>Obloquy, opprobrium, reproach.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Scent (<i>good</i> or <i>bad</i>), smell, perfume, fragrance, redolence.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>odorous</b>)</b><BR> Fragrant, perfumed, balmy, aromatic, sweet smelling, sweet scented, odorant.

offence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Attack, assault, aggression, onset (<i>in the expression &quot;weapons of offence</i>&quot;).<BR><b>2. </b>Hurt, harm, injury.<BR><b>3. </b>Displeasure, anger, indignation, wrath, umbrage, resentment.<BR><b>4. </b>Injury, injustice, affront, wrong, insult, indignity, outrage.<BR><b>5. </b>Trespass, transgression, misdeed, delinquency, misdemeanor, crime, sin, fault.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affront, displease, vex, chafe, annoy, irritate, provoke, nettle, mortify, fret, gall, give offence to, make angry.<BR><b>2. </b>Shock, wound, pain, annoy, molest.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Give offence.<BR><b>2. </b>Transgress, sin, do wrong, commit offence, stumble, err, fall.<BR><b>3. </b>Take offence, be scandalized.

override
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pass, ride beyond, outride.<BR><b>2. </b>Outweigh, surpass, be superior to, take precedence of, supersede, annul, trample down.<BR><b>3. </b>Ride over.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Control, govern, sway, have control of.<BR><b>2. </b>Annul, cancel, revoke, rescind, repeal, nullify, recall, reject, repudiate, supersede, set aside.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Superintend, supervise, overlook, inspect, have charge of, have the direction of.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Overshade, overcloud.<BR><b>2. </b>Shelter, protect, cover, hover over.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Open, manifest, public, patent, notorious, glaring, apparent.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Open, manifest.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Overturn, upset, overset, throw down.<BR><b>2. </b>Demolish, destroy, level, throw down.<BR><b>3. </b>Vanquish, conquer, defeat, worst, overcome, master, overpower, overbear, overwhelm, subjugate, crush, discomfit, beat, rout, foil.<BR><b>4. </b>Subvert, destroy, ruin.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fall.<BR><b>2. </b>Subversion, prostration, ruin.<BR><b>3. </b>Destruction, demolition, ruin, shipwreck.<BR><b>4. </b>Defeat, discomfiture, rout, dispersion.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> overthrow.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Endurance.<BR><b>2. </b>Endurance (<i>without complaint</i>), fortitude, resignation, submission, sufferance, long sufferance, long suffering, calmness, composure.<BR><b>3. </b>Quietness, calmness.<BR><b>4. </b>Forbearance, leniency, indulgence, longsuffering.<BR><b>5. </b>Perseverance, persistence, indefatigableness, constancy, diligence, assiduity.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Continue, remain, last, endure.<BR><b>2. </b>Persevere, be steadfast.

persistence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>persistency</b>)<BR><b>1. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> perseverance.<BR><b>2. </b>Obstinacy, contumacy, doggedness, stubbornness, perverseness, pertinacity, obduracy, headiness, pig headedness.<BR><b>3. </b>Continuance, continuation.

persistent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Persevering, constant, enduring, tenacious, fixed, immovable, persistive, persisting, steady.

personable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Graceful, good looking, well appearing, comely, seemly, well favored.

personage
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Individual, person.<BR><b>2. </b>Person of rank, great person, illustrious person.<BR><b>3. </b>Exterior appearance, stature, air.<BR><b>4. </b>Character assumed, disguise.<BR><b>5. </b>Character represented, impersonation.

personality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Individuality, distinct, existence.<BR><b>2. </b>Personal criticism, remark, reflection, allusion, animadversion, stricture, <i>or</i> exception.

personally
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Individually, as to one's person.<BR><b>2. </b>In person, by bodily presence.<BR><b>3. </b>Particularly.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Rhetoric</i>)<BR><b>1. </b>Prosopopoeia.<BR><b>2. </b>Embodiment, impersonation.

perspective
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Vista, prospect, view.

perspicacious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Quick sighted, sharpsighted, keen sighted.<BR><b>2. </b>Discerning, acute, keen, sagacious, shrewd, clear sighted, keen sighted, sharp witted, keen witted, long headed, eagle eyed, penetrating.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Clearness, lucidness, lucidity, transparency, plainness, intelligibility, perspicuousness, distinctness, explicitness.

perspicuous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Clear, lucid, plain, transparent, intelligible, distinct, explicit, unequivocal, obvious.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exudation, sweating.<BR><b>2. </b>Sweat.

perspire
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Sweat.

persuade
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Induce, influence, lead, incite, impel, actuate, move, entice, allure, prevail upon, bring over, win over, bring round.<BR><b>2. </b>Advise, counsel, try to influence.<BR><b>3. </b>Convince, satisfy by proof <i>or</i> evidence.<BR><b>4. </b>Inculcate, by argument, teach.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Convincing, cogent, logical, valid, sound, weighty, inducing, persuasory.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Inducement, incitement, exhortation.

pertinacious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Constant, steady, firm, determined, resolute, steadfast, stanch.<BR><b>2. </b>Stubborn, obstinate, dogged, wilful, mulish, unyielding, intractable, headstrong, perverse, wayward, inflexible.

pertinent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fit, appropriate, suitable, relevant, apposite, adapted, applicable, pat, proper, to the point, to the purpose.<BR><b>2. </b>Regarding, concerning, belonging, pertaining, appurtenant.

peruse
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Read.<BR><b>2. </b>Observe, examine, scrutinize, consider, inspect.

pervade
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Permeate, penetrate, pass through.<BR><b>2. </b>Overspread, fill, run through, be diffused through, be disseminated through, extend through, affect entirely.

perverse
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Distorted (<i>from the right</i>), bad, perverted.<BR><b>2. </b>Obstinate, stubborn, wilful, dogged, mulish, untrastable, unyielding, headstrong, pertinacious, wayward, ungovernable, froward, pervicacious.<BR><b>3. </b>Cross, petulant, peevish, waspish, captious, snappish, touchy, testy, crusty, churlish, crabbed, froward, morose, surly, snarling, ill tempered, ill natured, spleeny, spiteful.<BR><b>4. </b>Untoward, vexatious, troublesome, inconvenient.

pervert
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Distort, stretch, falsify, make an ill use of, misinterpret.<BR><b>2. </b>Entice, tempt, corrupt.<BR><b>3. </b>Convert, proselyte.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Apostate, proselyte.

plague
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pestilence, pest.<BR><b>2. </b>Affliction, annoyance, vexation, trouble, nuisance, curse, torment, thorn in one's side.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Annoy, tease, vex, worry, trouble, molest, torment, harass, harry, disturb, fret, gall, chafe, bore, incommode, bother, pester, badger, hector, irritate, disquiet, distress, afflict, tantalize, embarrass, perplex.

plain
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Even, level, smooth, flat, plane.<BR><b>2. </b>Open, clear, unencumbered, uninterrupted.<BR><b>3. </b>Manifest, visible, obvious, clear, unmistakable, apparent, certain, palpable, conspicuous, notable, notorious, glaring, patent, open, evident, distinct.<BR><b>4. </b>Unequivocal, unambiguous, distinct, explicit, intelligible, perspicuous.<BR><b>5. </b>Simple, unadorned.<BR><b>6. </b>Homely, ugly, ill looking, ill favored.<BR><b>7. </b>Artless, honest, sincere, candid, frank, open, downright, direct, unsophisticated, ingenuous, undesigning, straightforward, single minded, open hearted, above board, unreserved.<BR><b>8. </b>Artless, simple, unlearned, unsophisticated, natural, unaffected, homely, common.<BR><b>9. </b>Mere, absolute, unmistakable.<BR><b>10. </b>Easy, direct, clear.<BR><b>11. </b>Simple, frugal, homely.<BR><b>12. </b>Unornamented, unfigured, unvariegated.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Plateau, champaign, savanna, pampas, table land, champaign country.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Attitude (<i>formally assumed</i>), posture, artificial position.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Puzzle, stagger, embarrass, bewilder, perplex, mystify, nonplus, put out, put to a stand, confound, dumfound.

positive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Express, direct, explicit, determinate, defined, precise, definite, clear, unequivocal, unmistakable, categorical, expressed, laid down.<BR><b>2. </b>Real, actual, veritable, substantial, true, absolute, existing in fact.<BR><b>3. </b>Absolute, not relative.<BR><b>4. </b>Confident, sure, assured, certain, fully convinced.<BR><b>5. </b>Indisputable, decisive, incontrovertible, indubitable.<BR><b>6. </b>Decisive, unconditional, imperative.<BR><b>7. </b>Dogmatic, stubborn, peremptory, obstinate, over confident, tenacious, overbearing.

possess
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Own, have a title to, be seized of.<BR><b>2. </b>Have, hold, occupy, control.<BR><b>3. </b>Put in possession.<BR><b>4. </b>Acquaint, inform, make known.<BR><b>5. </b>Seize, obtain, take possession of.

possession
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ownership.<BR><b>2. </b>Occupation, occupancy, control, tenure, retention.<BR><b>3. </b>Thing possessed, property.<BR><b>4. </b>State of being possessed, madness, lunacy.

post
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pillar, column, support.<BR><b>2. </b>Station, position, seat.<BR><b>3. </b>Office, employment, place, situation, station.<BR><b>4. </b>Messenger, intelligencer, mercury.<BR><b>5. </b>Postman, courier, letter carrier, express, mail carrier.<BR><b>6. </b>Mail.<BR><b>7. </b>Speed, haste, hurry, despatch.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Place, station, set, put, fix, establish.<BR><b>2. </b>Placard, advertise, announce, make known, blaze abroad, spread abroad.<BR><b>3. </b>Stigmatize (<i>by public notice</i>), vilify, brand, defame, disgrace.<BR><b>4. </b>Put in the ledger, carry to the ledger.<BR><b>5. </b>Mail, put in the mail, put in the post office.

poster
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Placard, bill, hand bill, broadside, <i>affiche</i>.

posterior
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Subsequent, following, later after, succeeding, ensuing.<BR><b>2. </b>Hind, hinder, back, rear.

posthumous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Post obit, after death.

postpone
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Defer, delay, adjourn, procrastinate, put off, stave off, let lie over, prorogue.

postscript
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Appendix, supplement.

postulate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Supposition, conjecture, hypothesis, assumption, theory, speculation, axiom, assumed truth, <i>postulatum</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Geometry</i>) Self evident problem.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Assume, presuppose.<BR><b>2. </b>Solicit, entreat, supplicate, beseech.

posture
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Position, attitude, pose.<BR><b>2. </b>State, condition, situation, phase.<BR><b>3. </b>Disposition, mood, condition, state, phase.

pot
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Kettle, saucepan, pan, skillet.<BR><b>2. </b>Mug, cup, stoop, tankard, can.<BR><b>3. </b>Jar, jug, crock.

potable
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Drinkable, potulent, that may be drunk.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Beverage, drink.

potation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Drinking.<BR><b>2. </b>Drink, draught.<BR><b>3. </b>Dram, drink, potion, draught.<BR><b>4. </b>Drinking bout, debauch, carouse, perpotation, tippling.

potent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strong, forcible, powerful, efficacious, physically strong.<BR><b>2. </b>Powerful, mighty, able, efficient, puissant, strong.<BR><b>3. </b>Influential, efficacious, cogent, powerful.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Monarch, sovereign, king, emperor, prince, ruler.

potential
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Possible, in posse.

potentiality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Possibility.

pother
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Bustle, tumult, turmoil, flutter, rumpus, confusion, pudder, huddle, turbulence, hurlyburly, commotion.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Harass, perplex, puzzle, tease, embarrass, beset, confuse, confound, bewilder, pose.

potter
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Trifle, pudder, busy one's self about trifles.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Earthen ware, clay ware.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Bag (<i>small</i>), sack.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Claw, talon.

pound
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beat, strike.<BR><b>2. </b>Bray, bruise, crush, pulverize, triturate, comminute, levigate.<BR><b>3. </b>Impound, confine in a pound, coop, enclose, shut up.

pout
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Whiting pout, bib pout (<i>Morrhua lusca</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Catfish, horn pout, horned pout, bull head (<i>Pimelodus cattus</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Fit of sullenness, sulk.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Look sullen (<i>by protruding the lips</i>), look black, show ill temper.

poverty
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indigence, penury, want, destitution, need, necessity, privation, neediness, distress, straitened circumstances.<BR><b>2. </b>Beggary, mendicancy, pauperism.<BR><b>3. </b>Need, lack, want, deficiency, scantiness, sparingness, meagreness, jejuneness.<BR><b>4. </b>Paucity, exiguity, poorness, smallness.<BR><b>5. </b>Barrenness, sterility, unproductiveness, unfruitfulness.

practicable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Feasible, performable, possible, achievable, attainable.<BR><b>2. </b>Capable of use, usable, capable of passage <i>or</i> entrance, passable, penetrable.

practical
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Adapted to practice <i>or</i> use, not speculative, not theoretical, adjusted to facts, not visionary.<BR><b>2. </b>Experienced, versed, proficient, trained, qualified, practised, skilled, thoroughbred, able, <i>au fait.</i>

practically
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> <b>1. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> practical.<BR><b>2. </b>Actually, as a matter of fact, in fact, in effect, so far as results are concerned.

prank
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Caper, frolic, antic, gambol, trick.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Bedizen, begaud, trick out.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Make ostentation, make a gaudy show.

prate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Prattle, chatter, tattle, babble, gabble, palaver, jabber, be loquacious, be garrulous.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Tell (<i>foolishly</i>), babble, utter, prate about.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Prattle, gabble, chatter, twaddle, palaver, idle talk, childish talk, twattle, non sense.

preach
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Proclaim (<i>as in a religious discourse</i>), declare, publish, pronounce, deliver.<BR><b>2. </b>Inculcate, teach, urge, press urgently.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deliver sermons, discourse on religious subjects.<BR><b>2. </b>Prate sanctimoniously, exhort over righteously, moralize <i>ex cathedra</i>.

precarious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Uncertain, unsettled, unsteady, doubtful, dubious, equivocal, insecure, not to be depended upon, unreliable, hazardous, perilous, risky, riskful, unassured.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Antecedent, precedent, anterior, previous, prior, precursory, earlier, foregoing, above, above mentioned, aforesaid, above named.

precious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Costly, of great price, priceless.<BR><b>2. </b>Very valuable, of great worth, of great value, inestimable, priceless.<BR><b>3. </b>Dear, beloved, darling, very estimable, highly esteemed <i>or</i> valued, cherished, treasured, prized, idolized, adored.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Ironical.</i>) Good for nothing, worthless contemptible, base, despicable, pitiful.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Cliff, crag, steep, abrupt declivity, clift.

precipitate
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Throw <i>or</i> hurl headlong, cast down, fling downward.<BR><b>2. </b>Hasten, hurry, accelerate, speed, expedite, urge forward, quicken, despatch, forward, advance, further, bring on, cause to occur too soon, bring on sooner.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Chemistry</i>) Throw down, cause to subside.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>Chemistry</i>) Precipitated substance.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hasty, hurried, rash, headlong, reckless, indiscreet, over hasty, rashly hasty.<BR><b>2. </b>Violent, sudden, abrupt.

precipitation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Haste, hurry, flurry, precipitance, precipitancy.<BR><b>2. </b>Rashness, recklessness, thoughtlessness, heedlessness, inconsiderateness, temerity.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Steep, abrupt, sheer, perpendicular.<BR><b>2. </b>Precipitate, headlong, rushing, sudden, sheer downward.

precise
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exact, correct, definite, strict, express, distinct, explicit, severe, well defined, accurate, nice, pointed, unequivocal.<BR><b>2. </b>Scrupulous, strict, careful, exact (<i>in conduct</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Formal, ceremonious, stiff, rigid, starch, starched, prim, punctilious, finical.

preponderance

preponderate

prepossessing
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Attractive, alluring, engaging, winning, fascinating, taking, captivating, bewitching, winning <i>or</i> inviting favor, charming.

preposterous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Perverted, having the cart before the horse, reversed.<BR><b>2. </b>Absurd, unreasonable, extravagant, excessive, ridiculous, irrational, foolish, monstrous, exorbitant, perverted, wrong.

prerogative
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Privilege, immunity, right, liberty, franchise, advantage.

presage
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Forebode, divine, foreknow, have a presentiment of.<BR><b>2. </b>Foretell, predict, prophesy, soothsay, bode, portend, foreshow, indicate, betoken, foretoken, prognosticate, augur. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> vaticinate.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Omen, sign, prognostic, augury, portent, token, boding, foreshowing, indication, auspice.<BR><b>2. </b>Prophecy, prediction, foreboding, premonition, foreknowledge, presentiment.

prescient
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Foreknowing, foreseeing.

prescribe
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Direct, order, appoint, command, ordain, dictate, enjoin, decree, institute, establish.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Conservative, preservatory.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Keep, guard, protect, defend, secure, shield, save.<BR><b>2. </b>Maintain, uphold, sustain, guard, keep.<BR><b>3. </b>Conserve, keep sound, save from decay.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sweetmeat, confect, confection, comfit, confit, confiture, jam, conserve, jelly, marmalade.<BR><b>2. </b>Enclosure (<i>for game</i>).

preside
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Direct, control, govern, act as president.

press
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compress, squeeze, crowd, crush.<BR><b>2. </b>Squeeze out, express.<BR><b>3. </b>Make smooth, smooth, flatten.<BR><b>4. </b>Embrace closely, hug, clasp.<BR><b>5. </b>Constrain, compel, force.<BR><b>6. </b>Enjoin, enforce, urge, inculcate.<BR><b>7. </b>Straiten, distress.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Bear heavily, exert pressure, push, bear down, crowd.<BR><b>2. </b>Hasten, hurry, push, rush.<BR><b>3. </b>Crowd, throng, force a way.<BR><b>4. </b>Approach unseasonably <i>or</i> importunately.<BR><b>5. </b>Encroach.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Machine for printing, printing press.<BR><b>2. </b>Newspaperdom (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Literary publications.<BR><b>4. </b>Crowd, throng, multitude.<BR><b>5. </b>Urgency, pressure, hurry.<BR><b>6. </b>Case, closet, wardrobe, bureau.

pressing
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Urgent, importunate, constraining, distressing.

pressure
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Compressing, squeezing, crushing.<BR><b>2. </b>Influence, constraining force.<BR><b>3. </b>Urgency, press, hurry.<BR><b>4. </b>Affliction, grievance, calamity, distress, straits, oppression, difficulty, embarrassment.<BR><b>5. </b>Impression, stamp, character impressed.

presumable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Probable, reasonable, likely, credible, that stands to reason.

presume
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Suppose, conjecture, think, surmise, believe, assume, apprehend, anticipate.<BR><b>2. </b>Venture, make bold.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Consider, suppose, take for granted.

presumption
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Opinion, belief, supposition, conjecture, guess, anticipation, hypothesis, assumption, understanding, condition, concession.<BR><b>2. </b>Arrogance, forwardness, audacity, boldness, assurance, effrontery, brass, presumptuousness.<BR><b>3. </b>Probability, ground for believing.

presumptuous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Arrogant, bold, forward, presuming, insolent, audacious.<BR><b>2. </b>Rash, over confident, foolhardy.<BR><b>3. </b>Irreverent.

presuppose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Imply as antecedent, assume, presume, surmise, suppose, take for granted.

pretence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Written also <i>Pretense</i>.]<BR><b>1. </b>Show (<i>to conceal a thing to be done</i>), false appearance, seeming, semblance, mask, cloak, color, simulation, affectation.<BR><b>2. </b>Subterfuge, excuse, pretext, fabrication.<BR><b>3. </b>Assumption, claim to notice.<BR><b>4. </b>Pretension, claim.

pretension
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Claim.

pretentious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[<i>Recent</i>.] Assuming, presuming, conceited, vain, priggish.

preternatural
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Irregular (<i>as being aside from the ordinary course of nature, but not necessarily supernatural or miraculous</i>), abnormal, anomalous, unnatural, inexplicable, strange, extraordinary.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Show, appearance, affectation, semblance, guise, cloak, simulation, mask, color, pretence.

prevail
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Overcome.<BR><b>2. </b>Predominate, preponderate, succeed, have the superiority, gain the advantage, be in the ascendant, get the upper hand, carry the day, win the day, gain the day, win the palm.<BR><b>3. </b>Obtain, have effect, power, <i>or</i> influence, have sway, have currency, be in vogue, be rife.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Effectual, dominant, predominant, efficacious, preponderating, persuading, controlling, ruling, overruling, influential, operative, successful.<BR><b>2. </b>Prevalent, most common, most general.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Diffuse, wordy, verbose, circumlocutory, prosaic, loose, long, lengthy, lengthened out, full of detail, prolonged, protracted, long spun, spun out, long winded, discursive, rambling, not concise.<BR><b>2. </b>Tiresome, tedious, wearisome.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Buy, bargain for, get by payment.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Rare</i>.) <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Chance, casual, fortuitous, stray, wandering.

range
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Row, rank, line, tier, file.<BR><b>2. </b>Class, order, kind, sort.<BR><b>3. </b>Excursion, wandering, ramble, expedition, roving.<BR><b>4. </b>Scope, sweep, compass, extent, reach, amplitude, latitude, command, discursive power.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Music</i>) Compass, register.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Class, rank, arrange, set in a row, dispose in order.<BR><b>2. </b>Rove over, pass over.<BR><b>3. </b>Sail along, pass near.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Rove, ramble, wander, stroll, roam, course, straggle, rove at large.<BR><b>2. </b>Consort, be classed, be ranked, rank.<BR><b>3. </b>Lie, run, bend, correspond in direction.

rank
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Luxuriant, vigorous, exuberant, over abundant, high growing, strong in growth.<BR><b>2. </b>Excessive, extravagant, rampant, very great, violent, gross, sheer, utter.<BR><b>3. </b>Rancid, musty, fusty, fetid, offensive, strong smelling, strong scented, frowzy.<BR><b>4. </b>Offensive, high tasted.<BR><b>5. </b>Fertile, rich, productive.<BR><b>6. </b>Gross, coarse, foul, disgusting.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Row, line, tier, range, order.<BR><b>2. </b>Class, order, division, series.<BR><b>3. </b>Degree, grade, quality, relative station.<BR><b>4. </b>Dignity, high degree, distinction, eminence.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Class, arrange, range, classify.<BR><b>2. </b>[<i>Modern</i>] Outrank, take precedence of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Be ranked, be classed, take rank, have rank.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fester, be inflamed.<BR><b>2. </b>Be embittered, become more bitter, grow more intense, be inflamed.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Spout, declaim (<i>boisterously</i>), rave (<i>in high sounding phrases</i>), vociferate, mouth, tear a passion to tatters.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fustian, bombast, rhodomontade, exaggeration, boisterous declamation.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Abiding, dwelling, residing, inhabiting.<BR><b>2. </b>Fixed, firm.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inhabitant, dweller, resider, inhabiter, sojourner.<BR><b>2. </b>Tenant, occupant, dweller.

residual
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Remaining.

residue
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Remainder, rest, remnant, residuum.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Surplus (<i>of a testator's estate</i>), excess, overplus.

resign
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Yield, surrender, relinquish, forego, abandon, quit, forsake, abdicate, leave, give up, assign back, give back.<BR><b>2. </b>Withdraw, give up, renounce.<BR><b>3. </b>Yield, submit, give up, confide.<BR><b>4. </b>Yield, commit, submit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Abdicate, relinquish office.

resignation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Surrender, relinquishment, abandonment, renunciation, abdication.<BR><b>2. </b>Endurance (<i>with a submissive, religious spirit</i>), submission, acquiescence, compliance, patience, sufferance, forbearance, fortitude, long sufferance, long suffering.

resigned
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Surrendered, given up.<BR><b>2. </b>Submissive, unresisting, complying, yielding, uncomplaining, patient, humble, meek, lowly.

resilient
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Rebounding, recoiling, elastic, springy.

resin
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> rosin.

resist
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oppose, withstand, impugn, confront, assail, attack, strive against, counteract, rebuff, stand against.<BR><b>2. </b>Withstand, hinder, check, thwart, baffle, disappoint.

resistance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Opposition.<BR><b>2. </b>Rebuff, check, hindrance.

resolute
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Determined.<BR><b>2. </b>Firm, determined, steady, decided, resolved, stanch, steadfast, fixed, constant, persevering, pertinacious, unflinching, unwavering, inflexible, undaunted, hardy, unshaken, bold, stout, stout hearted.

resolution
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Analysis, decomposition, separation.<BR><b>2. </b>Dissolution, solution.<BR><b>3. </b>Disentanglement, explication, unravelling.<BR><b>4. </b>Firmness, determination, steadiness, constancy, inflexibility, courage, energy, pluck, hardihood, decision, manliness, tenacity of purpose, resolvedness, resoluteness, perseverance, steadfastness, fortitude, boldness, purpose, resolve.<BR><b>5. </b>Resolve, determination, intention, fixed purpose.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Mathematics</i>) Solution, explanation.<BR><b>7. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Disappearance, dispersion, termination, breaking up, removal.<BR><b>8. </b>(<i>Legislation</i>.) Resolve, declaration.

resolve
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Analyze, separate, reduce.<BR><b>2. </b>Dissolve, melt, liquefy.<BR><b>3. </b>Disentangle, interpret, decipher, unravel, explain, unfold, solve.<BR><b>4. </b>Determine, decide, fix in purpose.<BR><b>5. </b>Confirm, fix in resolution.<BR><b>6. </b>Prepare, make ready in mind.<BR><b>7. </b>Reduce, change.<BR><b>8. </b>(<i>Mathematics</i>) Solve.<BR><b>9. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Disperse, scatter.<BR><b>10. </b>(<i>Legislation</i>.) Declare, determine on, express.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dissolve, melt, liquefy, become fluid.<BR><b>2. </b>Intend, purpose, decide, determine, conclude, form a resolution, make up one's mind, come to a determination.<BR><b>3. </b>Determine by vote.<BR><b>4. </b>Be convinced, by settled in opinion.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Intention, resolution, determination, fixed purpose.<BR><b>2. </b>Declaration (<i>by a legislature</i> or <i>an organized body</i>), resolution, determination.

resonance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Reverberation.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Resounding, sonorous, ringing.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unquiet, uneasy, unresting, disquieted, disturbed, restive.<BR><b>2. </b>Unsteady, inconstant, changeable, unstable, unsettled, vacillating, irresolute.<BR><b>3. </b>Roving, wandering, in motion, on the move, unsettled.<BR><b>4. </b>Sleepless.<BR><b>5. </b>Turbulent, agitated.

revoke
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Recall (<i>what has been said</i>), recant, retract, repeal, reverse, annul, cancel, rescind, countermand, abrogate, abolish, make void.

revolt
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Desert, fall off.<BR><b>2. </b>Rebel, mutiny, rise, renounce allegiance.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Repel, shock, do violence to, disgust, nauseate, sicken.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Desertion, inconstancy, faithlessness, change of sides, defection.<BR><b>2. </b>Rebellion, insurrection, mutiny, sedition, uprising.

revolution
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rotation, whirling, circular motion.<BR><b>2. </b>Change (<i>in the political constitution of a country</i>), organic change, successful revolt <i>or</i> rebellion.

revolutionize
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Remodel, reform, new model, change completely.

revulsion
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Withdrawal, drawing back, violent separation, abstraction.<BR><b>2. </b>Reaction, change, transition.

reward
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Recompense, compensate, requite, remunerate, pay, punish.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Recompense, compensation, guerdon, requital, remuneration, pay.<BR><b>2. </b>Premium, bonus, bounty.<BR><b>3. </b>Retribution, punishment, requital.

rhapsody
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Rambling composition, medley of thoughts, sentences, <i>or</i> passages.

rhetoric
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Art of composition, art of discourse.<BR><b>2. </b>Oratory, elocution, eloquence, science of oratory.<BR><b>3. </b>Declamation, artificial eloquence.<BR><b>4. </b>Persuasion, attraction, allurement, charm.

rhetorical
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oratorical.<BR><b>2. </b>Declamatory, highly wrought.

rhythm
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Periodical emphasis, regular <i>or</i> melodious movement, harmonious flow.<BR><b>2. </b>Rhyme, metre, verse, number.

rhythmical
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Measured, regular, <i>or</i> melodious in movement.

ribald
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Base, low, mean, obscene, vile, filthy, gross, coarse, loose, indecent.

ribaldry
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Obscenity, indecency; low, vile, <i>or</i> vulgar language.

rickety
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Affected with the rickets.<BR><b>2. </b>Shattered, broken, weak, imperfect.<BR><b>3. </b>Shaky, tottering, approaching ruin.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Solve, explain, unriddle.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Enigma, puzzle, dark problem, puzzling question.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Extended elevation, long crest <i>or</i> summit.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Derision, mockery, raillery, satire, sarcasm, gibe, jeer, sneer, banter, wit, burlesque, irony.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Deride, mock, scout, satirize, lampoon, jeer, taunt, rally, banter, burlesque, laugh at, scoff at, make game of, make fun of, make a butt of.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Ludicrous, laughable, droll, funny, preposterous, farcical, comical, absurd, risible.

rigid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stiff, stiffened, inflexible, unpliant, unbending, unyielding.<BR><b>2. </b>Stiff, bristling, erect, precipitous, steep.<BR><b>3. </b>Sharp, severe, strict, stern, rigorous, harsh, austere, inflexible, exact, unmitigated.<BR><b>4. </b>Sharp, cruel.

rigidity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stiffness, inflexibility, rigidness, want of pliability.<BR><b>2. </b>Severity, rigor, harshness, strictness, austerity, rigidness.<BR><b>3. </b>Ungracefulness, want of ease, stiffness.

rigmarole
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Nonsense, jargon, gibberish, verbiage, trash, balderdash, twaddle, palaver, flummery, foolish talk.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stiffness, rigidity, rigidness, inflexibility, hardness.<BR><b>2. </b>Severity, austerity, harshness, sternness, asperity.<BR><b>3. </b>Strictness, exactness.<BR><b>4. </b>Inclemency, severity.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Medicine</i>) Sudden coldness with shivering.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Villain, miscreant, caitiff, rascal, scoundrel, wretch, monster, robber, cut throat, murderer.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Savage, brutal, savagely boisterous, tumultuous, raging, violent.

ruffle
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disarrange, damage, disorder, rumple, derange.<BR><b>2. </b>Discompose, disquiet, trouble, vex, torment, molest, plague, worry, harass, disturb, agitate, confuse, excite.<BR><b>3. </b>Gather into folds, wrinkle, cockle, pucker.<BR><b>4. </b>Surprise.<BR><b>5. </b>Amass, pile, heap.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Flutter, play loosely.<BR><b>2. </b>Swagger, put on airs.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ruff, frill, edging.<BR><b>2. </b>Bustle, disturbance, commotion, contention, tumult, confusion, perturbation, flutter, flurry, agitation, fluster, hurry skurry.

rugged
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Rough, craggy, cragged, uneven, irregular, scraggy.<BR><b>2. </b>Uneven, ragged, coarse.<BR><b>3. </b>Rough, bristly, shaggy.<BR><b>4. </b>Rough, harsh, crabbed, austere, hard, rude, severe.<BR><b>5. </b>Tempestuous, turbulent, stormy, rude, boisterous, inclement.<BR><b>6. </b>Harsh, inharmonious, grating, unmusical, scabrous.<BR><b>7. </b>Wrinkled, frowning, surly, sour, discomposed, ruffled.<BR><b>8. </b>Rude, boisterous, violent, tumultuous.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Destruction, discomfiture, overthrow, defeat, wreck, perdition, fall, downfall, prostration, subversion, undoing, shipwreck.<BR><b>2. </b>Bane, pest, mischief, destruction, perdition.<BR><b>3. </b>Wreck.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Destroy, demolish, overthrow, subvert, overturn, overwhelm, defeat, ruinate.<BR><b>2. </b>Impoverish, bring to want, reduce to poverty.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Chew the cud.<BR><b>2. </b>Muse, meditate, ponder, cogitate, think, reflect.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Meditate, chew, muse on, reflect upon, ponder upon, think about, brood over, chew the cud upon.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deficient, wanting, not plentiful, not abundant.<BR><b>2. </b>Rare, uncommon, infrequent.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>scarcely</b>)</b><BR> Hardly, barely, but just, with difficulty, scantly.

scarcely
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> scarce

scarcity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deficiency, dearth, want, insufficiency, lack.<BR><b>2. </b>Rareness, rarity, uncommonness, infrequency.

scare
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Fright, panic, sudden terror.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Frighten, affright, fright, intimidate, daunt, appall, terrify, make afraid, put in fear.

scathe
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Damage, injury, waste, harm, mischief.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> scath

scatter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strew, sprinkle, throw about loosely.<BR><b>2. </b>Sprinkle on, besprinkle.<BR><b>3. </b>Dissipate, disperse, separate, spread.<BR><b>4. </b>Disunite, distract, confound, harass.<BR><b>5. </b>Dispel, frustrate, disappoint, overthrow.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Disperse, straggle, go at random.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Spectacle, exhibition, show, pageant, sight, view, display, representation.

scenery
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Landscape, prospect, view.

scenic
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Theatrical, dramatic.

scent
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Odor, smell, perfume, fragrance, redolence, balminess.<BR><b>2. </b>Smell, sense of smell.<BR><b>3. </b>Track, course of pursuit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Smell, get scent of.<BR><b>2. </b>Perfume, fill with odor, give odor to, imbue with odor.

sceptical
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[Written also <i>Skeptical</i>.] Doubting, unbelieving, questioning, hesitating, incredulous.

schedule
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Scroll, document.<BR><b>2. </b>Inventory, list, record, roll, table, catalogue, register.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Plan, system, theory.<BR><b>2. </b>Device, design, plan, project, contrivance, plot, stratagem, conspiracy, intrigue, cabal, machination.<BR><b>3. </b>Draught, outline, diagram, arrangement.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Plan, contrive, project, plot, devise, design, imagine, frame, excogitate.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Intrigue, plot, plan, contrive.

schism
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Division (<i>in a church</i>), separation.<BR><b>2. </b>Disunion, discord, separation, division.

scholar
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disciple, pupil, student, learner.<BR><b>2. </b><i>Savant</i>, man of letters, philomath, learned man, erudite person.<BR><b>3. </b>Pedant.

scholarly
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Scholar like.

scholarship
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Learning, erudition, knowledge, attainments, acquirements, accomplishments, acquired knowedge.<BR><b>2. </b>Education, teaching.<BR><b>3. </b>Maintenance for a student, foundation for support.

school
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Seminary, academy, institute, gymnasium, place of education.<BR><b>2. </b>Sect, denomination.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Instruct, teach, educate, train, drill, exercise, indoctrinate.<BR><b>2. </b>Tutor, discipline, control, govern, chide, admonish, reprove, bring under subjection.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Division, split.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Mock, deride, jeer, scoff at.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Mock, jeer, gibe, sneer, flout, deride, ridicule.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sneer, gibe, jeer, taunt, flout, biting jest, mock.<BR><b>2. </b>Derision, ridicule, mock, reproach.

scorch
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Burn superficially, singe, char, roast, parch, shrivel.<BR><b>2. </b>Burn, blister.

score
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mark, incision, notch.<BR><b>2. </b>Account, charge, bill, debt, reckoning.<BR><b>3. </b>Reason, motive, ground, consideration, sake, account.<BR><b>4. </b>Twenty.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mark, notch, furrow, cut, scratch.<BR><b>2. </b>Record, note, charge, set down.<BR><b>3. </b>Note, impute, charge.<BR><b>4. </b>Enter, register.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Contemn, despise, disdain, scout, spurn, disregard, slight, hold in contempt.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Disdain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Contempt, disdain, derision, mockery, slight, sneer.<BR><b>2. </b>Mockery, derision, scoff.

scotch
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cut (<i>slightly</i>), wound (<i>superficially</i>), score, notch, scot, jag.<BR><b>2. </b>Stop (<i>as a wheel, to prevent it from rolling back</i>), block, prop, support.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Scottish.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Incision, cut, slit.

scour
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Clean (<i>by friction</i>), brighten, rub hard, scrub, cleanse.<BR><b>2. </b>Clean, cleanse, whiten.<BR><b>3. </b>Range over, brush along, pass swiftly over.<BR><b>4. </b>Purge (<i>violently</i>).<BR><b>5. </b>Rake, search closely.<BR><b>6. </b>Obliterate, efface, cleanse away, remove.<BR><b>7. </b>Overrun, sweep clear, drive away.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Clean (<i>by rubbing</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Clean, cleanse.<BR><b>3. </b>Be purged.<BR><b>4. </b>Course, career, scamper, range, run swiftly.

scratch
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mark with a scratch <i>or</i> with scratches.<BR><b>2. </b>Wound slightly (<i>as with the nails</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Scribble, write carelessly.<BR><b>4. </b>Dig (<i>with the claws</i>), excavate.<BR><b>5. </b>Obliterate, expunge, erase, rub out.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Incision (<i>slight and ragged</i>), laceration, slight wound.<BR><b>2. </b>Slight furrow, score.<BR><b>3. </b>Scratch wig, small wig, periwig, peruke.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Scribble, scrabble, scratch, write carelessly.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Scribble, scrabble.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Scribble, scratch, inelegant writing.

sedate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Calm, composed, collected, quiet, placid, serene, tranquil, still, unruffled, undisturbed, settled, imperturbable, sober, serious, staid, demure, cool, philosophical, contemplative, grave, thoughtful.

sedative
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Soothing, tranquillizing, allaying, composing, anodyne, calming, assuasive, assuaging, lenient, lenitive, demulcent, balmy.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Opiate, anodyne, narcotic, anaesthetic, hypnotic.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inactive, motionless, sluggish, torpid.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Change, alter, move.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Move, change place, change about, remove.<BR><b>2. </b>Alter, change.<BR><b>3. </b>Change, vary, veer, chop, alter.<BR><b>4. </b>Contrive, manage, plan, scheme, shuffle, devise ways and means.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Change.<BR><b>2. </b>Expedient, contrivance, resort, resource, means.<BR><b>3. </b>Evasion, artifice, fraud, trick, stratagem, subterfuge, mask, wile, craft, device, mean refuge, chicane, chicanery, artful contrivance, <i>ruse</i>.<BR><b>4. </b>Chemise, smock.

shiftiness
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Changeableness, variableness.

shiftless
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Improvident, imprudent, inefficient, prodigal, wasteful.

shimmer
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Glimmer, gleam, glisten, shine faintly.

shine
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beam, radiate, gleam, give light.<BR><b>2. </b>Glitter, glisten, sparkle, gleam, glow, glare, coruscate, be bright, be brilliant.<BR><b>3. </b>Be eminent, be distinguished, be conspicuous, excel.<BR><b>4. </b>Be prominent.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fair weather, sunshine.<BR><b>2. </b>Brightness, splendor, lustre, brilliancy, polish, gloss.

shining
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Beaming, gleaming.<BR><b>2. </b>Radiant, bright, splendid, glistening, lustrous, brilliant, glittering, resplendent, effulgent, glowing, lucid, luminous.<BR><b>3. </b>Illustrious, splendid, conspicuous, distinguished.

shiny
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bright, clear, sunshiny, unclouded, luminous.<BR><b>2. </b>Glossy, brilliant.

shock
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Concussion, collision, shog, clash, impact, percussion.<BR><b>2. </b>Brunt, onset, assault, hostile encounter, conflict.<BR><b>3. </b>Blow, stroke, agitation, offence.<BR><b>4. </b>Stook, hattock.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Shake, strike against, come into collision with, collide.<BR><b>2. </b>Encounter, meet.<BR><b>3. </b>Offend, disgust, disturb, disquiet, nauseate, sicken, scandalize, revolt, outrage.<BR><b>4. </b>Stun, astound, stagger.<BR><b>5. </b>Appall, terrify, affright, frighten, dismay, horrify.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Shaggy, matted, shagged.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Repulsive, offensive, hateful, detestable, execrable, obnoxious, odious, disgusting, revolting, repugnant, disgraceful, loathsome, foul, abominable.<BR><b>2. </b>Dreadful, terrible, horrid, horrible, fearful, frightful, dire, horrific, awful, tremendous, hideous, monstrous, ghastly, grim, appalling.

shoot
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Let fly, propel.<BR><b>2. </b>Fire, discharge, let off.<BR><b>3. </b>Propel, expel, discharge, send forth.<BR><b>4. </b>Hit <i>or</i> kill by a missile.<BR><b>5. </b>Protrude, dart forth, thrust forward.<BR><b>6. </b>Streak, variegate, dot.<BR><b>7. </b>Extend, put forth, thrust forth, send forth.<BR><b>8. </b>Dart, emit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Fire, discharge a missile.<BR><b>2. </b>Pass, fly, dart.<BR><b>3. </b>Bud, sprout, germinate.<BR><b>4. </b>Project, jut, stretch, push, protuberate.<BR><b>5. </b>Advance, make progress.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Sprout, branch, twig, scion, offshoot.<BR><b>2. </b>Shot, discharge.<BR><b>3. </b>[Written also <i>Shote, Shoat</i>.] Young swine.

shot
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Discharge.<BR><b>2. </b>Ball, bullet, missile, projectile.<BR><b>3. </b>Marksman, shooter.<BR><b>4. </b>Range, reach.<BR><b>5. </b>Young hog. <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> shote.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Chatoyant, iridescent, irisated.<BR><b>2. </b>Interwoven, interspersed, intermingled.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Backward, remiss, careless, negligent.<BR><b>2. </b>Slow, tardy, dilatory, lingering, abated, diminished.<BR><b>3. </b>Loose, relaxed.<BR><b>4. </b>Weak, remiss.<BR><b>5. </b>Dull, idle, quiet, inactive.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Partially, insufficiently, imperfectly.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> slacken.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> slacken.<BR><b>2. </b>Slake (<i>as lime</i>).

slacken
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Slack, abate, become less intense, be diminished.<BR><b>2. </b>Become loose <i>or</i> slack, be made less tight <i>or</i> tense, relax.<BR><b>3. </b>Neglect, be remiss, be backward, fail.<BR><b>4. </b>Become slow.<BR><b>5. </b>Languish, flag, fail.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Retard, slack, moderate, make slower.<BR><b>2. </b>Loosen, relax, make less tight <i>or</i> tense, lessen the tension of.<BR><b>3. </b>Lessen, diminish, abate, mitigate, remit, relieve.<BR><b>4. </b>Relax, neglect, be remiss in, defer, put off.<BR><b>5. </b>Abate, lower, make less.<BR><b>6. </b>Withhold, use less liberally.<BR><b>7. </b>Repress, check, restrain, curb, bridle, control.

slag
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Refuse, dross, recrement, cinders, scoria.

slake
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Quench, extinguish, allay, abate, decrease, slacken.<BR><b>2. </b>Slack (<i>as lime</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Desist, fail, go out, be quenched, become extinct.<BR><b>2. </b>Abate, decrease, become less decided.

slander
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Defame, calumniate, vilify, scandalize, decry, reproach, malign, traduce, brand, blacken, asperse, backbite, libel, belie.<BR><b>2. </b>Disparage, detract from.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Defamation, aspersion, detraction, calumny, backbiting, scandal, obloquy.<BR><b>2. </b>Libel, calumny.

slanderous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Calumnious, defamatory, libellous, false and malicious.<BR><b>2. </b>Backbiting, maligning, calumnious, false and malicious.

slant
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> slanting.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Slope.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Slope, lean, incline, lie obliquely.

slash
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Slit.<BR><b>2. </b>Crack, snap, smack.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Slit, long cut.

slattern
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Slut, drab, draggletail, slovenly woman.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Slovenly, slatternly, sluttish.

slaughter
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Massacre, murder, carnage, bloodshed, butchery, havoc, killing, slaying.<BR><b>2. </b>Butchery, killing.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Massacre, slay, kill, murder, butcher.<BR><b>2. </b>Butcher, kill.

slaver
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Drivel, slabber, slobber.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Slabber, slobber, drivel.

slavish
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Servile, low, mean, base, cringing, obsequious, fawning, supple, grovelling, sycophantic, abject, sneaking, beggarly, base minded, low minded.<BR><b>2. </b>Drudging, laborious, menial, servile.

slay
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Kill, slaughter, murder, massacre, despatch, butcher, assassinate.<BR><b>2. </b>Destroy, ruin, put an end to.

sleazy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Thin, flimsy, weak, poor.

sledge
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>[<i>Eng.</i>] Sled.<BR><b>2. </b>Sleigh.<BR><b>3. </b>Sledge hammer.

sleight
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sly artifice, artful trick.<BR><b>2. </b>Adroitness, dexterity, manaeuvring, dexterous management.

slender
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Slim, thin, narrow, slight.<BR><b>2. </b>Weak, feeble, slight, fragile, flimsy, fine.<BR><b>3. </b>Small, inconsiderable, moderate, trivial.<BR><b>4. </b>Meagre, scanty, inadequate, small, insufficient, pitiful, lean.<BR><b>5. </b>Spare, sparing, abstemious, light, meagre, simple.

slice
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cut (<i>into thin pieces</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Cut, divide, part.<BR><b>3. </b>Cut off, sever.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Collop, chop, thin piece.

slide
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Glide, slip, move smoothly.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Glide, slip.

slight
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Small, little, trifling, inconsiderable, trivial, petty, paltry, insignificant, unimportant.<BR><b>2. </b>Weak, feeble, gentle.<BR><b>3. </b>Cursory, hasty, hurried, desultory, superficial, scanty, careless, negligent.<BR><b>4. </b>Perishable, flimsy.<BR><b>5. </b>Contemptible, worthless, frivolous, paltry.<BR><b>6. </b>Slim, slender.<BR><b>7. </b>Contemptuous, disdainful.<BR><b>8. </b>Faint.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Neglect, disregard, inattention, disrespect, contempt, scorn, disdain, indignity.<BR><b>2. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> sleight.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Neglect, disregard, disdain, despise, scorn.<BR><b>2. </b>Overlook.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Mud, ooze, mire.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Miry, muddy, oozy.<BR><b>2. </b>Ropy, clammy, viscous, viscid, glutinous, gummy, mucilaginous, gelatinous, mucous, slabby.

sling
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Throw, cast, hurl, fling.<BR><b>2. </b>Hang up, suspend.

slink
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Sneak, skulk, steal away, slip away.

slip
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Glide, slide.<BR><b>2. </b>Err, trip, mistake, fall into error, commit a fault.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Put stealthily, convey secretly.<BR><b>2. </b>Omit, allow to escape, lose by negligence.<BR><b>3. </b>Throw off, disengage one's self from.<BR><b>4. </b>Loose, loosen, let loose, let go.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Slide, glide, slipping.<BR><b>2. </b>Error, mistake, blunder, fault, trip, oversight.<BR><b>3. </b>Transgression, indiscretion, backsliding, error, fault.<BR><b>4. </b>Cutting, twig, shoot, scion.<BR><b>5. </b>Strip, long and narrow piece, streak.<BR><b>6. </b>Leash, strap, string, cord.<BR><b>7. </b>Escape, desertion.<BR><b>8. </b>Case, covering, wrapper.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Smooth, glib.<BR><b>2. </b>Unstable, uncertain, changeable, mutable, unsteady, shaky, insecure, perilous, unsafe.<BR><b>3. </b>Treacherous, perfidious, faithless, knavish, dishonest, false, cunning, shifty, elusive.<BR><b>4. </b>Wanton, incontinent, unchaste, false, unfaithful.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Careless, slovenly, shuffling, untidy.

slit
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cut (<i>lengthwise</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Sunder, divide, rend, cut, split.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Long cut.

sloping
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Inclining, slanting, declivous, oblique.

sloppy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Plashy, splashy, muddy, slobbery, wet, slabby.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Slush, sludge.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Lazy, idle, inert, sluggish, indolent, dronish, inactive, lumpish, supine, torpid, slack.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Snail (<i>without a shell</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Drone, sluggard, idler, laggard, dawdler, lounger.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Opening, vent.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Sink (<i>as in walking on snow</i>), fall through.

slur
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Tarnish, soil, sully, contaminate, pollute, disgrace.<BR><b>2. </b>Reproach, traduce, asperse, disparage, depreciate, calumniate, speak of slightingly <i>or</i> disrespectfully.<BR><b>3. </b>Disregard, slight, pass by, pass over, gloss over, obscure, conceal.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Mark, stain.<BR><b>2. </b>Reproach, stigma, stain, brand, disgrace.<BR><b>3. </b>Innuendo.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>In printing</i>.) Blur, double, macule.

sly
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cunning, artful, crafty, wily, subtle, insidious.<BR><b>2. </b>Wily, cautious, shrewd, nimble, skilful, knowing, fine, subtle, astute.<BR><b>3. </b>Arch, knowing.<BR><b>4. </b>Secret, underhand, clandestine, stealthy.

smart
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Pungent <i>or</i> sharp pain, lancinating pain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Feel sharp pain.<BR><b>2. </b>Suffer, be punished.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR><b>1. </b>Sharp, stinging, keen, severe, poignant, pungent, pricking, painful.<BR><b>2. </b>Vigorous, forcible, effective, energetic, efficient.<BR><b>3. </b>Vigorous, sharp, severe, lively, active, quick.<BR><b>4. </b>Brisk, fresh, smacking.<BR><b>5. </b>Lively, brisk, vivacious, witty, ready, sprightly, spirited, brilliant.<BR><b>6. </b>Expert, dexterous, clever, quick, active, intelligent, stirring.<BR><b>7. </b>Witty, acute, apt, pertinent.<BR><b>8. </b>Spruce, trim, fine, showy, pretentious.<BR><b>9. </b>Agile, nimble, quick, alert, active.

smooth
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Even, level, flat, plain, polished.<BR><b>2. </b>Sleek, glossy, polished, soft, plane.<BR><b>3. </b>Unruffled, undisturbed.<BR><b>4. </b>Easy, voluble, fluent, even, ready.<BR><b>5. </b>Bland, mild, soothing, insinuating, soft, suave, oily, flattering, adulatory, courtier like, fair spoken, smooth spoken, smooth tongued, deceptive.<BR><b>6. </b>Pleasant, agreeable.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Level, flatten, make smooth.<BR><b>2. </b>Ease, make easy.<BR><b>3. </b>Palliate, soften, extenuate, varnish, plaster.<BR><b>4. </b>Calm, allay, assuage, mollify, mitigate, alleviate.<BR><b>5. </b>Regulate, ease.

smut

snap
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Break short, break short off.<BR><b>2. </b>Bite, seize, catch at, snatch at, snip.<BR><b>3. </b>Crack (<i>as a whip</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Twang.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Break short.<BR><b>2. </b>Crackle, decrepitate, crepitate.<BR><b>3. </b>Snarl.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bite, catch, seizure.<BR><b>2. </b>Clasp, fastening, catch, small lock.<BR><b>3. </b>Crack (<i>as of a whip</i>), smack.<BR><b>4. </b>Interval, spell, season.<BR><b>5. </b>Gingerbread, gingercake, gingernut.

snappish
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Touchy, testy, crabbed, cross, crusty, irascible, waspish, petulant, perverse, froward, pettish, snarling, growling, peevish, captious, churlish, splenetic, censorious, acrimonious, ill tempered, surly, tart.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Growl, gnarl, grumble, murmur.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Entangle, complicate, knot, involve in knots.<BR><b>2. </b>Entangle, embarrass, confuse, ensnare.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Entanglement, tangle, complication.<BR><b>2. </b>Intricacy, complication, embarrassment, difficulty.

snatch
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Grasp, clutch, gripe, wring, wrest, twitch, pluck, seize suddenly, pull, catch, snip.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bit, fragment, portion, small part.<BR><b>2. </b>Catch, short effort.
