<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Clip, cut, nip, nip off.<BR><b>2. </b>Snap, snatch.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Clip, cut.<BR><b>2. </b>Piece, shred, fragment, bit.<BR><b>3. </b>Share, snack.<BR><b>4. </b>Tailor, snipper.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fixedness, durability, permanence, stableness, steadiness, immovability, strength.<BR><b>2. </b>Constancy, steadiness, firmness, stableness.

stable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fixed, established, permanent, immovable, immutable, unalterable, indestructible, unchangeable, invariable, strong, firm.<BR><b>2. </b>Constant, steady, firm, steadfast, unwavering, stanch.<BR><b>3. </b>Durable, lasting, enduring, abiding, permanent, secure, perpetual, sure, fast.

staff
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stick, pole, rod.<BR><b>2. </b>Partisan, truncheon, quarter staff, club, cudgel, bludgeon, shillelah, bat.<BR><b>3. </b>Cane, stick.<BR><b>4. </b>Support, prop, stay.<BR><b>5. </b>Mace, truncheon, <i>b????ton</i>.<BR><b>6. </b>Staff officers, general officers, <i>etat major</i>.<BR><b>7. </b>Stanza, stave.

stagger
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Reel, totter, vacillate.<BR><b>2. </b>Fail, waver, give way.<BR><b>3. </b>Hesitate, waver, doubt.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Shock, astonish, astound, amaze, confound, dumfound, pose, surprise, nonplus, strike with wonder, take by surprise.

stagnant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Motionless, standing, close, quiet.<BR><b>2. </b>Sluggish, inactive, inert, torpid, dull, heavy.

stagnate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Be stagnant, stand still.<BR><b>2. </b>Be dull, be inactive.

staid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Sober, grave, steady, serious, composed, demure, solemn, calm, settled, sedate.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Soil, sully, tarnish, spot, blot, blemish, discolor, maculate.<BR><b>2. </b>Dye, tinge, color.<BR><b>3. </b>Disgrace, pollute, corrupt, defile, dishonor, debase, deprave, contaminate, taint, blot, soil, tarnish, sully, befoul.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Blemish, tarnish, spot, blot, imperfection, discoloration.<BR><b>2. </b>Disgrace, dishonor, contamination, taint, reproach, tarnish, pollution, blemish.<BR><b>3. </b>Shame, disgrace, infamy, cause of reproach, reproach.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Stairs (<i>with casing, etc</i>.), flight of stairs, stairway.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stick (<i>pointed for driving into the ground</i>), picket, pale.<BR><b>2. </b>Wager, bet, pledge.<BR><b>3. </b>Risk, hazard, venture, adventure.<BR><b>4. </b>Martyrdom (<i>by fire</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Risk, venture, hazard, peril, imperil, jeopardize, wager, pledge, put at stake, put at hazard.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vapid, tasteless, insipid, mawkish, flat, flashy, musty, fusty, sour.<BR><b>2. </b>Old, decayed, faded, effete, time worn, worn out.<BR><b>3. </b>Trite, common, hackneyed, commonplace, threadbare, old, vapid, stereotyped.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Move.<BR><b>2. </b>Agitate, disturb.<BR><b>3. </b>Discuss, argue, moot, start, raise, agitate, bring into debate.<BR><b>4. </b>Instigate, incite, excite, rouse, arouse, awaken, prompt, stimulate, provoke, animate, goad, spur, stir up, set on.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Move, budge, go, change place, change one's position, move one's self.<BR><b>2. </b>Be active, be in motion.<BR><b>3. </b>Appear, happen, turn up, come into notice.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Rise (<i>from bed in the morning</i>), get up.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Agitation, tumult, bustle, excitement, confusion, hurry, movement, activity, flurry, ado, fidget, fuss.<BR><b>2. </b>Disorder, tumult, uproar, commotion, public disturbance, seditious commotion.<BR><b>3. </b>Agitation of mind, conflict of passions.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Trunk (<i>of a tree</i>), stipe, stalk, stem.<BR><b>2. </b>Post, pillar, block, log.<BR><b>3. </b>Dolt, dullard, dunce, blockhead, fool, block, stick, dunderhead, numskull, loggerhead, clod.<BR><b>4. </b>Handle (<i>of an instrument</i>), haft.<BR><b>5. </b>Cravat, neckcloth.<BR><b>6. </b>Race, lineage, pedigree, parentage, ancestry, family, line, descent, house.<BR><b>7. </b>Capital, fund, invested property, principal.<BR><b>8. </b>Store, supply, accumulation, provision, hoard, reserve.<BR><b>9. </b>Live stock, domestic animals (<i>on a farm</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Store, supply, furnish, fill.<BR><b>2. </b>Reserve, save, garner, hoard, reposit, accumulate, lay in, treasure up, lay by, lay up.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Standard, permanent, standing.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stretch, draw tightly, make tense, make tight, tighten.<BR><b>2. </b>Wrench, sprain, injure by stretching.<BR><b>3. </b>Exert (<i>to the utmost</i>), put to the utmost strength.<BR><b>4. </b>Pervert (<i>from the true intent</i>), push too far.<BR><b>5. </b>Squeeze, press, embrace, hug, fold tightly in the arms.<BR><b>6. </b>Force, constrain, compel.<BR><b>7. </b>Filter, purify (<i>by filtration</i>), filtrate, percolate.<BR><b>8. </b>Fatigue, over exert, tire, over task, over work.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Try hard, make great efforts.<BR><b>2. </b>Percolate, filter, be filtered, be strained.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Extreme tension.<BR><b>2. </b>Over exertion, violent effort, great exertion.<BR><b>3. </b>Sprain, wrench.<BR><b>4. </b>Tune, melody, movement.<BR><b>5. </b>Poem, lay, song, sonnet.<BR><b>6. </b>Style, manner.<BR><b>7. </b>Turn, tendency, disposition, inborn disposition.<BR><b>8. </b>Bearing, conduct, port, manner of action.<BR><b>9. </b>Stock, race, descent, family, lineage, pedigree, descent, extraction.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Obstruct, trip, cause to stumble.<BR><b>2. </b>Perplex, confound, puzzle, nonplus, confuse, embarrass, pose.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Trip, miss one's footing, make a false step.<BR><b>2. </b>Err, do wrong.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Trip, false step.<BR><b>2. </b>Error, blunder, failure.

stun
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Make senseless (<i>by a blow</i>), make dizzy.<BR><b>2. </b>Stupefy, confound, bewilder, overcome, dizzy, dumfound, astonish, overwhelm, over power.<BR><b>3. </b>Deafen, make deaf.

stunning
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Deafening, stentorian, very loud.<BR><b>2. </b>Stupefying.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Striking, astonishing, wonderful.

stunt
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Dwarf, stint, stop the growth of, hinder from growth.

stupefy
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>[Written also <i>Stupify</i>.] Dull, blunt, benumb, muddle, hebetate, make stupid make dull, make torpid.

stupendous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Astonishing, surprising, amazing, wonderful, wondrous, marvellous, overwhelming, astounding.<BR><b>2. </b>Huge, vast, prodigious, tremendous.

stupor
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Lethargy, <i>narcosis</i>, torpor, numbness, coma, stupefaction.

sturdy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bold (<i>from coarseness</i> or <i>rudeness</i>), obstinate, dogged, stubborn, pertinacious, firm, stiff, hardy, persevering.<BR><b>2. </b>Strong, lusty, robust, stout, stalwart, athletic, brawny, muscular, hardy, vigorous, powerful, forcible, well set, thick set.<BR><b>3. </b>Stiff, stout, strong, hardy, firm.

stutter
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Stammer, hesitate, falter.

stygian
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hellish, infernal, diabolical.<BR><b>2. </b>Dark, Cimmerian, tenebrous, sunless, sombre, gloomy, murky.

stylus
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[Written also <i>Stilus.</i>] Style.

suavity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Sweetness (<i>of temper</i> or <i>of manner</i>), urbanity, amenity, civility, politeness, courtesy, decorum, gentleness, mildness, pleasantness, agreeableness, complaisance, affability, amiability, conciliatoriness obliging manner, good manners, good breeding.

subdivision
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Division, dividing, ramification.<BR><b>2. </b>Part, portion, piece, fraction, section, share.

subduct
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> subduce

subdue
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conquer, subjugate, subject, overcome, overpower, vanquish, overbear.<BR><b>2. </b>Vanquish, beat, crush, defeat, rout, discomfit, worst, overpower, overcome, overbear, overwhelm, master.<BR><b>3. </b>Quell, surmount, foil, get the better of, get the upper hand of, put down, beat down.<BR><b>4. </b>Overpower, destroy, overcome, reduce, choke, choke down, suppress, repress.<BR><b>5. </b>Tame, subject, control, make submissive, bring under rule, break, make tractable, discipline.<BR><b>6. </b>Overcome, reduce, destroy the force of, break.<BR><b>7. </b>Melt, soften, mollify.<BR><b>8. </b>Break, make mellow.<BR><b>9. </b>Destroy, eradicate, root out.

subject
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Subdue, control, bring under rule, make submissive, make subordinate.<BR><b>2. </b>Enslave, enthrall.<BR><b>3. </b>Expose, make liable.<BR><b>4. </b>Submit, refer, make accountable.<BR><b>5. </b>Make subservient.<BR><b>6. </b>Cause to undergo.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR><b>1. </b>Underneath, beneath, placed under, subjacent.<BR><b>2. </b>Subservient, subjected, subordinate, inferior, in bondage, under the lash, under one's thumb, under one's command, at one's command, at one's beck <i>or</i> call, at one's mercy.<BR><b>3. </b>Submissive, obedient.<BR><b>4. </b>Exposed, liable, prone, disposed, obnoxious.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dependant, subordinate, person owing allegiance.<BR><b>2. </b>Topic, theme, thesis, point, matter, subject matter, matter in hand, object matter.<BR><b>3. </b>Hero, person treated of.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Grammar</i> and <i>Logic</i>) Subject term, leading term, nominative.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Anatomy</i>) Corpse, dead body, carcass, body for dissection, cadaver.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Archaic Metaphysics</i>) Substance.<BR><b>7. </b>Recipient, object, case, patient.<BR><b>8. </b>Experiencing mind.<BR><b>9. </b>Mind, thinking being, conscious being, conscious subject, self, ego, me.

subjective
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Belonging to <i>or</i> characteristic of the subject (<i>as contrasted with the object</i>), in the mind, within the self.<BR><b>2. </b>Merely mental, limited to the subject, in the mind only, unreal, non objective, not actual, internal, non external.<BR><b>3. </b>Imagined, fancied, imaginary, illusory.<BR><b>4. </b>Introversive, introspective, contemplative, inward looking, dealing with one's own feelings, colored by one's own states.

subjugate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Conquer, vanquish, subdue, overcome, overpower, overbear, overthrow, master, subject.

sublimate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Chemistry</i>) <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> sublime.<BR><b>2. </b>Refine, exalt, elevate, heighten.

sublime
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>High, elevated, aloft.<BR><b>2. </b>Exalted (<i>in excellence</i> or <i>dignity</i>), great, noble, grand, lofty, eminent.<BR><b>3. </b>Stately, majestic, eminent, grand, solemn, noble, magnificent, glorious.<BR><b>4. </b>Elate, elevated, raised, exhilarated.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vaporize (<i>as a solid, to be again condensed</i>), sublimate.<BR><b>2. </b>Refine, exalt, elevate, heighten, improve, purify.<BR><b>3. </b>Dignify, ennoble, exalt, elevate, greaten.

submarine
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Subaqueous, subaquatic.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Immerse, plunge, sink, submerse.<BR><b>2. </b>Deluge, flood, overflow, overwhelm, inundate, cover with water, drown.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Plunge, sink, submerse.<BR><b>2. </b>Be merged, be incorporated, be included.

subscribe
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sign, set one's name to, affix one's signature to.<BR><b>2. </b>Promise to contribute.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sign one's name (<i>in token of consent</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Agree, consent, assent, give consent, yield assent.<BR><b>3. </b>Enter one's name (<i>for a newspaper, etc.</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Promise to contribute.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Real being.<BR><b>2. </b>Support, livelihood, maintenance, aliment, nutriment, sustenance, living, food, provision, meat, rations.<BR><b>3. </b>Inherence, inherency.

substance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Substratum, groundwork, reality, hypostasis, substantiality, essential nature, real being, real existence.<BR><b>2. </b>Meaning, import, significance, essence, pith, gist, soul, chief part, essential part, vital part.<BR><b>3. </b>Body, matter, material, texture, stuff.<BR><b>4. </b>Property, wealth, means, estate.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Theology</i>) Divine essence, divine being.

substantial
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Real, actual, existent, subsistent, actually existing, having substance.<BR><b>2. </b>True, positive, solid, not imaginary.<BR><b>3. </b>Corporeal, material.<BR><b>4. </b>Strong, stout, solid, firm, stable, sound, massive, bulky.<BR><b>5. </b>Weighty, solid, firm, strong, valid, just, cogent, efficient.<BR><b>6. </b>Responsible (<i>pecuniarily</i>), moderately wealthy.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Really, truly, essentially competently.<BR><b>2. </b>Strongly, stoutly, solidly, firmly.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Establish, verify, prove, confirm, corroborate, ratify, make good.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Grammar</i>) Noun, name.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Exchange, commute, change, put in the place of.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Proxy, lieutenant, agent, deputy, <i>locum tenens</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Makeshift, temporary expedient.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Set, suite.<BR><b>2. </b>Retinue, set, suite.<BR><b>3. </b>Request, solicitation, petition, entreaty, prayer, supplication, appeal, invocation, suing.<BR><b>4. </b>Courtship, wooing, addresses.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Law.</i>) Prosecution, process, trial, action, cause, case.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fit, adapt, adjust, fashion, accommodate, level, match, make suitable <i>or</i> proper.<BR><b>2. </b>Become, befit, beseem; be suited, fitted, <i>or</i> adapted to; be suitable for, be appropriate for.<BR><b>3. </b>Please, gratify, make content.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Agree, accord, harmonize, comport, tally, correspond, match, answer.

suitable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Fit, proper, meet, apt, appropriate, seemly, becoming, due, just, apposite, applicable, fitting, befitting, relevant, eligible, adapted, accordant, consonant, conformable, pertinent, agreeable, answerable, correspondent, decent, convenient, to the point, to the purpose.

superb
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Grand, stately, august, majestic, noble, magnificent.<BR><b>2. </b>Sumptuous, rich, splendid, elegant, beautiful, exquisite.<BR><b>3. </b>Showy, pompous, gorgeous, magnificent.

supercilious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Haughty, overbearing, domineering, dictatorial, arrogant, proud, high, lofty, overweening, consequential, lordly, intolerant, insolent, vainglorious, magisterial, imperious, high and mighty.<BR><b>2. </b>Haughty, disdainful, contemptuous, proud, arrogant, lordly, consequential, scornful.

superficial

superfluity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Superabundance, excess, redundance, redundancy, exuberance, surfeit, more than enough, enough and to spare.

superfluous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Excessive, superabundant, redundant, exuberant, unnecessary, needless, useless, expletive, more than enough.

superimpose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Superpose.

superintend
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Supervise, oversee, overlook, direct, conduct, manage, control, administer have charge of, have the direction of, have the oversight of, preside over.

superintendent
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Overseer, supervisor, master, conductor, inspector, curator, warden, guardian, custodian, intendant, director.

superior
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>High, higher, upper, paramount, more elevated.<BR><b>2. </b>Of higher rank, more exalted, more dignified.<BR><b>3. </b>Surpassing, noble, more eminent, more excellent, preferable, greater.<BR><b>4. </b>Predominant, prevalent.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pre eminence, ascendency, predominance, supremacy, preponderance, advantage, prevalence, odds.<BR><b>2. </b>Excellence, worthiness, nobility.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Supreme, most eminent, greatest, most excellent, surpassing, transcendent, consummate, pre eminent, peerless, incomparable.

supernatural
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Miraculous, preternatural, above nature, beyond the powers of nature, that exceeds the laws of nature.

supersede
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Suspend, annul, overrule, set aside, make void, obviate, neutralize.<BR><b>2. </b>Displace, replace, supplant, succeed, remove.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bigotry, fanaticism.<BR><b>2. </b>False religion, worship of false gods, irrational worship.<BR><b>3. </b>Belief in omens.<BR><b>4. </b>Excessive nicety, scrupulous exactness.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Addition (<i>to supply something wanting</i>), appendix, postscript, continuation.<BR><b>2. </b>Counterpart, correlative, complement.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Supply, add to, fill up.

swell
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dilate, expand, tumefy, distend, fill out, intumesce, grow larger <i>or</i> bigger (<i>by expansion</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Increase (<i>by outward addition</i>), augment, enlarge.<BR><b>3. </b>Rise (<i>as waves</i>), heave, surge.<BR><b>4. </b>Belly, be inflated.<BR><b>5. </b>Strut, look big, put on airs, be puffed up, swagger, ride a high horse, carry with a high hand.<BR><b>6. </b>Be turgid <i>or</i> bombastic.<BR><b>7. </b>Bulge, protuberate, swell out.<BR><b>8. </b>Be puffed, be bloated, become irate.<BR><b>9. </b>Glow, expand, warm, thrill, heave, throb, grow big.<BR><b>10. </b>Be elated, rise into arrogance.<BR><b>11. </b>Become larger, grow upon the view.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Dilate, expand, inflate, enlarge.<BR><b>2. </b>Enhance, heighten, aggravate.<BR><b>3. </b>Puff up, make arrogant.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Swelling.<BR><b>2. </b>Augmentation, protuberance.<BR><b>3. </b>Elevation, rise.<BR><b>4. </b>Force, intensity, power, <i>crescendo</i>.<BR><b>5. </b>Increase of power, increase of rhetorical force.<BR><b>6. </b>Ascent, elevation.<BR><b>7. </b>Waves, billows.<BR><b>8. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Fox, coxcomb, dandy, beau, exquisite, jackanapes, popinjay, blade, buck, fine gentleman, spark, jack a dandy, dandiprat, man milliner, man of dress, vain fellow.

swelling
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Bombastic, pompous, turgid, inflated, tumid, stilted, grandiloquent, pretentious, high flowing, high sounding, rhetorical, declamatory, grandiose.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Swell.<BR><b>2. </b>Protuberance, bump, prominence, rise.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun singular and plural</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hog, pig, porker.<BR><b>2. </b>Hogs (<i>collectively</i>).

swing
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oscillate, vibrate, wave, move to and fro, move backward and forward.<BR><b>2. </b>Depend, hang, dangle, hang loose.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Be hanged, hang.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cause to swing, wave, <i>or</i> vibrate.<BR><b>2. </b>Wave, flourish, brandish, move to and fro, whirl.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Oscillation, vibration, waving motion.<BR><b>2. </b>Scope, range, play, margin, free play, full play, elbow room, free course, sweep.<BR><b>3. </b>Bias, tendency, inclination.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Sweep, swape, well sweep.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Proportion, harmony, shapeliness, regularity, order, regular arrangement.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Compassionate, sympathizing, commiserating, pitiful, tender, kind, affectionate, loving, with the heart in the right place.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fellow feeling.<BR><b>2. </b>Agreement, harmony, correspondence, correlation, affinity, union, reciprocity, pre established harmony, congeniality, concord, concert.<BR><b>3. </b>Compassion, commiseration, condolence, pity, tenderness, kindliness, fellow feeling, bowels of compassion.<BR><b>4. </b>Mutual influence.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>symptomatical</b>)</b><BR> Indicative.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Degree of heat.

tempest
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Storm, hurricane, gale, squall, tornado, violent wind (<i>usually accompanied with rain, hail, or snow, and sometimes with thunder and lightning</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Excitement, tumult, disturbance, commotion, turmoil, perturbation, violent outbreak.

tempestuous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Stormy, windy, breezy, squally, gusty, blustering, boisterous.<BR><b>2. </b>Violent, turbulent, tumultuous, impetuous, stormy.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fane.<BR><b>2. </b>Church, house of worship, house of God, meeting house.<BR><b>3. </b>Place of worship.

tempo
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>(<i>Music</i>) Time, degree of movement.

temporal
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Worldly, terrestrial, mundane, secular, of this world, of this life.<BR><b>2. </b>Transient, fleeting, temporary, transitory.<BR><b>3. </b>Civil, political.

temporary
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Transitory, transient, fleeting, evanescent, ephemeral, short lived, temporal, brief, for a time, of short duration.

temporize
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Trim, comply with occasions, yield to circumstances, fall in with current opinion, act the time server, be on the fence, wait to see which way the cat will jump.

tempt
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Try, test, prove, put to trial.<BR><b>2. </b>Entice (<i>especially to evil</i>), allure, seduce, decoy, induce, inveigle, persuade, prevail upon, draw on, bring over, lure.<BR><b>3. </b>Incite, instigate, provoke, incline, dispose, prompt, endeavor to persuade, lead.<BR><b>4. </b>Attempt, venture on, essay, try.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Enticement (<i>especially to evil</i>), allurement.<BR><b>2. </b>Bribe, bait, lure, decoy, golden apple, voice of the tempter, song of the sirens.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Alluring, attractive, seductive, enticing.

tenable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Defensible, maintainable, capable of being held <i>or</i> defended.

tenacious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Retentive, apt to retain.<BR><b>2. </b>Adhesive, sticky, glutinous, viscous, cohesive, smeary, dauby, clinging.<BR><b>3. </b>Stubborn, obstinate, pertinacious, opinionated, opinionative, positive.

S.</i>] Woods, forest trees.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Seasonable, opportune, early, punctual, prompt.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Early, soon, in good season.

timid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Timorous, fearful, skittish, shy, cowardly, pusillanimous, faint hearted, chicken hearted, easily frightened.<BR><b>2. </b>Diffident, bashful, retiring, coy, shrinking, blushing, shame faced, over modest.

timidity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Timorousness, fearfulness, skittishness, shyness, cowardice, pusillanimity, want of courage, timidness.<BR><b>2. </b>Diffidence, bashfulness, coyness, sheepishness, shamefacedness.

timorous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fearful, timid, destitute of courage.<BR><b>2. </b>Scrupulous, full of scruples, indicating fear.

tinge
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dye, stain, color, tint, tincture.<BR><b>2. </b>Imbue, impress, infuse, impregnate.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Tint, stain, color, dye, tincture, shade (<i>of color</i>), cast, hue.<BR><b>2. </b>Taste, flavor, smack, spice.

tinker
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Mender (<i>of old pans, kettles, etc.</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Mend (<i>as old pans, kettles, etc.</i>), cobble, patch up, repair, vamp, put in repair.

tinkle
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Jingle, clink, ring.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> tinkling.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Tinge, color, hue, tincture, stain, dye, shade, grain.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Dye, stain, tinge.

tip
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>End, point, extremity.<BR><b>2. </b>Donation, gift, <i>douceur</i>.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Top, cap, put a point on.<BR><b>2. </b>Tap, strike (<i>lightly</i>).<BR><b>3. </b>Incline (<i>to one end, as a cart</i>), cant, tilt.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Lean, incline, tilt.

tipple
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Tope, guzzle, drink hard, be addicted to strong drink.

tirade
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Strain of invective, series of violent declamation, diatribe.

tire
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fatigue, weary, jade, fag, exhaust, knock up, tire out.<BR><b>2. </b>Irk, bore, weary, fatigue.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Be fatigued, become weary, grow weary.

tissue
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fabric, cloth, woven stuff (<i>especially cloth interwoven with gold or silver or figured colors</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Texture, structure, web.<BR><b>3. </b>Combination, series, accumulation, conglomeration, mass, network, chain.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Gigantic, huge, Herculean, Cyclopean, enormous, monstrous, stupendous, vast, immense, colossal, prodigious, mighty.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Nominal, titulary, only in name.

toil
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Labor (<i>hard</i>), work, strive, drudge, moil, exert one's self, take pains.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Labor (<i>that fatigues</i>), work, exertion, pains, effort, drudgery, hard work, travail.<BR><b>2. </b>Snare, net, trap, springe, noose, gin.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Endurance, sufferance, toleration.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Forbearing, indulgent.

tolerate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Permit (<i>as something unpleasant</i>), allow, admit, indulge, receive.<BR><b>2. </b>Suffer, endure, abide, brook, put up with, bear with, take patiently <i>or</i> easily.

toll
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Tax (<i>especially on travellers, as in crossing bridges, ferries, etc.</i>), duty, impost, custom.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>[Written also <i>Tole.</i>] Allure, draw, draw on.

tome
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Volume.<BR><b>2. </b>Book, work.

tonic
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Strengthening medicine.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Music</i>) Key, key note, first note of the scale, fundamental note.

toothsome
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Palatable, delicious, savory, nice, luscious, dainty, agreeable to the taste.

topple
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Fall (<i>top foremost</i>), tumble down, topple over, topple down, tumble over.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Anguish, agony, torture, rack, pang, extreme pain, excruciating pain, acute distress.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR><b>1. </b>Torture, distress, agonize, rack, excruciate, pain extremely, put to the rack, put to torture, harass with anguish.<BR><b>2. </b>Pain, distress, afflict.<BR><b>3. </b>Tease, vex, plague, harass, worry, harry, badger, fret, irritate, nettle, provoke, tantalize, trouble, annoy.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Storm (<i>of great violence and with a whirling motion</i>), hurricane, whirlwind, tempest, cyclone, blizzard.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cramp fish, electric ray (<i>Torpedo vulgaris</i>).<BR><b>2. </b>Explosive engine for blowing up ships.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Numb, benumbed, motionless, lethargic.<BR><b>2. </b>Sluggish, inert, dull, inactive, indolent, stupid.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Dried, parched, scorched.<BR><b>2. </b>Burning, parching, scorching, violently hot, fiery.

torso
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Trunk (<i>of a statue</i>).

tortuous

toss
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Throw (<i>by the hand and upward</i>), throw up.<BR><b>2. </b>Lift up suddenly, throw up, raise violently.<BR><b>3. </b>Fling, pitch, cast, hurl, throw.<BR><b>4. </b>Agitate, shake, rock.<BR><b>5. </b>Try, harass, disquiet, make restless.<BR><b>6. </b>Keep in play, tumble over.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Roll, writhe, fling, tumble about, be uneasy, be in violent commotion.<BR><b>2. </b>Be agitated, be tossed, be moved tumultuously.

touch
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Hit (<i>lightly</i>), strike against.<BR><b>2. </b>Perceive by the sense of feeling.<BR><b>3. </b>Meet, be contiguous to, abut on.<BR><b>4. </b>Graze, come in contact with (<i>in passing over</i>).<BR><b>5. </b>Reach, come to, arrive at, attain to.<BR><b>6. </b>Delineate (<i>lightly</i>), sketch, mark out, touch off.<BR><b>7. </b>Handle, feel, feel of.<BR><b>8. </b>Handle, speak of, deal with, treat of slightly.<BR><b>9. </b>Interfere with, meddle with.<BR><b>10. </b>Concern, regard, relate to, refer to, pertain to, appertain to, belong to, affect, bear upon, have to do with.<BR><b>11. </b>Affect, impress, strike, come home to, smite, stir.<BR><b>12. </b>Affect, move, melt, work upon, soften, strike mentally.<BR><b>13. </b>Make an impression on, act on, have an effect on.<BR><b>14. </b>Strike, play on.<BR><b>15. </b>Perform, play.<BR><b>16. </b>Distress, hurt, injure, afflict, molest.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> Meet, hit, be contiguous, be in contact, abut on one another.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Contact.<BR><b>2. </b>Feeling, tact, sense of feeling.<BR><b>3. </b>Power of exciting the affections.<BR><b>4. </b>Emotion, affection.<BR><b>5. </b>Stroke.<BR><b>6. </b>Animadversion, censure, reproof.<BR><b>7. </b>Stroke (<i>with a pen, etc.</i>, or <i>on a musical instrument</i>).<BR><b>8. </b>Tinge, tincture, cast, shade, grain, smack, taste, savor, flavor, spice, dash, sprinkling, seasoning, infusion, little, small quantity.<BR><b>9. </b>Hint, suggestion, slight notice.<BR><b>10. </b>(<i>Rare.</i>) Test, criterion, touchstone, proof, assay, ordeal.<BR><b>11. </b>Examination, trial.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Adhesive, tenacious, cohesive, flexible, without brittleness.<BR><b>2. </b>Coriaceous, leathery.<BR><b>3. </b>Viscous, clammy, tenacious, ropy, stringy, sticky.<BR><b>4. </b>Stiff, rigid, inflexible.<BR><b>5. </b>Strong, firm, hardy.<BR><b>6. </b>Refractory, stubborn, obdurate, callous, hard.<BR><b>7. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Difficult, hard, hard to deal with, troublesome, formidable.<BR><b>8. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Severe (<i>as a storm</i>), violent.

transcend
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exceed, transgress, overstep, pass, overpass, go beyond, pass over, overleap.<BR><b>2. </b>Surmount, rise above.<BR><b>3. </b>Surpass, excel, outstrip, overtop, outdo, exceed, outvie, be superior.

transcendent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pre eminent, surpassing, supereminent, unequalled, unparalleled, peerless, unrivalled, inimitable, very superior, consummate, unsurpassed, supreme in excellence.<BR><b>2. </b>Transcendental, above <i>or</i> dominating the (<i>Aristotelian</i>) categories.<BR><b>3. </b>Transcending the scope of knowledge, supersensible, metempirical, noumenal, transcending the limits of possible experience, beyond the range of reason <i>or</i> of the transcendental (or <i>a priori</i>) principles of knowledge.

transcendental
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Supereminent, transcendent, pre eminent, surpassing, supreme, consummate.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Colloquial</i>) Obscure, dark, vague, indefinite, speculative, mystic, mystical, fantastic, filmy, thin, abstruse, indistinct, rarefied, attenuated, unreal, intangible, impalpable, recondite.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Mathematics</i>) Non algebraic, extra algebraic, involving other than the four fundamental operations.<BR><b>4. </b>(<i>Metaphysics</i>) <i>adjective A priori</i>, pure, organic, primordial, original, aboriginal, formal, formative, constitutive, relating to form as distinguished from matter, non empirical. <i>b.</i> Synthetical, combinative, unitive, unifying, unificatory, colligative, constructive of system in experience, warranting inference from the past to the future. <i>c.</i> Non transcendent, immanent, limited to experience, applicable to phenomena alone, inapplicable to the absolute, to noumena, to the supersensible, <i>or</i> to things in themselves.

transcribe
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Copy, write a copy of.

transcript
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Written copy, transcription, rescript.<BR><b>2. </b>Copy, imitation.

transfer
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Transport, carry over, convey, transmit, remove, translate.<BR><b>2. </b>Remove, transplant.<BR><b>3. </b>Alienate, abalienate, consign, convey, make over, deliver over, pass, assign, confer, pass over, transmit.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Transferring, removal.<BR><b>2. </b>Alienation, abalienation, demise, conveyance, transferrence.

transfigure
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Transform, metamorphose.

transform
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Transfigure, metamorphose, change the form of.<BR><b>2. </b>Transmute, change into another substance, convert.<BR><b>3. </b>Change, change the nature of, convert.<BR><b>4. </b>Transubstantiate (<i>Rom. Cath. Church</i>).

transformation
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Metamorphosis, transfiguration, change of form.<BR><b>2. </b>Transmutation, conversion, change.<BR><b>3. </b>Change, conversion.<BR><b>4. </b>Transubstantiation.

transfuse
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Transfer (<i>as by pouring, instilling</i>, or <i>injecting</i>), convey, transmit.

transgress
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Exceed, transcend, pass, overstep, overpass, go beyond, pass over.<BR><b>2. </b>Disobey, infringe, break, contravene, set at naught, violate.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Err, sin, offend, do amiss.

transgression
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Infringement, violation, infraction, breach, non observance, transgressing.<BR><b>2. </b>Sin, offence, crime, misdemeanor, misdeed, misdoing, fault, trespass, evil deed, error, wrong doing.

transient
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Passing, fleeting, temporary, soon past, soon passing, flying, flitting, brief, fugitive.<BR><b>2. </b>Hasty, momentary, imperfect, short.

transit
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Passage through, passage over, act of passing.<BR><b>2. </b>Conveyance, passage.<BR><b>3. </b>Line of passage, line of conveyance.<BR><b>4. </b>Passage (<i>as of a heavenly body across the meridian</i>).

transition
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Change, shifting.

transitional
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Transitionary.

transitory
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Transient, passing, fleeting, flitting, flying, temporary, evanescent, ephemeral, momentary, short, brief, fugacious, short lived, of short duration, here to day and gone to morrow.

translucent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Semi transparent (<i>admitting rays of light, but not capable of being distinctly seen through</i>), pellucid, diaphanous.<BR><b>2. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> transparent.

transmit
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Send, remit, forward, send on, send forward.<BR><b>2. </b>Transfer, convey, carry, bear, hand over.

transmute
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Change (<i>from one form</i> or <i>nature into another</i>), transform.

transparent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Clear, lucid, bright, limpid, crystalline, transpicuous, translucent, that may be seen through.<BR><b>2. </b>Open, porous, transpicuous.<BR><b>3. </b>Clear, lucid, open, perspicuous, transpicuous.

transplant
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Plant in a new place.<BR><b>2. </b>Remove, transfer, transpose, transport, carry.

transport
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Carry (<i>from one place to another</i>), convey, bear, fetch, remove, transfer.<BR><b>2. </b>Banish (<i>to a penal colony</i>), carry into banishment.<BR><b>3. </b>Enrapture, ravish, enravish, entrance, beatify, put into ecstasy, make very happy, delight.<BR><b>4. </b>Carry away (<i>by excitement of any kind</i>).<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conveyance, transportation, carriage, transporting.<BR><b>2. </b>Transport ship, transport vessel.<BR><b>3. </b>Convict (<i>sentenced to banishment</i>), felon.<BR><b>4. </b>Rapture, ravishment, beatitude, ecstasy, beatification, bliss, happiness, felicity.<BR><b>5. </b>Warmth, vehemence, violent manifestation, passion.<BR><b>6. </b>Convict sentenced to exile.

transpose
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Change the order of (<i>by putting one in place of the other</i>, or <i>substituting one for the other</i>).

trap
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Snare, gin, pitfall, springe, toil.<BR><b>2. </b>Ambush, stratagem, artifice, pitfall, trapan, toil, wile.<BR><b>3. </b>Trap ball.<BR><b>4. </b>Trap rock.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ensnare, entrap, springe, noose.<BR><b>2. </b>Trapan, ensnare, take by stratagem.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Dross, refuse, rubbish, trumpery, waste matter, worthless stuff.

traverse
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Athwart, crosswise, cross.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Lying across, cross.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Cross, lay athwart, thwart.<BR><b>2. </b>Thwart, obstruct, cross in opposition, counteract, frustrate, defeat, contravene.<BR><b>3. </b>Pass, travel over, wander over, cross in travelling, go across, pass through.<BR><b>4. </b>Pass over and view, survey carefully, examine thoroughly.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Deny, plead &quot;not guilty&quot; to.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Triviality, small matter, bawble, nothing, bubble, thing of little value <i>or</i> consequence, thing of no moment, drop in the bucket, shadow of a shade, <i>bagatelle</i>.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Act with levity, be busy about trifles, toy, dally, play, dawdle, palter, fribble.<BR><b>2. </b>Talk idly <i>or</i> frivolously, toy, wanton.

tumult
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Uproar, affray, fray, brawl, feud, row, altercation, squabble, turbulence, bluster, hubbub, fracas, quarrel, outbreak, strife, general riot, <i>melee</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Violent commotion, turbulence, noisy agitation, confusion.<BR><b>3. </b>Commotion, disturbance, stir, agitation, breeze, confusion, turmoil, ferment, huddle, pother, ado, bustle, flurry, noise, fuss, confused noise, hurly burly, bluster, hubbub, racket, noisy commotion, disorder, to do (<i>colloq.</i>).<BR><b>4. </b>Ferment, state of high excitement, agitation, perturbation.

turbulent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disturbed, agitated, tumultuous, wild.<BR><b>2. </b>Tumultuous, disorderly, blustering, obstreperous, boisterous, uproarious, blatant, brawling, vociferous.<BR><b>3. </b>Riotous, seditious, mutinous, insubordinate, refractory, insurgent, rebellious, revolutionary, factious, disorderly, wild, violent.<BR><b>4. </b>Producing commotion.

turgid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Swelled, swollen, bloated, distended, puffed up.<BR><b>2. </b>Pompous, bombastic, tumid, puffy, inflated, stilted, grandiloquent, declamatory, rhetorical, ostentatious, turgent, grandiose, fustian, high flown.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Tumult, agitation, disturbance, disorder, turbulence, confusion, commotion, uproar, bustle, huddle, hurly burly, trouble, harassing labor.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Apostate, renegade, backslider, deserter.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unequalled, unparalleled, matchless, unexampled, unrivalled, unparagoned, without an equal, consummate, incomparable, peerless.<BR><b>2. </b>Odd, single (<i>of a pair</i> or <i>set</i>).

unmitigated
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Complete, thorough, absolute, consummate, unqualified, perfect.

unmoved
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Firm, steadfast, unwavering, unswerving, unfaltering, constant.<BR><b>2. </b>Calm, collected, self possessed, cool, undisturbed, quiet.<BR><b>3. </b>Indifferent, insensible, unaffected, untouched, unstirred, with dry eyes, without a tear.

unnoticed
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unobserved, neglected, overlooked, disregarded, slighted, ignored, unheeded.

unobstructed
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unhindered, unimpeded, open, clear.

unobtrusive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Modest, retiring, unostentatious, unpretending, unpretentious, unassuming.

unpalatable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Vapid, savorless, unsavory.<BR><b>2. </b>Disagreeable (<i>to the taste</i>), unpleasant, disgusting, nauseous, offensive.<BR><b>3. </b>Bitter, distasteful, disagreeable, unpleasant.

unparalleled
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unexampled, unequalled, unrivalled, unmatched, matchless, peerless, inimitable, unparagoned, unprecedented, without a parallel, incomparable.

unprecedented
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unexampled, novel, new, exceptional.

unpremeditated
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unstudied, extemporaneous, extempore, impromptu, spontaneous, off hand.

unprepossessing
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unattractive, repulsive.

unpretentious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  <span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> unpretending.

unprincipled
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Immoral, wicked, vicious, bad, knavish, roguish, dishonest, trickish, iniquitous, profligate, villanous, tricky (<i>colloq.</i>).

unproductive
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unfruitful, barren, unprolific, sterile, unprocreant.<BR><b>2. </b>Unprofitable, unremunerative.<BR><b>3. </b>Inefficient, ineffectual, without effect.

unpromising
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inauspicious, unpropitious, unfavorable, unlucky, untoward, ill omened, not encouraging, not promising.<BR><b>2. </b>Unlikely.

unqualified
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Incompetent, unfit, unadapted.<BR><b>2. </b>Absolute, unconditional, unmeasured, unrestricted, thorough, plump, full, direct, downright, decided.<BR><b>3. </b>Exaggerated, sweeping.

unquestionable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Indisputable, incontrovertible, indubitable, undeniable, irrefragable, incontestable, irrefutable, certain, evident, obvious, beyond all question, beyond a doubt, past dispute.<BR><b>2. </b>Undeniable, indisputable, indubitable, unmistakable.

unravel
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Disentangle, extricate, ravel, untwist.<BR><b>2. </b>Unfold, decipher, interpret, understand, resolve, solve, explain, read, clear up, make out.<BR><b>3. </b>Confuse, throw into disorder.

unreasonable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Irrational, foolish, unwise, absurd, silly, preposterous, senseless, stupid, injudicious, nonsensical, unphilosophical, ill judged.<BR><b>2. </b>Exorbitant, extravagant, unfair, unjust, extortionate, excessive.

unrecognized
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Ignored, overlooked, disregarded.<BR><b>2. </b>Unknown, unacknowledged.

unregenerate
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unconverted.

unreliable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>[<i>Modern</i>.] Untrustworthy, not to be depended upon.

unremitting
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unceasing, continual, persevering, constant, unabated, incessant, assiduous, sedulous, diligent, indefatigable, unwearied.

unrepentant
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Impenitent, seared, hardened, callous, incorrigible, irreclaimable, obdurate, abandoned, lost, graceless, shameless, profligate, recreant.

unrequited
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unreturned, unrewarded.

unreserved
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Full, entire, unlimited.<BR><b>2. </b>Frank, open, candid, ingenuous, undesigning, undissembling, artless, guileless, sincere, honest, fair, single minded, above board, open hearted.

unrestrained
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unchecked, unhindered.<BR><b>2. </b>Licentious, loose, dissolute.

unrestricted
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unrestrained, unlimited free, unconfined, unbridled, unfettered, independent.<BR><b>2. </b>Unobstructed, open, public, clear.

unsatisfactory
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Insufficient.<BR><b>2. </b>Disappointing.<BR><b>3. </b>Lame, poor, weak, feeble.

unscathed
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Uninjured, unharmed.

unscrupulous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unprincipled, unrestrained, ruthless, reckless, unconscientious, without scruples, regardless of principle.

unseasonably
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  Untimely, at an unsuitable time, unsuitably, malapropos.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Improper, indecorous, unbecoming, unmeet, unfit, unbefitting, indecent, unsuitable, inappropriate.

unselfish
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Disinterested, generous, liberal, magnanimous, high minded.

unsettle
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Derange, disturb, disconcert, unfix, confuse, disorder, throw into disorder, unhinge.

unskilled
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inexperienced, undrilled, unexercised, unpractised, undisciplined, uneducated, unschooled, unprepared, raw.<BR><b>2. </b><span style="color: #959595"><i>See</i></span> unskilful.

unsophisticated
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pure, unadulterated, genuine.<BR><b>2. </b>Guileless, undepraved, good, unpolluted, unvitiated, innocent.<BR><b>3. </b>Artless, simple, natural, unaffected, sincere, ingenuous, straightforward, honest, undesigning.

unsound
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Defective, imperfect, impaired, decayed, rotten.<BR><b>2. </b>Diseased, sickly, weakly, poorly, infirm, unhealthy, morbid, feeble.<BR><b>3. </b>Erroneous, wrong, false, fallacious, incorrect, deceitful, sophistical, illogical, defective, untenable, invalid, unsubstantial, faulty, hollow.<BR><b>4. </b>Deceitful, dishonest, untrustworthy.<BR><b>5. </b>Insincere, false, unfaithful, untrue.<BR><b>6. </b>Questionable, defective.<BR><b>7. </b>Disturbed, light.<BR><b>8. </b>Thin, weak.<BR><b>9. </b>Insubstantial, unreal.<BR><b>10. </b>Heterodox, heretical, unorthodox, defective.

unspotted
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Unstained, unsoiled, untarnished, unsullied, spotless, clean.<BR><b>2. </b>Pure, uncorrupted, untainted, unblemished, untarnished, unsullied, spotless, stainless, clean, undefiled, immaculate.

unstable

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unexcelled, matchless, unequalled, unmatched, unparalleled, unrivalled, unexampled, peerless, unparagoned, without an equal.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unsuspicious, credulous, trusting, confiding.

untainted
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Pure, clean, wholesome, fresh, sweet, healthy.<BR><b>2. </b>Pure, uncorrupted, undefiled, unspotted, unsullied, untarnished, immaculate, unstained.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unbroken, wild, fierce.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unspotted, unsullied, unstained, unsoiled, spotless, clean, unblemished.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Unmanageable (<i>from size</i> or <i>weight</i>), ponderous, bulky, weighty, heavy, clumsy, large.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Spiritual minded.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Inflexible, constant, steady, resolute, steadfast, stanch, pertinacious, determined, indomitable.<BR><b>2. </b>Stubborn, stiff, obstinate, wilful, headstrong, intractable, perverse, wayward.<BR><b>3. </b>Stiff, rigid, stubborn, hard, firm, unbending.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Void, empty space, vacuity.

valid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Efficacious, efficient, sound, weighty, powerful, conclusive, logical, cogent, good, just, solid, important, grave, sufficient, strong, substantial.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Having legal strength <i>or</i> force, efficacious, executed with the proper formalities, supportable by law <i>or</i> right, good in law.

vanish

vanity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Emptiness, hollowness, triviality, worthlessness, futility, unrealness, unsubstantialness, falsity, <i>vanitas vanitatum</i>.<BR><b>2. </b>Conceit, conceitedness, egotism, self conceit, self sufficiency, petty pride, self complacency, self approbation, self admiration.<BR><b>3. </b>Idle show, vain pursuit, unsubstantial enjoyment, fruitless effort, fruitless desire.

vanquish
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Conquer, defeat, overcome, subdue, subjugate, overpower, overthrow.<BR><b>2. </b>Overpower, overbear, master, crush, worst, rout, discomfit, foil, quell, put down, get the upper hand of, get the better of.<BR><b>3. </b>Confute, disprove, silence, confound.

vapid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Insipid, tasteless, flat, savorless, spiritless, stale, dead.<BR><b>2. </b>Tame, dull, meagre, jejune, languid, feeble, prosing, prosy, prosaic, insipid, spiritless, flat.

vapor
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Gaseous state (<i>of a substance ordinarily fluid</i> or <i>solid</i>), aeriform state.<BR><b>2. </b>Fume, steam, reek, exhalation, smoke, fog, mist, rack.<BR><b>3. </b>Phantom, fantasy, whim, whimsey, vagary, day dream, vain imagination, unreal fancy, dream, vision.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR>  Boast, brag, bluster, swagger, bully, <i>faire claquer son fouet</i>.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Foggy, vapory, full of vapor.<BR><b>2. </b>Unreal, unsubstantial, vain.

variable
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Changeable, mutable, shifting.<BR><b>2. </b>Inconstant, unsteady, fickle, vacillating, wavering, fluctuating, fitful, mutable, versatile, shifting.

variance
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Alteration, change of condition.<BR><b>2. </b>Disagreement, difference, discord, dissension, jarring, strife.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Law</i>.) Variation, want of conformity (<i>as between the writ and the declaration</i>, or <i>between the allegation and the proof</i>).

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Alteration, mutation, change, modification.<BR><b>2. </b>Deviation, departure, difference, diversity, discrepance, discrepancy.

<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Diversify, vary, streak, checker, dapple, figure, mark with different colors.

<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Diversity, difference.<BR><b>2. </b>Varied assortment.<BR><b>3. </b>Kind, species, class.<BR><b>4. </b>Multiplicity, multiformity, multifariousness.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Diverse, different, manifold, several, sundry, numerous, many.<BR><b>2. </b>Changeable, mutable, uncertain, unfixed.<BR><b>3. </b>Multiform, diverse, unlike each other.<BR><b>4. </b>Variegated, diversified.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lacquer.<BR><b>2. </b>Glossy appearance.<BR><b>3. </b>Outside show, gloss, cover, palliation, mitigation.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lacquer, japan, glaze.<BR><b>2. </b>Polish, adorn, decorate, garnish, gild, embellish.<BR><b>3. </b>Palliate, gloss, extenuate, excuse, glaze over, disguise.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Boisterous, furious, impetuous, vehement, turbulent, tumultuous, wild.<BR><b>2. </b>Fierce, fiery, fuming, raging, ungovernable, infuriate, passionate, high, hot.<BR><b>3. </b>Unnatural, effected by force.<BR><b>4. </b>Unjust, outrageous.<BR><b>5. </b>Sharp, severe, acute, poignant, intense, exquisite.

virago
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Female warrior, amazon.<BR><b>2. </b>Termagant, vixen, shrew, Tartar, brawler, scold, Xantippe, fury.

virile
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Of a man.<BR><b>2. </b>Manly, masculine, vigorous.

virility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Manhood, maturity.<BR><b>2. </b>Masculinity, masculineness, male energy.<BR><b>3. </b>Manliness, manly vigor, masculine force.

virtual
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Substantial, constructive, practical, essential, equivalent, implied, implicit, indirect.<BR><b>2. </b>Potential, in essence <i>or</i> effect.

virtually
<span style="color: #0000ff">adverb</span><BR>  In effect, potentially, substantially, practically, to all intents and purposes.

virtue
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Force, efficacy, power, strength, potency, energy, inherent power.<BR><b>2. </b>Natural excellence, worth, merit, value, desert.<BR><b>3. </b>Goodness (<i>that comes from self discipline</i>), uprightness, probity, integrity, rectitude, morality, worth, moral excellence.<BR><b>4. </b>Excellence, good quality.<BR><b>5. </b>Virginity, purity, female chastity.<BR><b>6. </b>Efficacy, force, power.

virtuoso
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>[It.]<BR><b>1. </b>Connoisseur, amateur, <i>dilettante</i>, man devoted to <i>virtu</i>, person skilled in the fine arts.<BR><b>2. </b>Collector of curiosities, <i>curioso</i>.

virtuous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Upright, honest, good, righteous, exemplary, worthy, excellent, blameless, morally right, equitable.<BR><b>2. </b>Chaste, modest, pure.<BR><b>3. </b>Efficacious, powerful.

virulence
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> (<i>also</i> <b>virulency</b>)<BR><b>1. </b>Poisonousness, venomousness.<BR><b>2. </b>Acrimony, malignancy, malignity, bitterness, malevolence.

virulent
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Poisonous, venomous, malignant, highly noxious.<BR><b>2. </b>Malignant, acrimonious, bitter.

virus
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Poison (<i>of a morbid nature</i>), venom.

visage
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Face, countenance, physiognomy.

viscid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Glutinous, viscous, sticky, tenacious, slabby.

viscosity
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Glutinousness, ropiness, tenacity, viscidity.<BR><b>2. </b>Glutinous substance.

viscous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Glutinous, clammy, sticky, adhesive, tenacious, viscid, ropy, sizy.

visibility
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Perceptibility, exposure to view.<BR><b>2. </b>Conspicuousness.

visible
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Perceptible, discernible, in view, in sight, to be seen, perceivable by the eye.<BR><b>2. </b>Apparent, manifest, evident, open, obvious, conspicuous, clear, plain, palpable, patent, unmistakable, noticeable, observable.

vision
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Sight, seeing.<BR><b>2. </b>Sight, faculty of seeing.<BR><b>3. </b>Appearance.<BR><b>4. </b>Apparition, ghost, spectre, phantom, phantasm, chimera, illusion, supernatural appearance.

visionary
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Imaginative, romantic, given to revery.<BR><b>2. </b>Unreal, fanciful, fancied, ideal, fantastic, imaginary, chimerical, illusory, shadowy, wild, dreamy, romantic, unsubstantial, air built.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Dreamer, enthusiast, zealot, castle builder, fanatic.

vista
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  View (<i>especially through an avenue</i>), prospect, perspective.

vital
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Essential, indispensable.<BR><b>2. </b>Necessary to life, life supporting.<BR><b>3. </b>Living, alive, having life, animate.<BR><b>4. </b>Very necessary, highly important, essential, paramount.

vitality
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Life, animation, vital power.

vitalize
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Vivify, animate, quicken, make alive, give life to, furnish with vital principle.

vitiate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Impair, spoil, deteriorate, debase, deprave, corrupt, pollute, adulterate, injure, contaminate, infect, defile, poison, render defective, make vicious.<BR><b>2. </b>Make void, destroy, cause to fail of effect.

vitreous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Glassy.

vituperate
<span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>(<i>Rare.</i>) Find fault with, scold, censure, overwhelm with abuse, abuse, vilify, revile, reproach, berate, rate, upbraid, rail at, objurgate.

vituperative
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Abusive, reproachful, scolding, scurrilous, opprobrious, condemnatory, damnatory, contemptuous, insulting.

vivacious
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Lively, sprightly, brisk, animated, spirited, gay, sportive, frolicsome, jocund, merry, cheerful, mirthful, pleasant, full of life, buxom.

vivid
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Lively, sprightly, vigorous, animated, quick, active, strong.<BR><b>2. </b>Bright, clear, lucid, lively, brilliant, intense, animated, strong.

void
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Empty, vacant.<BR><b>2. </b>Free, destitute, clear, without, wanting, devoid, lacking.<BR><b>3. </b>Unoccupied, unfilled, unsupplied.<BR><b>4. </b>Null, invalid, nugatory, ineffectual, of no effect, of no binding force.<BR><b>5. </b>Unsubstantial, vain, unreal, imaginary.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Vacuum, empty space.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Suit, leave.<BR><b>2. </b>Throw out, emit, send out, evacuate, pour out.<BR><b>3. </b>Vacate, annul, nullify, make null.

<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Of many volumes.

voluntary
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Volitional.<BR><b>2. </b>Spontaneous, free, unforced, unconstrained, without compulsion, free will.<BR><b>3. </b>Willing, from inclination.<BR><b>4. </b>Designed, intended, intentional, purposed, deliberate.<BR><b>5. </b>Optional, discretional.<BR><b>6. </b>(<i>Law.</i>) <i>adjective</i> Free, without compulsion. <i>b.</i> Gratuitous, without consideration.

waste
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Decrease, diminish, wear, corrode, use up, prey upon, wear away, consume, wear out, impair gradually, diminish by constant loss.<BR><b>2. </b>Consume (<i>foolishly</i>), spend, expend, squander, dissipate, lose, misspend, misuse, fool away, fritter away, muddle away, use prodigally.<BR><b>3. </b>Spend in vain, expend uselessly, lavish, squander, dissipate.<BR><b>4. </b>Destroy, desolate, ravage, pillage, plunder, strip, ruin, spoil, devastate, sack, devour.<BR><b>5. </b>(<i>Law.</i>) Damage, impair, injure.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Dwindle, wither, pine, perish, decay, be diminished, waste away.<BR><b>2. </b>Swale, melt (<i>as a candle</i>), sweal, consume.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>III.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR><b>1. </b>Destroyed, ruined, ravaged, spoiled, devastated, desolated, stripped, bare.<BR><b>2. </b>Dreary, dismal, forlorn.<BR><b>3. </b>Wild, uncultivated, bare, untilled, unoccupied, unimproved.<BR><b>4. </b>Worthless, refuse, valueless, useless.<BR><b>5. </b>Superfluous, exuberant.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>IV.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR><b>1. </b>Consumption, loss, diminution, decrement, expenditure, wasting, dissipation, wear and tear.<BR><b>2. </b>Squandering, prodigality, wanton destruction, loss.<BR><b>3. </b>Devastation, ravage, ruin, rapine, destruction, desolation, pillage, havoc.<BR><b>4. </b>Refuse, worthless matter, rubbish.<BR><b>5. </b>Wild, wilderness, desert, solitude, lonely place, deserted region.<BR><b>6. </b>Dreary void, expanse.

wavy
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Undulating, waving, playing to and fro.

wax
<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Cere, smear with wax.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb neuter</span><BR><b>1. </b>Increase (<i>as the moon</i>), become larger, become fuller.<BR><b>2. </b>Grow, become, come to be, get to be.

<span style="color: #ff0000"><b>I.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Bond, chain, link, tie, ligature.<BR><b>2. </b>Bondage, servitude, service, dependence, subjection, thraldom, vassalage.<BR><span style="color: #ff0000"><b>II.</b></span> <span style="color: #0000ff">verb active</span><BR>  Join, couple, link, interlink, conjoin, connect, associate.

zeal
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Ardor, eagerness, engagedness, fervor, fervency, warmth, glow, feeling, energy, earnestness, devotedness, devotion, intentness, intensity, heartiness, cordiality, enthusiasm, passion, soul, spirit.

zealot
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Fanatic, bigot.<BR><b>2. </b>Enthusiast, visionary, dreamer.

zealous
<span style="color: #0000ff">adjective</span><BR>  Ardent, eager, keen, earnest, fervent, fervid, warm, glowing, burning, fiery, passionate, enthusiastic, devoted, swift, prompt, ready, forward.

zenith
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR>  Summit, top, apex, pinnacle, acme, utmost height, highest point, culminating point.

zephyr
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>West wind.<BR><b>2. </b>(<i>Poetical.</i>) Gentle, mild, <i>or</i> soft breeze; light wind.

zest
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>Relish, gust, gusto, appetite.<BR><b>2. </b>Relish, flavor, savor, taste, smack, twang.<BR><b>3. </b>Relish, appetizer, sauce.

zone
<span style="color: #0000ff">noun</span><BR> <b>1. </b>(<i>Poetical.</i>) Belt, girdle, cincture, girth, baldric, band.<BR><b>2. </b>Region, clime, climate.<BR><b>3. </b>(<i>Geometry</i>) Surface bounded by parallel circles (<i>on a sphere</i>), belt.
